original: de'i phyir rnam par grol ba ni mos pa kho na yin par ma zad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par grol ba ni mos pa kho na yin par ma zad do //
translated: Therefore, liberation is not just aspiration.

original: gzhan dag na re /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re /
translated: Others say:

original: gang gi phyir 'dod chags las sems 'dod chags dang bral zhing rnam par grol ba zhes bya ba nas yongs su ma rdzogs pa'i rnam par grol ba zhes bya ba'i bar rgyas par 'byung ba de'i phyir 'dir rnam par grol ba mos pa kho nar ma zad do
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'dod chags las sems 'dod chags dang bral zhing rnam par grol ba zhes bya ba nas yongs su ma rdzogs pa'i rnam par grol ba zhes bya ba'i bar rgyas par 'byung ba de'i phyir 'dir rnam par grol ba mos pa kho nar ma zad do
translated: Because it is said that the mind is free from attachment due to detachment from attachment, and so on, up to the mind is fully liberated due to full liberation, and the mind is not fully liberated due to not being fully liberated, therefore, here liberation is not just resolute belief.

original: zhes bya bar shes so zhes zer ro //
analyzed: zhes bya bar shes so zhes zer ro //
translated: One should understand it in this way.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What is it?

original: de kho na shes pas zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: de kho na shes pas zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: It is the knowledge of thatness, etc.

original: sems dri ma med pa nyid ni zag pa med pa nyid dang don gzhan ma yin par gyur pa mar gyi snying khu dang ba lta bu yin no //
analyzed: sems dri ma med pa nyid ni zag pa med pa nyid dang don gzhan ma yin par gyur pa mar gyi snying khu dang ba lta bu yin no //
translated: The mind free from contaminants is nothing other than the state of being free from contaminants, like pure butter.

original: yang dag pa'i lta ba las tha dad pa'i shes pa mi slob pa'i yan lag nyid du rnam par gzhag pas yang dag pa'i shes pa gang zhig ce na zhes bya ba dri ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lta ba las tha dad pa'i shes pa mi slob pa'i yan lag nyid du rnam par gzhag pas yang dag pa'i shes pa gang zhig ce na zhes bya ba dri ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
translated: Since knowledge is posited as a branch of no more learning that is distinct from right view, the question arises, What is right knowledge?

original: mi slob sems ni skye bar 'gyur zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: mi slob sems ni skye bar 'gyur zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: The mind of no more learning arises.

original: ma 'ongs pa dang skye bar 'gyur ba la tha dad ci zhig yod /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa dang skye bar 'gyur ba la tha dad ci zhig yod /
translated: What is the difference between the future and that which is in the process of arising?

original: skye bar 'gyur ba smos pa kho nas rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: skye bar 'gyur ba smos pa kho nas rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhe na ma yin te /
translated: Because it is understood merely by the mention of that which is in the process of arising.

original: dri ba dang mthun pa'i lan 'debs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dri ba dang mthun pa'i lan 'debs pa'i phyir /
translated: No, because the reply accords with the question.

original: ci 'das pa'am zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i dri ba dang rjes su mthun par ma 'ongs pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: ci 'das pa'am zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i dri ba dang rjes su mthun par ma 'ongs pa zhes brjod do //
translated: In accordance with the question, ‚ÄúIs it the past, etc.?‚Äù the reply is, ‚ÄúIt is the future.‚Äù

original: de yang skye bzhin pa dang skye bzhin ma yin pas de'i phyir skye bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de yang skye bzhin pa dang skye bzhin ma yin pas de'i phyir skye bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Since that is both in the process of arising and not in the process of arising, he says, ‚Äúthat which is in the process of arising.‚Äù

original: skye bzhin pa rnam par grol zhes bshad na da ltar ba kha cig kyang skye bzhin pa yin pas de gsal ba'i phyir ma 'ongs pa smos so //
analyzed: skye bzhin pa rnam par grol zhes bshad na da ltar ba kha cig kyang skye bzhin pa yin pas de gsal ba'i phyir ma 'ongs pa smos so //
translated: If it is explained that that which is in the process of arising is liberated, then some of the present is also in the process of arising, so the future is mentioned in order to clarify that.

original: ma 'ongs pa ni 'dir skye bzhin pa da ltar byung ba yin te /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa ni 'dir skye bzhin pa da ltar byung ba yin te /
translated: Here, that which is in the process of arising is the future.

original: ma 'ongs pa thams cad rnam par grol ba rgyud rnam par grol ba'i skyed chos skyed pa'i dus su rnam par grol ba ste /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa thams cad rnam par grol ba rgyud rnam par grol ba'i skyed chos skyed pa'i dus su rnam par grol ba ste /
translated: All future states are liberated when the time of the arising of the liberated dharmas of the liberated mindstream arrives.

original: 'di'i rnam pa bstan pa'i phyir ma 'ongs pa skye bzhin pa zhes smos so kha cig zer ro //
analyzed: 'di'i rnam pa bstan pa'i phyir ma 'ongs pa skye bzhin pa zhes smos so kha cig zer ro //
translated: In order to indicate its mode of activity, the root text states, ‚Äúthat which is in the process of arising in the future.‚Äù

original: tshig lhag pas don lhag par skyed do //
analyzed: tshig lhag pas don lhag par skyed do //
translated: The meaning of the phrase ‚Äúthat which is in the process of arising in the future‚Äù is that the future is generated by the power of the present.

original: sems smos pa ni gtso bo yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: sems smos pa ni gtso bo yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: The mind is mentioned because it is the principal factor.

original: sems kho nar ma zad kyi sems las byung ba rnams kyang rnam par grol bar gyur to //
analyzed: sems kho nar ma zad kyi sems las byung ba rnams kyang rnam par grol bar gyur to //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúand the mental factors‚Äù is added to indicate that not only the mind but also the mental factors are liberated.

original: yang na de dpe tsam zhig tu zad do //
analyzed: yang na de dpe tsam zhig tu zad do //
translated: Or, the mind is mentioned as an example.

original: 'o na skye bar 'gyur ba ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyi mjug thogs su 'jig rten pa de ji ltar grol @280a * //üîΩbar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na skye bar 'gyur ba ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyi mjug thogs su 'jig rten pa de ji ltar grol @280a * // bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If the phrase ‚Äúthat which is in the process of arising‚Äù refers to the mundane mind that occurs immediately after the vajra-like concentration, how can it be liberated?

original: de dag kyang grol bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dag kyang grol bar 'gyur te /
translated: It is liberated,

original: skye ba'i sgrib pa mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba'i sgrib pa mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is equal to the obscurations that are to be abandoned by the path of cultivation.

original: skye bar nges ba gang yin pa de kho na bshad do //
analyzed: skye bar nges ba gang yin pa de kho na bshad do //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthat which is in the process of arising‚Äù refers only to that which is certain to arise.

original: rnam par grol bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par grol bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúis liberated‚Äù is supplied.

original: cung zad nges par skye ba nyid kyis kyang 'jig rten pa'i nyon mongs pa rgyas pa'i phyir rnam par grol ba mi srid par 'dri ba ni /
analyzed: cung zad nges par skye ba nyid kyis kyang 'jig rten pa'i nyon mongs pa rgyas pa'i phyir rnam par grol ba mi srid par 'dri ba ni /
translated: Since birth definitely occurs even a little, it is impossible to be liberated because mundane afflictions increase.

original: gang las 'jig rten pa rnam par grol bar 'gyur zhe na zhes bya ba 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gang las 'jig rten pa rnam par grol bar 'gyur zhe na zhes bya ba 'byung ngo //
translated: From what is mundane beings liberated?

original: skye ba'i sgrib pa nyid las so zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: skye ba'i sgrib pa nyid las so zhes bya ba ni /
translated: From the obscuration of birth itself.

original: 'jig rten pa'i nyon mongs pa'i thob pa dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i nyon mongs pa'i thob pa dang ldan pa ste /
translated: One who possesses the obtainment of mundane afflictions

original: nyon mongs pa'i thob pa sgrib pa yin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i thob pa sgrib pa yin no //
translated: is obscured by the obtainment of afflictions.üîΩOne who is not liberated

original: ma grol ba yang zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa'i nyon mongs pa'i thob pa dang 'gal bar ston pa'o //
analyzed: ma grol ba yang zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa'i nyon mongs pa'i thob pa dang 'gal bar ston pa'o //
translated: is taught to be incompatible with the obtainment of mundane afflictions.

original: de ni de dang mi 'dra'o zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: de ni de dang mi 'dra'o zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: That is not similar to this.üîΩThis is stated in response to the question, ‚ÄúWhat is birth that is not liberated?‚Äù

original: 'di skad du ma grol ba la skye ba gang yin pa de ni nyon mongs pa'i thob pa dang mi 'gal te /
analyzed: 'di skad du ma grol ba la skye ba gang yin pa de ni nyon mongs pa'i thob pa dang mi 'gal te /
translated: Birth that is not liberated is birth that is not incompatible with the obtainment of afflictions.

original: rgyud de dang mthun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyud de dang mthun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is compatible with that continuum.

original: mi slob pa'i rgyud ni nyon mongs pa'i thob pa ma lus pa dang bral bas de'i rgyud las skyes pa dge ba ni nyon mongs pa'i thob pa lhan cig mi skye ste /
analyzed: mi slob pa'i rgyud ni nyon mongs pa'i thob pa ma lus pa dang bral bas de'i rgyud las skyes pa dge ba ni nyon mongs pa'i thob pa lhan cig mi skye ste /
translated: The continuum of one beyond training is free from all obtainment of affliction. Therefore, virtue arising from that continuum does not simultaneously arise with the obtainment of affliction.

original: de'i phyir mi slob pa'i rgyud la skyes pa ni 'jig rten pa yin yang nyon mongs pa'i thob pa nyid las rnam par grol bar bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir mi slob pa'i rgyud la skyes pa ni 'jig rten pa yin yang nyon mongs pa'i thob pa nyid las rnam par grol bar bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, though virtue arising in the continuum of one beyond training is mundane, it is taught to be liberated from the obtainment of affliction.

original: 'gag par 'gyur ba'i lam gyis ni //
analyzed: 'gag par 'gyur ba'i lam gyis ni //
translated: The path that will cease

original: de yi sgrib pa rab tu spong //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de yi sgrib pa rab tu spong // zhes bya ba la /
translated: completely abandons its obscurations.

original: da ltar ba ni rga ba dang mi rtag pa'i byed pa bltos nas 'gag par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba'o zhes bya ba'i sgra ni 'gag par 'gyur ba kho na zhes nges par gzung bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: da ltar ba ni rga ba dang mi rtag pa'i byed pa bltos nas 'gag par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba'o zhes bya ba'i sgra ni 'gag par 'gyur ba kho na zhes nges par gzung bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The present is called that which will cease in dependence on the activity of aging and impermanence. The word ‚Äúonly‚Äù is stated to ascertain that it is only that which will cease.

original: ji ltar skye bar 'gyur ba dang skyes pa'i lam gyis rnam par grol ba ma yin pa de ltar 'gag par 'gyur ba dang 'gag par 'gyur ba ma yin pa'i lam gyis de'i sgrib pa rab tu spong ngo zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar skye bar 'gyur ba dang skyes pa'i lam gyis rnam par grol ba ma yin pa de ltar 'gag par 'gyur ba dang 'gag par 'gyur ba ma yin pa'i lam gyis de'i sgrib pa rab tu spong ngo zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: Just as one is not liberated by the path that arises or has arisen, so too one does not abandon its obscurations by the path that is ceasing or has ceased.

original: gal te 'gag par 'gyur ba'i lam gyis de'i sgrib pa mi spong na ni /
analyzed: gal te 'gag par 'gyur ba'i lam gyis de'i sgrib pa mi spong na ni /
translated: If one does not abandon the obscurations of that path by the path that is ceasing,

original: ji ltar skye bzhin pa rnam par grol bzhin pa dang de ma thag tu rnam par grol bar 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar skye bzhin pa rnam par grol bzhin pa dang de ma thag tu rnam par grol bar 'gyur /
translated: how is one liberated when one is in the process of arising, or immediately after arising?

original: 'o na gang skye bzhin pa ma yin pas ji ltar de rnam par grol bar byed ce na /
analyzed: 'o na gang skye bzhin pa ma yin pas ji ltar de rnam par grol bar byed ce na /
translated: But if one is not in the process of arising, how can one be liberated?

original: 'di ni sgrib pa mtshungs pa'i phyir zhes bshad do //
analyzed: 'di ni sgrib pa mtshungs pa'i phyir zhes bshad do //
translated: This is explained as being due to the similarity of the obscurations.

original: rnam par grol ba 'dus ma byas su bshad pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rnam par grol ba 'dus ma byas su bshad pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: That which was explained as unconditioned liberation

original: nyon mongs bcom pa @280b 'dus ma byas //
analyzed: nyon mongs bcom pa @280b 'dus ma byas //
translated: is the destruction of the defilements.

original: zhes bya'o // khams gsum po 'byung ba zhes bya ba la gang nas 'byung zhe na mdo dag las so //
analyzed: zhes bya'o // khams gsum po 'byung ba zhes bya ba la gang nas 'byung zhe na mdo dag las so //
translated: The three realms are called ‚Äúarising‚Äù in the sutras.

original: de nyid ston pa ni spangs pa'i khams dang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid ston pa ni spangs pa'i khams dang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba'o //

original: 'dus ma byas nyid khams zhes bya //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas nyid khams zhes bya //
translated: The element of nonarising is called the element.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'dus ma byas kyi rnam par grol ba dang / khams gsum la khyad par 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'dus ma byas kyi rnam par grol ba dang / khams gsum la khyad par 'ga' yang med do //
translated: There is no difference between the element of nonarising and the element of liberation.

original: gang gi phyir 'dus ma byas kyi rnam par grol ba de nyid khams gsum yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'dus ma byas kyi rnam par grol ba de nyid khams gsum yin no //
translated: The element of nonarising is the element of liberation.

original: yang khams rnams rnam par grol ba'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir /üîΩkhyad par du ji ltar phan tshun gyi sgo nas tha dad pa nyid du brtag pa'i khyad par la bltos te 'di dag khams gzhan nyid yin gyi rdzas kyi sgo nas ma yin te /
analyzed: yang khams rnams rnam par grol ba'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir / khyad par du ji ltar phan tshun gyi sgo nas tha dad pa nyid du brtag pa'i khyad par la bltos te 'di dag khams gzhan nyid yin gyi rdzas kyi sgo nas ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, the elements are the nature of liberation.

original: thams cad rnam par grol ba'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad rnam par grol ba'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, they are different elements in the sense of being mutually dependent, but not in the sense of being substantial entities, because they are all the nature of liberation.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir de la 'dod chags kun zad chags bral zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir de la 'dod chags kun zad chags bral zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: In order to demonstrate this point, the root text states, ‚ÄúThe absence of attachment to all that is desirable is freedom from attachment.‚Äù

analyzed: khams gsum gyi 'dod chags spangs pa ni 'dod chags dang bral ba'i khams so //

original: 'dod chags las gzhan pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'dod chags las gzhan pa zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: 'dod chags ma gtogs pa'i nyon mongs pa khams gsum pa thams cad spangs pa'i khams yin no //

original: nyon mongs pa ma gtogs pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ma gtogs pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The realm of what is other than the defilements is

analyzed: kun tu sbyor bar 'gyur ba'i gzhi khams gsum pa thams cad spangs pa ni 'gog pa'i khams yin no //
translated: the abandonment of all the bases of the fetters of the three realms, with the exception of the defilements.

original: 'di lta bu 'di ga las she na /
analyzed: 'di lta bu 'di ga las she na /

original: 'dod chags dang ldan pa dang / nyon mongs pa lhag ma dang ldan pas zag dang bcas pa'i dngos po dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang ldan pa dang / nyon mongs pa lhag ma dang ldan pas zag dang bcas pa'i dngos po dang ldan pa ste /
translated: One who is endowed with attachment is endowed with all the impure things, as well as with the remaining defilements.

analyzed: de'i phyir rim pa bzhin du 'dod chags dang bral ba'i spangs pa dang 'gog pa'i khams rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Therefore, the realms of detachment and cessation are respectively established as the abandonment of attachment and of the defilements.

original: gzhan dag na re /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re /

analyzed: sred pa la dmigs pa'i sred pa spangs pa ni 'dod chags dang bral ba'i khams so //
translated: The realm of detachment is the abandonment of the craving that is focused on craving.

original: nyon mongs pa lhag ma la dmigs pa'i sred pa spangs pa ni spangs pa'i khams so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa lhag ma la dmigs pa'i sred pa spangs pa ni spangs pa'i khams so //

analyzed: sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung la bzod pa dang shes pa rnams kho nas yid 'byung bar 'gyur te / yid 'byung @281a * //

original: ba'i dngos po la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ba'i dngos po la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //

original: gzhan dag gis ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni 'gog pa dang lam la bzod pa dang shes pa dag gis ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan dag gis ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni 'gog pa dang lam la bzod pa dang shes pa dag gis ma yin te /

analyzed: mchog tu dga' ba'i dngos po la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //

original: kun gyis 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur ba ni /
analyzed: kun gyis 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur ba ni /
translated: One becomes detached through all of them.

analyzed: de bzhin du bsgoms pa'i lam la yang sbyor ba dang rnam par grol ba dang khyad par gyi lam gyis bsdus pa sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba shes pa dag gis yid 'byung ba dang 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur ro //

analyzed: the tshom spangs pa'i shes rab la ni shes pa zhes bya ba yin pas bzod pa rnams ni shes pa ma yin no //

analyzed: shes pa @282b 'di ma yin no zhes bya ba'i rig pa tha dad pa med pas zag pa dang bcas pa rnams ma yin no //

original: dri med ces bya ba la /
analyzed: dri med ces bya ba la /

analyzed: dri ma ni rjes su 'brel pa dri ma dang bcas pa zhes bya ba'o //

analyzed: thams cad kyang shes rab dang shes pa dang lta ba dang rig pa ste lta ba'i rang bzhin shes rab dang shes pa'i rang bzhin las byed pa nyid du gnas so //
translated: All of them are wisdom, knowledge, views, and insight. The nature of views is wisdom and the nature of knowledge is insight.

analyzed: de'i phyir rig pa gang gis spang bar bya ba the tshom gyi phra rgyas de spangs pa las zag pa med pa'i shes rab ste /

original: de bzhin du /

translated: Intention is the clear intention.

original: rtogs pa dang bcas pa'i bsam pa dang rtog pa med pa'i bsam pa de bzhin du @283a * //
analyzed: rtogs pa dang bcas pa'i bsam pa dang rtog pa med pa'i bsam pa de bzhin du @283a * //
translated: Just as there is an intention with understanding and an intention without understanding,

original: yongs su tshol ba'i bsam pa yang shes par bya'o //
analyzed: yongs su tshol ba'i bsam pa yang shes par bya'o //
translated: so too should the intention to investigate be understood.

original: zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa dag kyang de dag la bsam pa gcig yin par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa dag kyang de dag la bsam pa gcig yin par mi 'gyur te /
translated: The knowledge of elimination and the knowledge of non-arising also do not have the same intention,

original: so sor 'jug pa'i bsam pa yin pa'i phyir dang / sbyor ba lhod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: so sor 'jug pa'i bsam pa yin pa'i phyir dang / sbyor ba lhod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they have separate intentions and because their application is relaxed.

original: de'i phyir yongs su tshol ba'i bsam pa rtsom pa nyid las lta ba'i rang bzhin dag la ji srid 'di bya ba ma byas pa de srid du sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i bden pa rnams la nye bar rtogs par byed yongs su rtogs par byed do //
analyzed: de'i phyir yongs su tshol ba'i bsam pa rtsom pa nyid las lta ba'i rang bzhin dag la ji srid 'di bya ba ma byas pa de srid du sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i bden pa rnams la nye bar rtogs par byed yongs su rtogs par byed do //
translated: Therefore, the intention to investigate is the very beginning of the performance of action. As long as one has not performed that action, one investigates and fully understands the truths of suffering, etc.

original: ji skad bshad pa'i rnam pas bya ba byas pa na yang ji ltar lta ba rnams dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams la so sor rtog pa tsam las de dag tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa'i rnam pas bya ba byas pa na yang ji ltar lta ba rnams dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams la so sor rtog pa tsam las de dag tu 'gyur ro //
translated: When one has performed the action in the manner explained, one then fully understands the truths of suffering, etc., by merely discriminating the truths of the noble ones, such as suffering, etc., and the views.

original: rtog par byed pa dang yongs su tshol bas bdag gi sdug bsngal yongs su tshol bas bdag gi sdug bsngal yongs su shes pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rtog par byed pa dang yongs su tshol bas bdag gi sdug bsngal yongs su tshol bas bdag gi sdug bsngal yongs su shes pa ma yin no //
translated: One does not fully understand one's own suffering by investigating and fully understanding one's own suffering.

original: yang yongs su shes par bya ba de lta bu'i rnam pas de'i rjes la thob pa de dag gi mjug thogs su skye'o zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: yang yongs su shes par bya ba de lta bu'i rnam pas de'i rjes la thob pa de dag gi mjug thogs su skye'o zhe na ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, that which is to be fully understood is not immediately produced in that manner, after that investigation and full understanding.

original: de dag lta ba'i rang bzhin shes pa la nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag lta ba'i rang bzhin shes pa la nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are certain that they know the nature of the view.

original: bzod pa dang zad pa shes pa las gzhan pa zag pa med pa'i shes rab dang lta ba dang shes pa yang yin no //
analyzed: bzod pa dang zad pa shes pa las gzhan pa zag pa med pa'i shes rab dang lta ba dang shes pa yang yin no //
translated: The others are both knowledge and view.

original: yang ci gzhan slob pa dang mi slob pa'i shes pa brgyad rnams kyang mi slob pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba yin /
analyzed: yang ci gzhan slob pa dang mi slob pa'i shes pa brgyad rnams kyang mi slob pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba yin /
translated: Do the other eight knowledges of those in training and beyond training also constitute right view beyond training?

original: bar chad med pa'i lam thams cad rang gi gnyen po nyon mongs pa thob pa rjes su 'brel pa'i rgyud la skye ba ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: bar chad med pa'i lam thams cad rang gi gnyen po nyon mongs pa thob pa rjes su 'brel pa'i rgyud la skye ba ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: Don't all uninterrupted paths arise in a continuum that is related to the obtainment of the antidotes that abandon their respective objects to be abandoned?

original: yongs su tshol ba'i bsam pa rtsom pa dang rnam par grol ba'i lam thams cad de las bzlog pas /
analyzed: yongs su tshol ba'i bsam pa rtsom pa dang rnam par grol ba'i lam thams cad de las bzlog pas /
translated: The intention to investigate is not initiated and all liberated paths are the opposite of that.

original: bzod pa dang zad pa dang mi skye bshes pa ma gtogs gzhan zag pa med pa'i shes rab ni gnyi ga ltar yang mi rigs so //
analyzed: bzod pa dang zad pa dang mi skye bshes pa ma gtogs gzhan zag pa med pa'i shes rab ni gnyi ga ltar yang mi rigs so //
translated: Therefore, with the exception of the knowledge of elimination and the knowledge of nonarising, other uncontaminated wisdom is not suitable as either.

original: 'di spangs pa la the tshom rnams med de /
analyzed: 'di spangs pa la the tshom rnams med de /
translated: There is no doubt about the abandonment of this.

original: bar chad med pa'i lam gyis bskyed pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / de dag kyang lta ba'i sder shes par bya ba'i yul nyid kyi phyir de las tha dad pa'i zag pa med pa'i shes rab ni nges par rtogs pa'i phyir dang nges pa'i phyir gnyi ga ji lta bar sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: bar chad med pa'i lam gyis bskyed pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / de dag kyang lta ba'i sder shes par bya ba'i yul nyid kyi phyir de las tha dad pa'i zag pa med pa'i shes rab ni nges par rtogs pa'i phyir dang nges pa'i phyir gnyi ga ji lta bar sgrub par byed do //
translated: because they are generated by the uninterrupted path, and because they are the objects of knowledge that are to be known by the philosophical schools.

original: 'di dag ni re zhig zag pa med pa'i shes rab kho na'i rnam par dbye ba'o //
analyzed: 'di dag ni re zhig zag pa med pa'i shes rab kho na'i rnam par dbye ba'o //
translated: These are the divisions of uncontaminated wisdom alone.

original: gzhan shes zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gzhan shes zhes bya ba la /
translated: The others are knowledge.

original: 'jig rten pa'i @283b shes rab thams cad shes pa yin pa 'di ni phyir gtong ba yin la /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i @283b shes rab thams cad shes pa yin pa 'di ni phyir gtong ba yin la /
translated: All mundane wisdom is knowledge.

original: phyir btang ba 'di'i dmigs kyis bsal ba brtsam pa ni /
analyzed: phyir btang ba 'di'i dmigs kyis bsal ba brtsam pa ni /
translated: The exception to this general rule is stated

original: drug ni lta ba'ang yin zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
analyzed: drug ni lta ba'ang yin zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
translated: in the line ‚ÄúSix are also view.‚Äù

original: 'ang ba zhes bya ba'i sgras ni shes pa'ang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'ang ba zhes bya ba'i sgras ni shes pa'ang yin pa'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù indicates that they are knowledge as well.

original: lta ba lnga zhes bya ba ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa'o ;
analyzed: lta ba lnga zhes bya ba ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa'o ;
translated: The five views are the afflicted view of the self, and so on.

original: /'jig rten pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: /'jig rten pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The so-called ‚Äúcorrect view of the world‚Äù is as follows.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu la sogs pa dag la yod par lta ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu la sogs pa dag la yod par lta ba'o //
translated: The so-called mundane right view is the view that cause and effect, etc. exist.

original: gzhan lta ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzhan lta ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The so-called other view is

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga dang lhan cig skyes pa dang lung du ma bstan pa'o ;
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga dang lhan cig skyes pa dang lung du ma bstan pa'o ;
translated: the five groups of consciousness that are associated with attachment, etc., and are co-arisen and indeterminate.

original: /'di dang gzhan dag kyang shes pa ni yin no zhes bya ba la 'di zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: /'di dang gzhan dag kyang shes pa ni yin no zhes bya ba la 'di zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Both this and the other are knowledge.

original: drug ni lta ba'ang yin zhes bshad pa gang yin pa dag go //
analyzed: drug ni lta ba'ang yin zhes bshad pa gang yin pa dag go //
translated: The so-called this refers to the six that were explained as being both view and knowledge.

original: 'di'i mdor bsdus pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'di'i mdor bsdus pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The summary of this is as follows.

original: 'jig rten pa'i shes rab rnam pa drug ni lta ba dang shes pa yin la /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i shes rab rnam pa drug ni lta ba dang shes pa yin la /
translated: The six types of mundane wisdom are both view and knowledge.

original: de las gzhan pa'i 'jig rten pa thams cad ni shes pa kho na yin gyi lta ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i 'jig rten pa thams cad ni shes pa kho na yin gyi lta ba ma yin te /
translated: All other mundane wisdom is only knowledge and not view.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: yang dag par rtog pa'i rnam par ma zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag par rtog pa'i rnam par ma zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it does not enter into correct conception.

original: ci'i phyir shes rab bzhin the tshom dang bcas pa yin yang shes pa nyid du bshad ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir shes rab bzhin the tshom dang bcas pa yin yang shes pa nyid du bshad ce na /
translated: Why is it called knowledge, even though it is associated with doubt?

original: 'dir bshad pa'i rgyu de spang bya yin pa'i phyir the tshom gyi phra rgyas so zhes rgyas par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa'i rgyu de spang bya yin pa'i phyir the tshom gyi phra rgyas so zhes rgyas par 'byung ngo //
translated: The root text says, ‚ÄúBecause it is the cause of the explanation, it is the negative tendency of doubt.‚Äù

original: kha cig na re lus dang ngag gi rnam par rig byed kyis kun nas bslang ba'i rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lngas bsdus pa'i yid kyi sa pa 'chi ba'i mtha' can gyi dge ba shes rab dang lta ba ma yin pa zhes brjod de /
analyzed: kha cig na re lus dang ngag gi rnam par rig byed kyis kun nas bslang ba'i rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lngas bsdus pa'i yid kyi sa pa 'chi ba'i mtha' can gyi dge ba shes rab dang lta ba ma yin pa zhes brjod de /
translated: Some say: It is a virtuous mental faculty that is included in the five collections of consciousness, is motivated by the informative form of body and speech, and is terminated by death. It is called wisdom and view.

original: kha phyir bltas te 'jug pa'i phyir dang rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir dang / nyam chung ba'i phyir rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga bzhin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: kha phyir bltas te 'jug pa'i phyir dang rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir dang / nyam chung ba'i phyir rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga bzhin no zhes zer ro //
translated: It is like the five collections of consciousness because it engages external objects, it is nonconceptual, and it is weak.

original: gzhan dag na re 'di ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re 'di ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: Others say: This is not so.

original: so sor mi shes pas gcig tu ma nges pa'i phyir dang 'di so sor mi shes pas kha nang du phyogs te 'dug pa kho na lta bu ste gzhan ni lta ba ma yin no //
analyzed: so sor mi shes pas gcig tu ma nges pa'i phyir dang 'di so sor mi shes pas kha nang du phyogs te 'dug pa kho na lta bu ste gzhan ni lta ba ma yin no //
translated: Because it is not individually cognized, it is not ascertained as one. And because it is not individually cognized, it is like that which is directed inward and remains, and not like that which is directed outward.

original: gzhan du na zag pa med pa'i lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i bdag nyid kyi shes rab lta ba ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na zag pa med pa'i lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i bdag nyid kyi shes rab lta ba ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, the wisdom which is the nature of the mindfulness of the body in the uncontaminated realm would not be seeing.

original: phyi'i lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas so zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: phyi'i lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas so zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is said, ‚ÄúHe dwells watching the body as a body externally.‚Äù

original: 'di mtha' gcig tu ma yin te /üîΩmig la sogs @284a * //
analyzed: 'di mtha' gcig tu ma yin te / mig la sogs @284a * //
translated: This is not one-sided.üîΩWhat is the nature of the eye consciousness, etc.?

original: pa'i rnam par shes pa ci 'dra bar 'gyur ba de 'dra ba yid kyi rnam par 'gyur ba ma yin na /
analyzed: pa'i rnam par shes pa ci 'dra bar 'gyur ba de 'dra ba yid kyi rnam par 'gyur ba ma yin na /
translated: If the nature of the mental consciousness is not like that,

original: 'di ltar dge ba la sogs pa dang rnam par shes pa'i tshogs rnams la mi dge ba la sogs pa yang des bsdus pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa skyed do //
analyzed: 'di ltar dge ba la sogs pa dang rnam par shes pa'i tshogs rnams la mi dge ba la sogs pa yang des bsdus pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa skyed do //
translated: then, just as the collection of consciousnesses such as the virtuous, etc., are included in the unvirtuous, etc., the mental consciousness also generates the unvirtuous, etc.

original: yang gsungs pa //
analyzed: yang gsungs pa //
translated: It is also said:

original: 'chi ba'i dus kyi dge ba'i sems dang sems las byung ba rnams thob pas yang dag pa'i lta ba dang lhan cig gyur pa zhes so //
analyzed: 'chi ba'i dus kyi dge ba'i sems dang sems las byung ba rnams thob pas yang dag pa'i lta ba dang lhan cig gyur pa zhes so //
translated: Because he obtains the wholesome thought and thoughtconcomitants at the moment of death, he is accompanied by the right view.

original: de'i phyir yid kyi sa pa'i dge ba dang shes rab thams cad lta ba yin no //üîΩshes pa bcus zhes bya ba bcu po gang gis she na /
analyzed: de'i phyir yid kyi sa pa'i dge ba dang shes rab thams cad lta ba yin no // shes pa bcus zhes bya ba bcu po gang gis she na /
translated: Consequently, all the wholesome thoughts and all the discernment of the realm of immateriality are view.

original: chos dang / rjes dang / kun rdzob dang / gzhan gyi sems dang / sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung dang / 'gog pa dang / lam dang / zad pa dang / mi skye ba shes pa dag gis so //
analyzed: chos dang / rjes dang / kun rdzob dang / gzhan gyi sems dang / sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung dang / 'gog pa dang / lam dang / zad pa dang / mi skye ba shes pa dag gis so //
translated: By ten cognitions: by the cognition of the factors, subsequent cognition, cognition of the path, cognition of cessation, cognition of exhaustion, cognition of non-arising, cognition of another‚Äôs thoughts, conventional cognition, cognition of suffering and cognition of origin.

original: brtsam pa 'di ni nges par gzung ba'i phyir yin gyi /
analyzed: brtsam pa 'di ni nges par gzung ba'i phyir yin gyi /
translated: This enumeration is exhaustive.

original: 'chi 'pho ba dang / skye ba dang / smon gnas shes pa la sogs pa gzhan dag ni 'di dag kho na'i nang du 'dus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'chi 'pho ba dang / skye ba dang / smon gnas shes pa la sogs pa gzhan dag ni 'di dag kho na'i nang du 'dus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The other cognitions, cognition of death and rebirth, cognition of aspiration, etc., are included in these ten cognitions.

original: mdor bsdus na ni /
analyzed: mdor bsdus na ni /
translated: In brief,

original: shes pa zag bcas khrag pa med //
analyzed: shes pa zag bcas khrag pa med //
translated: impure cognition is tenfold; pure cognition is sixfold.

original: ces bya ba ni nges par gzung bar bya ba'i phyir brtsam pa ste rnam par rtog pa gsum pa med phyir ro //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni nges par gzung bar bya ba'i phyir brtsam pa ste rnam par rtog pa gsum pa med phyir ro //
translated: This is the undertaking of the ascertainment, because there is no third alternative.

original: phal cher bum pa dang / snam bu dang / skyes pa dang / bud med la sogs pa kun rdzob 'dzin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: phal cher bum pa dang / snam bu dang / skyes pa dang / bud med la sogs pa kun rdzob 'dzin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
translated: For the most part, it is because it apprehends the conventional, such as pot, cloth, man, woman, etc.

original: kun rdzob ni bum pa dang snam bu dang skyes pa dang bud med la sogs pa'i dngos po tha snyad kyi yan lag tu gyur pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob ni bum pa dang snam bu dang skyes pa dang bud med la sogs pa'i dngos po tha snyad kyi yan lag tu gyur pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The conventional is that which is a part of the conventional expressions, such as pot, cloth, man, woman, etc.

original: bum pa dang snam bu dang bud med dang skyes pa la sogs pa don du ma'i sgo nas yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bum pa dang snam bu dang bud med dang skyes pa la sogs pa don du ma'i sgo nas yod pa ma yin no //
translated: A pot, cloth, woman, man, etc. do not exist in the sense of being many things.

original: de la srid pa ni kun rdzob kyi rjes su yod pa'i yul te 'di yod pas don dam pa dang rjes su mthun pa'o //
analyzed: de la srid pa ni kun rdzob kyi rjes su yod pa'i yul te 'di yod pas don dam pa dang rjes su mthun pa'o //
translated: Therein, existence is the object that follows the conventional, because of the existence of this, it is in conformity with the ultimate.

original: de ltar mang ba nyid du ston pa ni phal cher smos pas ston par byed do //
analyzed: de ltar mang ba nyid du ston pa ni phal cher smos pas ston par byed do //
translated: Thus, the teaching of the many is taught by the expression for the most part.

original: gzhan dag na re sgrib par byed pa'i kun rdzob shes pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re sgrib par byed pa'i kun rdzob shes pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Others say that it is the conventional that obscures, and that is the meaning of the expression conventional knowledge.

original: des rgyas par byed pa'i shes pa ni kun rdzob shes pa ste /
analyzed: des rgyas par byed pa'i shes pa ni kun rdzob shes pa ste /
translated: Conventional knowledge is the knowledge that extends to that.

original: de nyid kyi phyir don dam pa dang rjes su mthun pa nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa shes pa ni kun rdzob shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir don dam pa dang rjes su mthun pa nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa shes pa ni kun rdzob shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, knowledge that is compatible with the ultimate is called conventional knowledge.

original: gzhan dag na re kun ni mtha' dag dang rdzob pa ni blo gros so zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re kun ni mtha' dag dang rdzob pa ni blo gros so zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say: ‚ÄúAll‚Äù means the entirety and ‚Äúconventional‚Äù means the intellect.

original: gzhan dag na re gzugs la sogs pa dang bum pa la @284b sogs pa la blo 'jug pa dang phal cher la rtogs bya dang / rtogs byed kyi rgyur gyur shes pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re gzugs la sogs pa dang bum pa la @284b sogs pa la blo 'jug pa dang phal cher la rtogs bya dang / rtogs byed kyi rgyur gyur shes pa'o //
translated: Others say: ‚ÄúConventional‚Äù is knowledge that is the cause of engaging the intellect in form and so on and in pots and so forth, and it is the cause of engaging the object to be comprehended and the comprehender.

original: de'i phyir kun rdzob shes pa'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir kun rdzob shes pa'o zhes zer ro //
translated: Therefore it is called conventional knowledge.

original: gzhan dag ni thog ma med pa'i 'khor ba nas 'di rgyud la 'jug pas na rgyud shes pa zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni thog ma med pa'i 'khor ba nas 'di rgyud la 'jug pas na rgyud shes pa zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say: It is called conventional knowledge because it engages the continuum of mind since beginningless samsara.

original: zag med rnam gnyis zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zag med rnam gnyis zhes bya ba la /
translated: Two are uncontaminated.

original: rjes su shes pa la ni 'ga' zhig rjes su dpag pa shes pa zhes zer ro //
analyzed: rjes su shes pa la ni 'ga' zhig rjes su dpag pa shes pa zhes zer ro //
translated: Some say: Subsequent knowledge is knowledge that is an inference.

original: de yang de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang de lta ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: mthong bar gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthong bar gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is said that one sees them.

original: rjes su dpag pa la ni mthong ba zhes bya ba sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung dag ma mthong ba'i bdag nyid du zhes mthong bar khyad par med par gsungs pas so //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa la ni mthong ba zhes bya ba sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung dag ma mthong ba'i bdag nyid du zhes mthong bar khyad par med par gsungs pas so //
translated: In inference, one sees without distinction, as it says, ‚ÄúOne sees suffering and origination without seeing them.‚Äù

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po rnams yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin mthong ba'i phyir bden pa de rnams mthong ba de lta bu la sogs pa 'gog pa la dmigs pa'i ngo bor thal ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po rnams yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin mthong ba'i phyir bden pa de rnams mthong ba de lta bu la sogs pa 'gog pa la dmigs pa'i ngo bor thal ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one sees the four noble truths exactly as they are, there is no entailment that one sees those truths in the nature of focusing on cessation.

original: rjes su dpag pa'i shes pa rjes su shes par khas blangs pas ni 'gog pa'i yul chos shes pa 'gog par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i shes pa rjes su shes par khas blangs pas ni 'gog pa'i yul chos shes pa 'gog par 'gyur te /
translated: If one accepts that the knowledge of subsequent realization is subsequent realization, then the knowledge of cessation that has cessation as its object would be cessation,

original: mngon sum gyi phyir dang mtshungs par nges pa med par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon sum gyi phyir dang mtshungs par nges pa med par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is direct perception and because it would follow that it is not ascertained as similar.

original: rjes su dpag pa la ni mthong ba med de mtshungs par nges pas rjes su dpag pa la 'khrul pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa la ni mthong ba med de mtshungs par nges pas rjes su dpag pa la 'khrul pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In inference, there is no seeing because it is possible that inference is mistaken due to ascertaining similarity.

original: bden pa mthong ba ni 'du byed thams cad mi rtag pa dang chos thams cad bdag med pa dang mya ngan las 'das pa zhi ba'o zhes mthong ba mtshungs par nges pa yin no //
analyzed: bden pa mthong ba ni 'du byed thams cad mi rtag pa dang chos thams cad bdag med pa dang mya ngan las 'das pa zhi ba'o zhes mthong ba mtshungs par nges pa yin no //
translated: The seeing of the truth is the same in that it is the certainty that all conditioned things are impermanent, that all factors are impersonal, and that nirvana is peace.

original: de'i phyir rjes su shes pa ni rjes su dpag pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rjes su shes pa ni rjes su dpag pa yin no //
translated: Thus, subsequent cognition is inference.üîΩDirect perception is threefold, because the author of the treatise explains that it is the cognition that experiences the sense faculty.

original: mngon sum rnam pa gsum du 'dod de dbang po nyams su myong ba'i blo bshad pa'i phyir dbang po'i mngon sum ni gzugs la sogs pa'i yul reg bya'i mthar thug pa rnams so //
analyzed: mngon sum rnam pa gsum du 'dod de dbang po nyams su myong ba'i blo bshad pa'i phyir dbang po'i mngon sum ni gzugs la sogs pa'i yul reg bya'i mthar thug pa rnams so //
translated: Direct perception of the sense faculty is the sense faculties, eye, etc., up to the body sense faculty, which are the sense faculties of the five sense consciousnesses.

original: nyams su myong ba'i mngon sum ni tshor ba la sogs pa mngon du gyur pa rnams so //
analyzed: nyams su myong ba'i mngon sum ni tshor ba la sogs pa mngon du gyur pa rnams so //

original: blo'i mngon sum ni chos thams cad do //
analyzed: blo'i mngon sum ni chos thams cad do //

original: ci rigs par rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid dag gis de la gal te 'bad pas dbang po nyams su myong ba'i mngon sum dag mngon sum ma yin no //
analyzed: ci rigs par rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid dag gis de la gal te 'bad pas dbang po nyams su myong ba'i mngon sum dag mngon sum ma yin no //
translated: If one wishes, one can have direct perception of the general characteristics and the specific characteristics of these factors, respectively, by means of the sense faculties.

original: de mngon sum yin pa de lta na 'gog pa'i yul med pa chos shes pa'o //
analyzed: de mngon sum yin pa de lta na 'gog pa'i yul med pa chos shes pa'o //

original: 'on te 'di blo'i mngon sum ma yin na /
analyzed: 'on te 'di blo'i mngon sum ma yin na /
translated: But if it is the supramundane right view,

original: yin pa / 'phags pa'i rnam pa'i rjes su 'jug pa yin na /
analyzed: yin pa / 'phags pa'i rnam pa'i rjes su 'jug pa yin na /

translated: But if it is the supramundane right view, then it is the cognition of the principle of cessation.üîΩIf it is the mundane right view, then it is the cognition of the principle of the path.

analyzed: bag chag bstan pa zag pa med pa'i rnam grangs ma yin pa cig shos 'bar ba gang yin pa ni rtsva'i me bzhin no //
translated: But if it is the supramundane right view, then it is the cognition of the principle of cessation.üîΩIf it is the mundane right view, then it is the cognition of the principle of the path.üîΩBut if it is the supramundane right view, then it is the cognition of the principle of cessation.üîΩIf it is the mundane right view, then it is the cognition of the principle of the path.üîΩBut if it is the supramundane right view, then it is the cognition of the principle of cessation.

original: 'jig rten pa'i shes pa'i rjes su mngon pa'i nga (rnon po mngon par btab pa/) rgyal skye ba ma yin zhing /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i shes pa'i rjes su mngon pa'i nga (rnon po mngon par btab pa/) rgyal skye ba ma yin zhing /
translated: If it is the mundane right view, then it is the cognition of the principle of the path.üîΩBut if it is the supramundane right view, then it is the cognition of the principle of cessation.üîΩIf it is the mundane right view, then it is the cognition of the principle of the path.üîΩBut if it is the supramundane right view, then it is the cognition of the principle of cessation.üîΩIf it is the mundane right view, then it is the cognition of the principle of the path.üîΩBut if it is the supramundane right view, then it is the cognition of the principle of cessation.üîΩIf it is the mundane right view, then it is the cognition of the principle of the path.

original: zag pa med pa'i ye shes su yang ma yin pas 'di de ltar khyad par med do //üîΩde ltar shes pa 'di gnyis zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i ye shes su yang ma yin pas 'di de ltar khyad par med do // de ltar shes pa 'di gnyis zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Thus, these two types of knowledge are not different in this way.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa dag go //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa dag go //
translated: The two types of knowledge are called ‚Äúcontaminated‚Äù and ‚Äúuncontaminated.‚Äù

original: gsum du 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gsum du 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni /
translated: They become three types

original: zag pa med pa gnyis su phye ste /
analyzed: zag pa med pa gnyis su phye ste /
translated: because the uncontaminated is divided into two types:

original: chos dang rjes su shes pa'i dbye ba'o //
analyzed: chos dang rjes su shes pa'i dbye ba'o //
translated: the knowledge of the Dharma and subsequent knowledge.

original: 'di dag kyang dmigs pa'i dbye bas phye ba'o //
analyzed: 'di dag kyang dmigs pa'i dbye bas phye ba'o //
translated: These are distinguished by the distinction of their objects.

original: de la kun rdzob yul ni thams cad do zhes bya ba la ;
analyzed: de la kun rdzob yul ni thams cad do zhes bya ba la ;
translated: All objects are the domain of conventional knowledge.

original: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi chos thams cad dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi chos thams cad dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because all conditioned and unconditioned phenomena are its objects.

original: chos shes ni 'dod pa'i sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i spyod yul nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: chos shes ni 'dod pa'i sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i spyod yul nyid yin gyi /
translated: The knowledge of the Dharma has the suffering of the desire realm, etc., as its domain.

original: gong ma'i sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i spyod yul ma yin no //
analyzed: gong ma'i sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i spyod yul ma yin no //
translated: It does not have the suffering of the higher realms, etc., as its domain.

original: so sor ma brtags pa'i 'gog pa dang nam mkha' yang spyod yul ma yin no //
analyzed: so sor ma brtags pa'i 'gog pa dang nam mkha' yang spyod yul ma yin no //
translated: It also does not have the cessation not attained through mental application or space as its domain.

original: rjes su shes pa yang gong ma'i sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i spyod yul can kho na ste /
analyzed: rjes su shes pa yang gong ma'i sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i spyod yul can kho na ste /
translated: Subsequent knowledge also has the upper realms‚Äô suffering, etc., as its object field.

original: bshad ma thag pa'i spyod yul can ma yin no //
analyzed: bshad ma thag pa'i spyod yul can ma yin no //
translated: It does not have the object field that was just explained.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa'i dbye bas kyang zag pa med pa'i spyod yul ni 'dus ma byas gnyis ma yin no //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa'i dbye bas kyang zag pa med pa'i spyod yul ni 'dus ma byas gnyis ma yin no //
translated: The classification of contaminated and uncontaminated states also does not have the two unconditioned states as its object field.

original: chos dang rjes su shes pa bzhin thams cad yul ma yin no //
analyzed: chos dang rjes su shes pa bzhin thams cad yul ma yin no //
translated: Like Dharma knowledge and subsequent knowledge, it does not have all states as its object field.

original: de dag nyid bden bye brag gis bzhi ste zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de dag nyid bden bye brag gis bzhi ste zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Those two are four by the specific truths.

original: chos dang rjes su shes pa dag ni khams kyi dbye bas sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i bden pa tha dad par byas te dbye ba gsungs so //
analyzed: chos dang rjes su shes pa dag ni khams kyi dbye bas sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i bden pa tha dad par byas te dbye ba gsungs so //
translated: Dharma knowledge and subsequent knowledge are said to be classified by the different truths of suffering, etc., which are differentiated by the classification of realms.üîΩThe knowledge of suffering, etc., are classified as four by the classification of Dharma knowledge and subsequent knowledge, taking the three realms as the domain.

original: sdug bsngal la sogs pa shes pa rnams la ni chos dang rjes su shes pa'i dbye bas khams gsum pa'i dbang du byas nas sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i bden pa rnams la 'dir dbye ba sngon du 'gro bas bzhi par dbye ba bshad do //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la sogs pa shes pa rnams la ni chos dang rjes su shes pa'i dbye bas khams gsum pa'i dbang du byas nas sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i bden pa rnams la 'dir dbye ba sngon du 'gro bas bzhi par dbye ba bshad do //
translated: Here, the classification of the truths of suffering, etc., is explained as four by the prior classification.

original: de la dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal la @285b dmigs shing shes pa ni /
analyzed: de la dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal la @285b dmigs shing shes pa ni /
translated: Because it focuses on that.üîΩüîΩKnowledge focuses on suffering.

original: sdug bsngal shes pa ste de bzhin du gzhan la yang ngo //
analyzed: sdug bsngal shes pa ste de bzhin du gzhan la yang ngo //
translated: Because it focuses on that. Knowledge that focuses on and knows suffering is knowledge of suffering. The same applies to the others.

original: yang ci'i phyir zag pa dang bcas pa yang de'i rnam par sdug bsngal shes par brjod kyi sdug bsngal gyi sgo nas she na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir zag pa dang bcas pa yang de'i rnam par sdug bsngal shes par brjod kyi sdug bsngal gyi sgo nas she na /
translated: Why is it called knowledge of suffering when it is knowledge of the aspect of suffering of contaminated states, and not knowledge of suffering itself?

original: rnam pa de yang phung po lnga pa ste /
analyzed: rnam pa de yang phung po lnga pa ste /
translated: That aspect is the five aggregates.

original: yang mtha' gcig tu bde ba'i sgo nas de smos pa srid pa'i phyir //
analyzed: yang mtha' gcig tu bde ba'i sgo nas de smos pa srid pa'i phyir //
translated: It is not possible to refer to it as knowledge of pleasure, because it is not exclusively pleasure.

original: de la dmigs pa the tshom kun tu spyod pa de thob pa'i phyir rnam pa bzhi ste sdug bsngal la sogs pa bden pa bzhi la dmigs pa tha dad pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde yang dang por skyes pa ni mi bden pa la dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: de la dmigs pa the tshom kun tu spyod pa de thob pa'i phyir rnam pa bzhi ste sdug bsngal la sogs pa bden pa bzhi la dmigs pa tha dad pa'i phyir ro // de yang dang por skyes pa ni mi bden pa la dmigs pa ste /
translated: It is fourfold because it focuses on doubt that engages the four noble truths, since it focuses on the four noble truths of suffering and so on.

original: mi bden pa la dmigs pa yang rgyun la bltos nas yin no zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: mi bden pa la dmigs pa yang rgyun la bltos nas yin no zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: Moreover, it is said that doubt that focuses on the four truths is initially generated in relation to the four truths, but it is not generated in relation to the four truths that are not directly perceived.üîΩDoubt that focuses on the four truths is generated in relation to the four truths that are not directly perceived.

original: srid pa'i rtse mo pa'i phung po la sdug bsngal la kun 'byung ba rjes su shes pa'i rnam par dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: srid pa'i rtse mo pa'i phung po la sdug bsngal la kun 'byung ba rjes su shes pa'i rnam par dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because the aggregates of the summit of existence are observed in the aspect of the origin of suffering by subsequent knowledge of the origin.

original: gang gi phyir de ni thams cad kyi rjes su srid pa'i rtse mo nyid spong ba yin pas /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ni thams cad kyi rjes su srid pa'i rtse mo nyid spong ba yin pas /
translated: Because that subsequent knowledge abandons the summit of existence,

original: de'i phyir gang gis gzir ba dang gang gis bcings pa de kho na las thar pa lan mang du yid la byed pa na mjug thogs su srid pa'i rtse mo zad pa kho na la dmigs la /
analyzed: de'i phyir gang gis gzir ba dang gang gis bcings pa de kho na las thar pa lan mang du yid la byed pa na mjug thogs su srid pa'i rtse mo zad pa kho na la dmigs la /
translated: when one frequently brings to mind the liberation from that which is oppressed and bound, it immediately focuses on the mere exhaustion of the summit of existence.

original: de yang sdug bsngal lam kun 'byung ba yin te /
analyzed: de yang sdug bsngal lam kun 'byung ba yin te /
translated: And that is either suffering or origin,

original: de'i phyir srid pa'i rtse mo la sdug bsngal la kun 'byung ba'i rnam par dmigs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir srid pa'i rtse mo la sdug bsngal la kun 'byung ba'i rnam par dmigs so //
translated: therefore the summit of existence is observed in the aspect of suffering or origin.

original: rdo rje lta bu'i mjug thogs su zad pa shes pa 'byung la /
analyzed: rdo rje lta bu'i mjug thogs su zad pa shes pa 'byung la /
translated: Knowledge of elimination arises immediately after the vajra like.

original: de'i rjes la mi skye ba shes pa 'byung ba de'i phyir 'dri ba ni rdo rje lta bu la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rjes la mi skye ba shes pa 'byung ba de'i phyir 'dri ba ni rdo rje lta bu la sogs pa'o //
translated: Knowledge of nonarising arises after that. Therefore the question is about the vajra like and so on.

original: de gnyis dang zhes bya ba ni dang por skyes pa dang dang zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de gnyis dang zhes bya ba ni dang por skyes pa dang dang zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthose two‚Äù means ‚Äúfirst arisen‚Äù and ‚Äúarisen.

original: gal te sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung la dmigs na ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni /
analyzed: gal te sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung la dmigs na ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni /
translated: ‚Äù If it focuses on the truths of suffering and origin,

original: rdo rje lta bu bden pa bzhi la dmigs pa yang srid pa'i dbang du byas nas brjod pa ste /
analyzed: rdo rje lta bu bden pa bzhi la dmigs pa yang srid pa'i dbang du byas nas brjod pa ste /
translated: the vajra-like concentration may focus on the four truths, but this is said from the perspective of the possibility of rebirth.

original: de'i phyir 'di la nges pa med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di la nges pa med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no certainty in this case.

original: gzhi las pha rol sems rig pa //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gzhi las pha rol sems rig pa // zhes bya ba la /
translated: Knowledge of others‚Äô minds is from the basis.

original: gzhan gyi sems shes pa ni zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa la dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems shes pa ni zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa la dmigs pa yin no //
translated: Knowledge of others‚Äô minds focuses on contaminated and uncontaminated states.

original: de la gang zag pa dang bcas pa la dmigs pa de kun rdzob kyi shes pa ste zag pa bcas pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la gang zag pa dang bcas pa la dmigs pa de kun rdzob kyi shes pa ste zag pa bcas pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Among them, that which focuses on contaminated states is conventional knowledge because it is contaminated.

original: zag pa med pa la dmigs pa ni lam dang chos dang rjes su shes pa gsum gyi'o //
analyzed: zag pa med pa la dmigs pa ni lam dang chos dang rjes su shes pa gsum gyi'o //
translated: That which focuses on uncontaminated states is the three: knowledge of the truth of the path, knowledge of the truth of phenomena, and subsequent knowledge.

original: gal te chos dang rjes su shes pa las ma gtogs par lam @286a * //
analyzed: gal te chos dang rjes su shes pa las ma gtogs par lam @286a * //
translated: If knowledge of others‚Äô minds is excluded from knowledge of the truth of the path and knowledge of the truth of phenomena, it is subsequent knowledge.

original: shes pa yong pa ma yin pas gzhan gyi sems shes pa gsum kho na las brjod par bya ba ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: shes pa yong pa ma yin pas gzhan gyi sems shes pa gsum kho na las brjod par bya ba ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But isn't it said that the three knowledges of others' minds are not to be expressed?

original: 'di de lta yin mod kyi chos dang rjes su shes pa gang gis gzhan gyi sems dang sems las byung ba zag pa med pa shes pa de lam shes pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di de lta yin mod kyi chos dang rjes su shes pa gang gis gzhan gyi sems dang sems las byung ba zag pa med pa shes pa de lam shes pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: This is so, but it should be understood that any Dharma or subsequent knowledge that knows the uncontaminated minds and mental factors of others is knowledge of the path.

original: sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba shes pa ni ma yin no zhes gzhan gyi sems shes pa skal pa mnyam pa'i yul can nyid du shes par bya ba'i phyir de skad brjod do //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba shes pa ni ma yin no zhes gzhan gyi sems shes pa skal pa mnyam pa'i yul can nyid du shes par bya ba'i phyir de skad brjod do //
translated: It is not knowledge of suffering or origin because this is said to make it understood that knowledge of others' minds has the same realm as its object.

original: zag pa med pas zag pa bcas pa shes pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: zag pa med pas zag pa bcas pa shes pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not knowledge of contaminated states by uncontaminated knowledge.

original: 'di'i nges pa ni de yin /üîΩre zhig zag pa dang bcas pa gang yin pas zag pa med par dmigs par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di'i nges pa ni de yin / re zhig zag pa dang bcas pa gang yin pas zag pa med par dmigs par mi 'gyur te /

original: phra ba'i phyir dang mchog yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phra ba'i phyir dang mchog yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: First, contaminated states are not observed as uncontaminated because they are subtle and supreme.

original: zag pa med pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba rnams zag pa med pa la ni zag pa dang bcas pa dmigs pa yod pa ma yin pas /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba rnams zag pa med pa la ni zag pa dang bcas pa dmigs pa yod pa ma yin pas /
translated: The uncontaminated mind and mental factors do not have contaminated objects as their object, because they are uncontaminated.

original: de la rgyu cis zag pa dang bcas pa'i yul rnams zag pa med pa la rnam pa gzhan du 'jug / gang zag zag pa dang bcas pa'i dmigs pa dang zag pa med pa'i shes pa rnams ni rab ste /
analyzed: de la rgyu cis zag pa dang bcas pa'i yul rnams zag pa med pa la rnam pa gzhan du 'jug / gang zag zag pa dang bcas pa'i dmigs pa dang zag pa med pa'i shes pa rnams ni rab ste /
translated: What is the reason that contaminated objects do not become the object of the uncontaminated?üîΩThe uncontaminated object and the contaminated mind and mental factors are far apart.

original: rnam pa de dag la gang gi phyir sems dang sems las byung ba'i rang bzhin bzung ba 'jug pa byed ce na /
analyzed: rnam pa de dag la gang gi phyir sems dang sems las byung ba'i rang bzhin bzung ba 'jug pa byed ce na /

original: de ni sun 'byin pa la dga' ba'i phyir dang / 'jug pa las phyir phyogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni sun 'byin pa la dga' ba'i phyir dang / 'jug pa las phyir phyogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they delight in refuting and because they turn away from engagement.

original: yang 'phags pa rnams kyi sems dang sems las byung ba'i rdzas re res zag pa med pa shes par mi nus so //
analyzed: yang 'phags pa rnams kyi sems dang sems las byung ba'i rdzas re res zag pa med pa shes par mi nus so //
translated: Moreover, each substance of the mind and mental factors of the noble ones is not able to know the uncontaminated.

original: spyi'i sgo nas mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pas rtog par byed do //
analyzed: spyi'i sgo nas mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pas rtog par byed do //
translated: They conceive it in general through the aspects of impermanence and so on.

analyzed: rna ba 'dod pa) gnyis pa dang (dga' ba nyid 'di gzhan du na zhes so/) / gsum pa'i sa pas kyang bsam gtan gong ma'i sa pa mi shes pa'o zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: Those of the third formless realm do not know those of the higher levels.üîΩThose of the fourth formless realm do not know those of the higher levels.

original: rang gi sa 'og ma pa mi shes pas na /
analyzed: rang gi sa 'og ma pa mi shes pas na /
translated: Those of the lower level do not know those of the higher level.

original: de la 'jig rten pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba rnam pa bco lnga po dag ste sa lnga pa rnams su @286b so sor rnam pa gsum nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de la 'jig rten pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba rnam pa bco lnga po dag ste sa lnga pa rnams su @286b so sor rnam pa gsum nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: There are fifteen types of mundane minds and mental factors in the five levels, each with three types.

original: zag pa med pa rnam pa bcu gnyis te /
analyzed: zag pa med pa rnam pa bcu gnyis te /
translated: There are twelve types of uncontaminated minds.

original: bsam gtan sa bzhi po rnams las pas ma gtan so sor rnam pa gsum nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: bsam gtan sa bzhi po rnams las pas ma gtan so sor rnam pa gsum nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because each of the four absorptions has three types.

original: de las gong ma'i 'jig rten pa'i chung ngu sa ni au tsa ma ta nu rtsi te na /
analyzed: de las gong ma'i 'jig rten pa'i chung ngu sa ni au tsa ma ta nu rtsi te na /
translated: The small of the small of the higher mundane path is the small of the small of the lower mundane path.

original: gzhan gyi sems shes pas sa 'og ma pa'i rnam pa gsum shes so //
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems shes pas sa 'og ma pa'i rnam pa gsum shes so //
translated: The knowledge of others' minds knows the three types of the lower level.

original: rang gi sa pa chung ngu nyid dang 'bring gis sa 'og ma pa yang snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: rang gi sa pa chung ngu nyid dang 'bring gis sa 'og ma pa yang snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The small of the small and the medium of the small of one's own level are the same as before.

original: rang gi sa pa rnam pa gnyis kyi chen pos ni rang gi sa pa rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: rang gi sa pa rnam pa gnyis kyi chen pos ni rang gi sa pa rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: The great of the small knows the three types of one's own level.

original: zag pa med pa ni gzhan gyi sems shes pas rang gi sa pa dang / 'og ma'i yang chung ngus chung ngu dang 'bring gi chung ngu dang chen pos kyang rnam pa gsum ga shes so //
analyzed: zag pa med pa ni gzhan gyi sems shes pas rang gi sa pa dang / 'og ma'i yang chung ngus chung ngu dang 'bring gi chung ngu dang chen pos kyang rnam pa gsum ga shes so //
translated: The uncontaminated knowledge of others' minds knows the small of the small of one's own level and the lower level, the small of the medium of the small, and the great of the three types.

original: ci'i phyir yang rnam pa gzhan du zag pa dang bcas pa'i tshul las rnam pa gzhan du zag pa med pa yin na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir yang rnam pa gzhan du zag pa dang bcas pa'i tshul las rnam pa gzhan du zag pa med pa yin na /
translated: Why is the uncontaminated knowledge of others' minds different from the contaminated knowledge of others' minds?

original: gang las rgyu gcig la yang zag pa dang bcas pa rnam pa gsum yod la /
analyzed: gang las rgyu gcig la yang zag pa dang bcas pa rnam pa gsum yod la /
translated: There are three types of contaminated states that arise from a single cause.

original: zag pa med pa ni dbang po'i sgo nas rnam pa gsum rnam par bzhag pas tshul de lta rgyud gcig las rnam pa gnyis ma yin pa yang yod do //üîΩdbang po rnams kyi gsum nyid las gang zag gcig ni lam rnam pa dgu nyon mongs pa spong bar gsungs pa de'i lam gang yin pa ni rgyu la nye bar btags te mchog gi dbang du byas kyi /
analyzed: zag pa med pa ni dbang po'i sgo nas rnam pa gsum rnam par bzhag pas tshul de lta rgyud gcig las rnam pa gnyis ma yin pa yang yod do // dbang po rnams kyi gsum nyid las gang zag gcig ni lam rnam pa dgu nyon mongs pa spong bar gsungs pa de'i lam gang yin pa ni rgyu la nye bar btags te mchog gi dbang du byas kyi /
translated: Uncontaminated states are posited as three types from the perspective of faculty. Thus there are states that are not two types within a single mindstream.üîΩFrom among the three types of faculties, it is said that one person abandons the nine aspects of the truth of path through the nine stages of the path of meditation.

original: dbang po'i dbye bas ma yin no //
analyzed: dbang po'i dbye bas ma yin no //
translated: The path is designated in dependence on its cause, from the perspective of the supreme, but it is not classified by faculty.

original: bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re /
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re /
translated: Vaibhasikas say:

original: 'dir rigs thams cad rnam pa dgu yin pa de'i phyir rigs gzhan yang rnam pa dgu'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: 'dir rigs thams cad rnam pa dgu yin pa de'i phyir rigs gzhan yang rnam pa dgu'o zhes zer ro //
translated: Here all types are ninefold. Therefore other types are also ninefold.

original: dbang po 'das pa zhes bya ba ni dad pas mos pa'i lam gyis mthong bas 'ong ba'i lam mi shes shing dus kyis rnam par grol ba'i lam gyis dus dang mi sbyor bar rnam par grol ba'i lam mi shes pa ste dbang po 'das pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po 'das pa zhes bya ba ni dad pas mos pa'i lam gyis mthong bas 'ong ba'i lam mi shes shing dus kyis rnam par grol ba'i lam gyis dus dang mi sbyor bar rnam par grol ba'i lam mi shes pa ste dbang po 'das pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The path of one who is resolute in faith does not know the path of one who obtains results by insight, and the path of one liberated according to circumstances does not know the path of one liberated regardless of circumstances, because their faculties are different.

original: 'di ltar dad pas mos pa'i lam ni dbang po rtul pos bsdus shing /
analyzed: 'di ltar dad pas mos pa'i lam ni dbang po rtul pos bsdus shing /
translated: Thus, the path of one resolute in faith is included in the dull faculties,

original: mthong bas thob pa dang dus dang mi sbyor bar rnam par grol ba'i lam ni dbang po rnon pos bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: mthong bas thob pa dang dus dang mi sbyor bar rnam par grol ba'i lam ni dbang po rnon pos bsdus pa yin no //
translated: and the path of one who obtains results by insight and one liberated regardless of circumstances are included in sharp faculties.

original: 'og mas gong ma mi shes so zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'og mas gong ma mi shes so zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The lower does not know the higher.

original: phyir mi 'ong ba'i lam gyis nyan thos dgra bcom pa'i lam dang / dgra bcom pas rang sangs rgyas kyi lam dang rang sangs rgyas kyis sangs rgyas kyi lam mo //üîΩmthong @287a * //
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba'i lam gyis nyan thos dgra bcom pa'i lam dang / dgra bcom pas rang sangs rgyas kyi lam dang rang sangs rgyas kyis sangs rgyas kyi lam mo // mthong @287a * //
translated: The path of a nonreturner does not know the path of a ≈õrƒÅvaka arhat, an arhat does not know the path of a pratyekabuddha, and a pratyekabuddha does not know the path of a buddha.

original: pas thob pas dus kyis rnam par grol ba'i mi shes te gang zag 'das pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pas thob pas dus kyis rnam par grol ba'i mi shes te gang zag 'das pa'i phyir ro //
translated: One who obtains results by insight does not know one liberated according to circumstances, because the person is different.

original: dus kyis rnam par grol bas kyang mthong bas thob pa'i ste dbang po 'das pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus kyis rnam par grol bas kyang mthong bas thob pa'i ste dbang po 'das pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Also, those liberated according to circumstances do not know those who obtain results by insight, because they surpass their intellectual faculty.

original: bha ga batstshar dva too /
analyzed: bha ga batstshar dva too /
translated: The Bhagavan and the two arhats

original: bsam gtan dang po dang gnyis pa dag phan tshun mi shes te sa dang dbang po 'das pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po dang gnyis pa dag phan tshun mi shes te sa dang dbang po 'das pa'i phyir ro //
translated: do not know each other, because they surpass each other‚Äôs level and intellectual faculty.

original: dus dang mi sbyor bar rnam par grol ba dang mthong bas thob pa dag kyang bsam gtan dang po dang gnyis pa'i sa pa phan tshun mi shes bzhin te sa dang gang zag 'das (bcom ldan 'das dang shva ra dva te dag pa/) pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus dang mi sbyor bar rnam par grol ba dang mthong bas thob pa dag kyang bsam gtan dang po dang gnyis pa'i sa pa phan tshun mi shes bzhin te sa dang gang zag 'das (bcom ldan 'das dang shva ra dva te dag pa/) pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Those liberated according to circumstances and those who obtain results by insight do not know each other, because they surpass each other‚Äôs level and person.
