analyzed: da ltar gyis pha rol gyi sems yul yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Because the present is the object of the mind.

original: gang gi phyir sems kyi yul gzugs la sogs pa'i yul yin par mi 'os pa de bzhin du da ltar byung ba'i yul du 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i yul mi rung ngo //
analyzed: gang gi phyir sems kyi yul gzugs la sogs pa'i yul yin par mi 'os pa de bzhin du da ltar byung ba'i yul du 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i yul mi rung ngo //
translated: Just as the object of the mind is not suitable to be the object of form and so on, so too the present is not suitable to be the object of the past and future.

original: de gnyis ni zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de gnyis ni zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Those two

original: gzhan gyi sems shes pas chos dang rjes su shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa dag go //üîΩgnyis pa ni 'dod pa las gong ma'i khams kyi gnyen po la dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems shes pas chos dang rjes su shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa dag go // gnyis pa ni 'dod pa las gong ma'i khams kyi gnyen po la dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The cognition of another's thoughts is of the class of cognition of the factors and subsequent cognition, because it has the thought of the realm of desire and the realm of fine-materiality for its cognitive object.üîΩThe cognition of exhaustion is of the class of cognition of the factors and cognition of the path, because it has the truth of the path and the truth of cessation for its cognitive object.

original: phan tshun rgyab kyis phyogs pas phan tshun dmigs pa nyid du mi rung ngo //
analyzed: phan tshun rgyab kyis phyogs pas phan tshun dmigs pa nyid du mi rung ngo //
translated: The cognition of another's thoughts and the cognition of exhaustion are not of the class of cognition of the factors with regard to the realm of desire, for the first does not bear on the factors of the realm of desire, and the second is not of the realm of desire.

original: mthong ba'i lam la pha rol gyi sems shes pa med do zhes bya ba ni myur du 'gro ba nyid kyis sbyor ba med pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam la pha rol gyi sems shes pa med do zhes bya ba ni myur du 'gro ba nyid kyis sbyor ba med pa'i phyir la /
translated: The cognition of another's thoughts is absent in the path of insight, because the path of insight is swift and does not admit of preparatory effort.

original: de thob pa rnams la yang sbyor ba las gzhan gyi sems shes pa mngon du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //üîΩsbyor ba byas nas dang po mthong skad cig dag nyan thos kyi rigs te zhes rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: de thob pa rnams la yang sbyor ba las gzhan gyi sems shes pa mngon du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro // sbyor ba byas nas dang po mthong skad cig dag nyan thos kyi rigs te zhes rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: Even though one has obtained the cognition of another's thoughts, it is not active in the path of insight.üîΩThe cognition of another's thoughts is absent in the path of insight of the disciples and the self-enlightened ones, because this path is swift and does not admit of preparatory effort.

original: rang sangs rgyas kyis pha rol gyi sems shes pa chung ngu ni sbyor bas byed do //üîΩnyan thos kyis ni kha cig tu 'bring pos so //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyis pha rol gyi sems shes pa chung ngu ni sbyor bas byed do //üîΩnyan thos kyis ni kha cig tu 'bring pos so //
translated: The cognition of another's thoughts is absent in the path of insight of the Buddha, because this path is very swift.

original: kha cig tu chen pos so //üîΩchos shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa dang rjes su shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i sems so zhes ma bshad do //
analyzed: kha cig tu chen pos so // chos shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa dang rjes su shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i sems so zhes ma bshad do //
translated: In some places, it is called great.üîΩThe knowledge of the mind of another does not know the mind of the path of insight of the Aryan, because it does not know the mind of a higher stage, because it does not know future minds, and because it does not know the path of insight.üîΩThe knowledge of the mind of another of the realm of desire does not know the mind of the path of insight of the Aryan of the realm of fine-materiality, because it is a lower stage.üîΩThe knowledge of the mind of another of the realm of fine-materiality does not know the mind of the path of insight of the Aryan of the realm of immateriality, because it is a lower stage.

original: chos shes pa'i phyogs ma lus pas gzhan gyi sems shes pas nyan thos kyi mthong ba'i lam skad cig ma dang po gnyis kho nas shes so //üîΩda ni rjes su shes pa'i phyogs shes par bya ste /üîΩde ji srid yul phyi rol gyi sems shes pa mngon du bya ba'i phyir sbyor ba rtsom pa srid 'di sems bcu drug rjes su 'thob pa yin te /
analyzed: chos shes pa'i phyogs ma lus pas gzhan gyi sems shes pas nyan thos kyi mthong ba'i lam skad cig ma dang po gnyis kho nas shes so // da ni rjes su shes pa'i phyogs shes par bya ste / de ji srid yul phyi rol gyi sems shes pa mngon du bya ba'i phyir sbyor ba rtsom pa srid 'di sems bcu drug rjes su 'thob pa yin te /
translated: The knowledge of the mind of another of the realm of immateriality does not know the mind of the path of insight of the Aryan of the realm of desire, because it is a higher stage.üîΩThe knowledge of the mind of another of the realm of desire does not know the mind of the path of insight of the Aryan of the realm of immateriality, because it is a higher stage.üîΩThe knowledge of the mind of another of the realm of fine-materiality does not know the mind of the path of insight of the Aryan of the realm of immateriality, because it is a higher stage.

original: de'i sbyor ba ring ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i sbyor ba ring ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The knowledge of the mind of another of the realm of immateriality does not know the mind of the path of insight of the Aryan of the realm of desire, because it is a higher stage.

original: @287b de yang mthong ba'i lam ma yin no //üîΩrang sangs rgyas kyi skad cig ma gsum gyis shes te /
analyzed: @287b de yang mthong ba'i lam ma yin no // rang sangs rgyas kyi skad cig ma gsum gyis shes te /
translated: The knowledge of the mind of another of the realm of desire does not know the mind of the path of insight of the Aryan of the realm of immateriality, because it is a higher stage.

original: chos su shes pa'i phyir gyi sa dang po gnyis kyis shes shing /
analyzed: chos su shes pa'i phyir gyi sa dang po gnyis kyis shes shing /
translated: The knowledge of the mind of another of the realm of fine-materiality does not know the mind of the path of insight of the Aryan of the realm of immateriality, because it is a higher stage.üîΩThe knowledge of the mind of another of the realm of immateriality does not know the mind of the path of insight of the Aryan of the realm of desire, because it is a higher stage.üîΩThe knowledge of the mind of another of the realm of desire does not know the mind of the path of insight of the Aryan of the realm of immateriality, because it is a higher stage.üîΩThe knowledge of the mind of another of the realm of fine-materiality does not know the mind of the path of insight of the Aryan of the realm of immateriality, because it is

original: rjes su shes pa'i phyogs kyis gzhan gyi sems shes pa mngon du byas te brgyad pas shes so //
analyzed: rjes su shes pa'i phyogs kyis gzhan gyi sems shes pa mngon du byas te brgyad pas shes so //
translated: The eighth moment of subsequent knowledge of the truth of path knows the mind of another through the aspect of subsequent knowledge.

original: sbyor chung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba ring ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sbyor chung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba ring ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not distant from the path of preparation.

original: gzhan dag na re bco lngas so zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re bco lngas so zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say: It is known by fifteen moments.

original: skad cig ma lnga rnams dang bzhi rnams kyis de'i sbyor ba bsgrub par mi rigs so //
analyzed: skad cig ma lnga rnams dang bzhi rnams kyis de'i sbyor ba bsgrub par mi rigs so //
translated: It is not logical that the path of preparation is accomplished by five or four moments.

original: gzhan dag skad cig ma bzhi shes te /
analyzed: gzhan dag skad cig ma bzhi shes te /
translated: Others say: It is known by four moments.

original: dang po dang gnyis pa dang brgyad pa dang bcu bzhi pa rnams nyid kyis so zhes zer te de ltar yang rung ngo //
analyzed: dang po dang gnyis pa dang brgyad pa dang bcu bzhi pa rnams nyid kyis so zhes zer te de ltar yang rung ngo //
translated: The first, second, eighth and fourteenth moments.

original: chos shes pa'i phyogs kyis dmigs na skad cig ma lnga'i mjug thogs su'o //
analyzed: chos shes pa'i phyogs kyis dmigs na skad cig ma lnga'i mjug thogs su'o //
translated: If it is focused on by the aspect of Dharma knowledge, it is subsequent to five moments.

original: gal te rjes su shes pa'i phyogs la ni brgyad pas shes te /
analyzed: gal te rjes su shes pa'i phyogs la ni brgyad pas shes te /
translated: If it is focused on by the aspect of subsequent knowledge, it is known by eight moments.

original: de'i phyir skad cig ma lnga'i mjug thogs ci lta bar chos shes pa'i phyogs la bcu bzhis shes so //
analyzed: de'i phyir skad cig ma lnga'i mjug thogs ci lta bar chos shes pa'i phyogs la bcu bzhis shes so //
translated: Therefore, just as it is subsequent to five moments, it is known by fourteen moments in the aspect of Dharma knowledge.

original: sbyor ba med pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sbyor ba med pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúwithout application‚Äù means

original: thugs kyi dbang phyug bcom ldan 'das kyis ni sbyor ba mi mnga' bar yon tan phun sum tshogs pa thams cad mngon du 'gyur ba'i phyir mthong ba'i lam gyi skad cig thams cad bar med par mkhyen to //
analyzed: thugs kyi dbang phyug bcom ldan 'das kyis ni sbyor ba mi mnga' bar yon tan phun sum tshogs pa thams cad mngon du 'gyur ba'i phyir mthong ba'i lam gyi skad cig thams cad bar med par mkhyen to //
translated: that the Bhagavat, the Lord of Mind, knows all the moments of the path of seeing without interruption, because he actualizes all the perfections of his qualities without application.

original: de ltar chos dang rjes su shes pa rnam pa bzhi ni zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa dag yin no zhes bshad na /
analyzed: de ltar chos dang rjes su shes pa rnam pa bzhi ni zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa dag yin no zhes bshad na /
translated: If it is explained that the four aspects of Dharma knowledge and subsequent knowledge are the knowledge of elimination and the knowledge of nonarising,

original: de gnyis la dbye ba ma mthong bas /
analyzed: de gnyis la dbye ba ma mthong bas /
translated: then since they are not seen to be differentiated,

original: yang zad pa shes pa dang mi skye ba shes pa dag khyad par ci yod ces bya ba dris te /
analyzed: yang zad pa shes pa dang mi skye ba shes pa dag khyad par ci yod ces bya ba dris te /
translated: it is asked, What is the difference between the knowledge of elimination and the knowledge of nonarising?

original: de'i phyir zad pa shes bden pa rnams la zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir zad pa shes bden pa rnams la zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
translated: Therefore it says, The knowledge of elimination is with regard to the truths and so on.üîΩHow is it that they are known in this way through uncontaminated knowledge?

original: ji ltar na zag pa med pa shes pas de ltar shes zhes bya ba ni zag pa med pa rnam pa bcu drug pa yin pa'i phyir dang / rnam par rtog pa'i phyir dris pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar na zag pa med pa shes pas de ltar shes zhes bya ba ni zag pa med pa rnam pa bcu drug pa yin pa'i phyir dang / rnam par rtog pa'i phyir dris pa'o //
translated: This is asked because they are the sixteen aspects of uncontaminated knowledge and because they are conceptual.

original: de'i rjes la langs pas zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: de'i rjes la langs pas zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: and then, having arisen, it is as if one knows.

original: bsam pa'i sgo nas 'di shes pa gnyis kho na rab tu 'jug go zhes bshad do /
analyzed: bsam pa'i sgo nas 'di shes pa gnyis kho na rab tu 'jug go zhes bshad do /
translated: Thus it is explained that these two knowledges arise through the door of imagination.

original: zag pa med pa'i shes pas ni de ltar mi shes te /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i shes pas ni de ltar mi shes te /
translated: But uncontaminated knowledge does not know in that way,

original: rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is nonconceptual.

original: zag pa med pa'i shes pa las langs pa la rnam par rtog pa 'di dag skye ste /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i shes pa las langs pa la rnam par rtog pa 'di dag skye ste /
translated: The conceptualization of these two arises in one who has arisen from uncontaminated knowledge,

original: de'i rjes la skye ba'i skabs yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rjes la skye ba'i skabs yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is an opportunity for it to arise after that.

original: da ni zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa gnyis kyis skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu yin te /
analyzed: da ni zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa gnyis kyis skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu yin te /
translated: Now, the knowledge of elimination and the knowledge of nonarising are the human life-force result of the uninterrupted path.

original: kun rdzob shes pa ni @288a * //
analyzed: kun rdzob shes pa ni @288a * //
translated: Conventional knowledge

original: de dag gi stobs kyis thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gi stobs kyis thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: is obtained by the power of those two.

original: de'i phyir yang de'i khyad par gyis de dag gi khyad par te /
analyzed: de'i phyir yang de'i khyad par gyis de dag gi khyad par te /
translated: Therefore, their distinction is due to the distinction of that.

original: kha che ba rnams na re /
analyzed: kha che ba rnams na re /
translated: The Kashmiri Vaibhasikas say:

original: bstan bcos las shes par byos zhes zer ro //
analyzed: bstan bcos las shes par byos zhes zer ro //
translated: It should be known from the treatise.

original: de'i khyad par gyis zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de'i khyad par gyis zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The distinction of thatüîΩis due to the distinction of the two knowledges.

original: de'i skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu shes pa'i khyad par gyis so //
analyzed: de'i skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu shes pa'i khyad par gyis so //
translated: The special result of the person is the result of conscious effort.

original: de la zad pa shes pa'i skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu ni bdag gis sdug bsngal yongs su shes so zhes bya ba nas lam bsgom mo zhes bya ba'i bar ro //

original: gyi sems shes pa shes pa gcig yin la bzhi'i cha yang yin no zhes bya ba ni chos dang rjes dang lam dang kun rdzob shes pa rnams kyi cha sems las byung ba la dmigs pa gang yin pa ste /

analyzed: bya ba byas pa la zhes bya ba ni bya ba byas pa nyid kyi phyir ni zhes bya ba'i don to //

analyzed: 'bras bu thams cad kyi mthar de la gdon mi za bar 'byung ba'i phyir ro //

analyzed: gang gi phyir zad pa shes pa la yod pa gang yin pa rang gi rgyud can yang mi skye ba shes pa'i rgyu ma yin no //

analyzed: mi skye ba shes pa gang yin pa zad pa shes pa'i 'bras bu dang rgyur gyur pa med pa nyid do //

analyzed: so sor brtags pa ma yin pa'i 'gog pa'o zhes brjod de /

original: de'i phyir gzhan ril ma yin pa'i gnyen po ril ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di khas blangs par 'gyur ba de bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩgzhan yang / bsgom pa'i lam la 'gog pa'am //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhan ril ma yin pa'i gnyen po ril ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di khas blangs par 'gyur ba de bstan pa'i phyir / gzhan yang / bsgom pa'i lam la 'gog pa'am //
translated: Therefore, one would accept that there is no antidote to all other afflictions.

original: lam la chos shes pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: lam la chos shes pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: Moreover, in the path of meditation, the Dharma knowledge of cessation

original: khams gsum char gyi gnyen po zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: khams gsum char gyi gnyen po zhes bya ba ni /
translated: and the path are the antidote to the three realms.

original: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba gsum pa rnams kyi spong ba'i gnyen po yin pa'o //üîΩyang ci'i phyir 'gog pa dang lam la chos shes pa dag kho nas khams gsum pa'i bsgom @290a * //
analyzed: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba gsum pa rnams kyi spong ba'i gnyen po yin pa'o // yang ci'i phyir 'gog pa dang lam la chos shes pa dag kho nas khams gsum pa'i bsgom @290a * //
translated: The antidote to the three realms is the antidote to the three realms.

original: pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spong gi snga ma dag gis ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spong gi snga ma dag gis ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why do Dharma knowledge of cessation and the path alone abandon afflictions of the three realms to be abandoned by the path of meditation and not the former?

original: zhi ba dang nges par 'byung ba can nyid du skal pa mnyam pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhi ba dang nges par 'byung ba can nyid du skal pa mnyam pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are homogeneous in being peaceful and definitely released.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i 'du byed dag 'gog pa'i gnyen po 'am /
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i 'du byed dag 'gog pa'i gnyen po 'am /
translated: The antidote to the cessation of the formative forces of the desire realm

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa 'gog pa'i gnyen po la khyad par 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa 'gog pa'i gnyen po la khyad par 'ga' yang med do //
translated: There is no difference between the cessation of the realm of fine-materiality and the cessation of the realm of immateriality, since the counter-agent is the same.

original: gang gi phyir thams cad du 'gog pa dge zhing 'dus ma byas pa dang lam yang nges par 'byung ba can no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir thams cad du 'gog pa dge zhing 'dus ma byas pa dang lam yang nges par 'byung ba can no //
translated: Cessation is wholesome and unconditioned, and the path is the means of deliverance.

original: kha cig na re mi mnyam pa'i phyir sdug bsngal ni snga ma dag gis ma yin te /
analyzed: kha cig na re mi mnyam pa'i phyir sdug bsngal ni snga ma dag gis ma yin te /
translated: Some say: Cessation is not a cognitive object of the cognition of unsatisfactoriness, because it is not associated with unsatisfactoriness.

original: khams rnams su sdug bsngal gsum gyis khrid pa'i khyad par las so zhes zer ro //
analyzed: khams rnams su sdug bsngal gsum gyis khrid pa'i khyad par las so zhes zer ro //
translated: It is because of the difference in the degree of being led by the three forms of unsatisfactoriness in the realms.

original: gzhan dag na re 'gog pa dang lam dag mi ldan pa ma yin pa'i phyir de la dmigs pa shes pa dag khams gsum pa'i gnyen po nyid du rigs te /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re 'gog pa dang lam dag mi ldan pa ma yin pa'i phyir de la dmigs pa shes pa dag khams gsum pa'i gnyen po nyid du rigs te /
translated: Others say: It is not correct that the cognition of cessation and the cognition of the path are the counter-agents of the three realms, because they are not associated with the realms.

original: 'dod pa dang ldan pa dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang ldan pa dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
translated: For, they have the realm of desire for their cognitive object.

original: sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung shes pa dag gis gzugs dang gzugs med pa las 'dod chags dang bral ba mi rung ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung shes pa dag gis gzugs dang gzugs med pa las 'dod chags dang bral ba mi rung ste /
translated: It is not possible to be free from attachment to the realms of fine-materiality and immateriality by means of the cognition of unsatisfactoriness and the cognition of the origin.

original: rnam par sun 'byin pa yid la byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par sun 'byin pa yid la byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the mental attention of thorough disaffection.

original: gzhan sun 'byin pa na gzhan la 'dod chags dang bral ba ni mi rigs so //
analyzed: gzhan sun 'byin pa na gzhan la 'dod chags dang bral ba ni mi rigs so //
translated: When one is thoroughly disenchanted with one thing, it is not possible to be attached to something else.

original: 'gog pa dang lam shes pa dag ni /
analyzed: 'gog pa dang lam shes pa dag ni /
translated: The cognitions of cessation and path

original: rang gi yul la bya ba byas pa yin yang gzhan gyi yul la yang 'jug cing rjes su gnas la /
analyzed: rang gi yul la bya ba byas pa yin yang gzhan gyi yul la yang 'jug cing rjes su gnas la /
translated: are antidotes to the three realms, because they engage and abide in the objects of others,

original: nges par 'byung ba'i dngos po'i yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba'i dngos po'i yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are the objects of the things of definite release.

original: de'i phyir de dag kho na khams gsum pa'i gnyen po nyid yin gyi gzhan dag ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag kho na khams gsum pa'i gnyen po nyid yin gyi gzhan dag ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, only those two are antidotes to the three realms, but others are not.

original: 'dod pa'i khams kyi rjes su ma yin zhes bya ba la /üîΩgal te 'gog pa dang lam la chos shes pa ni mi ldan pa la dmigs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams kyi rjes su ma yin zhes bya ba la / gal te 'gog pa dang lam la chos shes pa ni mi ldan pa la dmigs pa'i phyir /
translated: The cognition of cessation and the cognition of the path are not antidotes to the desire realm.

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i gnyen po yin na /
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i gnyen po yin na /
translated: If the cognition of the dharma with regard to cessation and the path are antidotes to the form and formless realms,üîΩbecause they focus on the nonassociated formative forces,

original: de lta na rjes su shes pa yang 'dod pa'i khams kyi gnyen por 'dod par bya dgos so zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na rjes su shes pa yang 'dod pa'i khams kyi gnyen por 'dod par bya dgos so zhe na /
translated: then subsequent cognition should also be asserted to be an antidote to the desire realm.

original: de ni de lta ma yin te //
analyzed: de ni de lta ma yin te //
translated: That is not so.

original: shes pa rnams ni rno ba yin pa'i phyir rang gi yul la bya ba byas te /
analyzed: shes pa rnams ni rno ba yin pa'i phyir rang gi yul la bya ba byas te /
translated: Because consciousnesses are sharp, they perform their function in relation to their object.üîΩ

original: gzhan gyi yul la bya ba dag byed pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyi yul la bya ba dag byed pa yin no //
translated: Because the cognitions are sharp, they perform their function with respect to their object field and do not perform their function with respect to another object field.

original: rjes su shes pa'i bya ba yongs su rdzogs pa ni chos zhes bya ba gang yin pa de nyid rjes su shes pa la rjes su gnas pa yod pa ma yin te mi srid pa'i phyir rjes su shes pa 'dod @290b pa'i khams kyi gnyen po ma yin
analyzed: rjes su shes pa'i bya ba yongs su rdzogs pa ni chos zhes bya ba gang yin pa de nyid rjes su shes pa la rjes su gnas pa yod pa ma yin te mi srid pa'i phyir rjes su shes pa 'dod @290b pa'i khams kyi gnyen po ma yin
translated: The function of subsequent cognition is not to abide in the subsequent cognition itself, because it is impossible that the function of subsequent cognition be complete with respect to that which is called the truth of the path.

original: no // lam la rjes su shes pa gong du spyod pa'i phyir 'dod chags dang bral ba ni rjes su shes pa mngon du gyur pa med do //üîΩ'on te yod na de dag tu rgyud mi mthun pa'i phyogs la gnas pa'i phyir 'og na ma yin zhing /
analyzed: no // lam la rjes su shes pa gong du spyod pa'i phyir 'dod chags dang bral ba ni rjes su shes pa mngon du gyur pa med do // 'on te yod na de dag tu rgyud mi mthun pa'i phyogs la gnas pa'i phyir 'og na ma yin zhing /
translated: Subsequent cognition is not manifest in those who are free from attachment to the realm of desire, because it is applied to higher realms.

original: 'bras bu ma grub pa'i rim pa mi srid pa'i phyir gong de na ma yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu ma grub pa'i rim pa mi srid pa'i phyir gong de na ma yin no //
translated: If it were to exist, it would not exist in lower realms, because the mindstream is not homogeneous there, and it would not exist in higher realms, because it is impossible that the stages of the path not be complete.

original: rnam pa thams cad med do zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i lam gyis bsdus pa 'am bsgom pa'i lam gyis bsdus pa yang rung ste /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad med do zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i lam gyis bsdus pa 'am bsgom pa'i lam gyis bsdus pa yang rung ste /
translated: The statement ‚ÄúNo aspect exists‚Äù refers to the path of seeing or the path of meditation.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyi gnyen po rjes su shes pa de ni mi srid pa'i phyir rnam pa thams cad du med do zhes smos so //
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyi gnyen po rjes su shes pa de ni mi srid pa'i phyir rnam pa thams cad du med do zhes smos so //
translated: All aspects do not exist means that the subsequent cognition that is the antidote to the afflictions of the desire realm does not exist in any way, whether subsumed by the path of seeing or subsumed by the path of meditation.üîΩHow many aspects do these ten knowledges possess?

original: yang shes pa bcu po 'di dag las shes pa gang zhig rnam pa du dag tu 'byung zhe na de la chos shes pa dang rjes su shes pa ni rnam pa bcu drug ste /
analyzed: yang shes pa bcu po 'di dag las shes pa gang zhig rnam pa du dag tu 'byung zhe na de la chos shes pa dang rjes su shes pa ni rnam pa bcu drug ste /
translated: The Dharma and subsequent knowledges have sixteen aspects.

original: bden pa bzhi la dmigs pa nyid kyis bden pa re re la rnam pa bzhi bzhi yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bden pa bzhi la dmigs pa nyid kyis bden pa re re la rnam pa bzhi bzhi yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They have sixteen aspects because they focus on the four truths, with each truth having four aspects.

original: kun rdzob shes pa ni rnam pa bcu drug can yang yin la gzhan gyi rnam pa can yin te zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
analyzed: kun rdzob shes pa ni rnam pa bcu drug can yang yin la gzhan gyi rnam pa can yin te zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
translated: Conventional knowledge is also of sixteen aspects, but it is said to have other aspects.

original: de la rnam pa bcu drug can ni dro bar gyur pa dang / rtse mo dang bzod pa la sogs pa dag na'o //
analyzed: de la rnam pa bcu drug can ni dro bar gyur pa dang / rtse mo dang bzod pa la sogs pa dag na'o //
translated: It is of sixteen aspects in the stages of heat, peak, patience and so on.

original: gzhan gyi rnam pa can ni mi sdug pa dang dbugs rngub pa dang 'byung ba dang / byams pa la sogs pa dag na kun rdzob shes pa du ma can no //
analyzed: gzhan gyi rnam pa can ni mi sdug pa dang dbugs rngub pa dang 'byung ba dang / byams pa la sogs pa dag na kun rdzob shes pa du ma can no //
translated: The others are those that have the aspect of something else.

original: de nyid la rgyu chos thams cad kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid la sogs pa 'dzin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de nyid la rgyu chos thams cad kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid la sogs pa 'dzin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The reason is that it apprehends the specific and general characteristics of all dharmas.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa'i phyir dang spyi'i mtshan nyid 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa'i phyir dang spyi'i mtshan nyid 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It apprehends the specific characteristics and the general characteristics.

original: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgra ni bum pa dang / snam bu la sogs pa dag bsdus te /
analyzed: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgra ni bum pa dang / snam bu la sogs pa dag bsdus te /
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes pots, cloth, etc.

original: de dag ni chos rnams kyi rang gi mtshan nyid kyang ma yin la spyi'i mtshan nyid kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: de dag ni chos rnams kyi rang gi mtshan nyid kyang ma yin la spyi'i mtshan nyid kyang ma yin te /
translated: They are not the specific characteristics of dharmas, nor are they the general characteristics.

original: gzhan gyi yid shes dri med kyang //
analyzed: gzhan gyi yid shes dri med kyang //
translated: The knowledge of others‚Äô minds and the stainless knowledge of the path

original: de bzhin zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de bzhin zhes bya ba la /
translated: are also like that.

original: ji ltar shes pa bzhi po 'di dag re re zhing rnam pa bzhi bzhi yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar shes pa bzhi po 'di dag re re zhing rnam pa bzhi bzhi yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as these four knowledges each have four aspects,

original: gzhan gyi sems shes pa zag pa med pa yang rang gi bden pa'i rnam pa dag gis rnam pa bzhi can yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems shes pa zag pa med pa yang rang gi bden pa'i rnam pa dag gis rnam pa bzhi can yin no //
translated: Also, uncontaminated knowledge of others' minds has four aspects, the aspects of its own truth.

original: lam gyi rnam pa shes pa yin no zhes bya ba ni lam gyi nang du gtogs pa'i shes pa ste /
analyzed: lam gyi rnam pa shes pa yin no zhes bya ba ni lam gyi nang du gtogs pa'i shes pa ste /
translated: Knowledge of the aspects of the truth of path is knowledge that is included in the truth of path.

original: lam shes pa'i phyogs gcig yin zhes bya ba'i @291a * //üîΩtha tshig go //
analyzed: lam shes pa'i phyogs gcig yin zhes bya ba'i @291a * // tha tshig go //
translated: It is one part of knowledge of the truth of path.

original: gnyi ga yang rdzas re re zhing spyod yul lo zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gnyi ga yang rdzas re re zhing spyod yul lo zhes bya ba la /
translated: Both of those are substantially different and have different objects.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba de dag gis rang gi mtshan nyid ni lam la sogs pa nyid yin zhing /
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba de dag gis rang gi mtshan nyid ni lam la sogs pa nyid yin zhing /
translated: The objects of those minds and mental factors are the aspects of the truth of path and so on.

original: de dag gi yul can gzhan gyi sems shes pa yang re re'i spyod yul can yin pa'i phyir ;
analyzed: de dag gi yul can gzhan gyi sems shes pa yang re re'i spyod yul can yin pa'i phyir ;
translated: The knowledge of others' minds that is their object is the object of each.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can yin yang rnam pa gzhi can zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can yin yang rnam pa gzhi can zhes bya ste /
translated: Even though they have aspects of their own nature, they are called knowledge having aspects of the basis because

original: dper na gzhan gyi sems shes pa chags pa la sogs pa'i yul can lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na gzhan gyi sems shes pa chags pa la sogs pa'i yul can lta bu'o //
translated: for example, knowledge of others' minds that is the object of attachment and so on is the object of each.

original: chags pa la sogs pa nyid sems las byung ba rnams kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid yin mod kyi /üîΩde lta na yang rdzas re re'i spyod yul can yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: chags pa la sogs pa nyid sems las byung ba rnams kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid yin mod kyi / de lta na yang rdzas re re'i spyod yul can yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Attachment and so on are indeed the general characteristics of mental factors.üîΩHowever, they are called ‚Äúcognitions that have the aspect of their own particular object‚Äù because they have as their object a particular substance,

original: shes bya rang gi mtshan nyid kyi rnam pa can zhes bya'i spyi'i rnam pa can ni ma yin no //
analyzed: shes bya rang gi mtshan nyid kyi rnam pa can zhes bya'i spyi'i rnam pa can ni ma yin no //
translated: and not because they have a general aspect.

original: 'o na bcom ldan 'das kyis 'dod chags dang bcas pa'i sems la yang 'dod chags dang bcas pa'i sems zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: 'o na bcom ldan 'das kyis 'dod chags dang bcas pa'i sems la yang 'dod chags dang bcas pa'i sems zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: Well then, how can the BhagavƒÅn have said, ‚ÄúA mind that possesses attachment is accurately known as a mind that possesses attachment‚Äù?

original: de bzhin du 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / zhe sdang dang bcas pa dang zhe sdang dang bral ba dang / gti mug dang bcas pa dang gti mug dang bral ba dang / kun bsdus pa dang rnam par g-yengs pa dang / zhum pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / zhe sdang dang bcas pa dang zhe sdang dang bral ba dang / gti mug dang bcas pa dang gti mug dang bral ba dang / kun bsdus pa dang rnam par g-yengs pa dang / zhum pa dang /
translated: Similarly, he said, ‚ÄúA mind that is free from attachment, that possesses aversion, that is free from aversion, that possesses delusion, that is free from delusion, that is contracted, that is distracted, that is slack,

original: rab tu bzung ba dang / chung ngu dang chen por gyur pa dang ; nye bar ma zhi ba dang nye bar zhi ba dang / rgod pa dang rgod pa ma yin pa dang / mnyam par ma bzhag pa dang mnyam par gzhag pa dang /
analyzed: rab tu bzung ba dang / chung ngu dang chen por gyur pa dang ; nye bar ma zhi ba dang nye bar zhi ba dang / rgod pa dang rgod pa ma yin pa dang / mnyam par ma bzhag pa dang mnyam par gzhag pa dang /
translated: It is fully grasped, small and large, not pacified and pacified,üîΩagitated and not agitated, not concentrated and concentrated,

original: ma bsgoms pa dang bsgom pa dang / rnam par ma grol ba dang rnam par grol ba'o zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes so //
analyzed: ma bsgoms pa dang bsgom pa dang / rnam par ma grol ba dang rnam par grol ba'o zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes so //
translated: not cultivated and cultivated, not liberated and liberated.

original: gal te de 'dod chags dang bcas pa 'dzin pa med na /
analyzed: gal te de 'dod chags dang bcas pa 'dzin pa med na /
translated: If it is not grasped as associated with attachment,

original: ji ltar 'dod chags dang bcas pa'o snyam du shes /
analyzed: ji ltar 'dod chags dang bcas pa'o snyam du shes /
translated: how is it known that it is associated with attachment?

original: ci ste 'dod chags dang bcas par 'dzin na ni rdzas re re zhing spyod yul lo zhes bya ba 'di ji ltar mi 'gal zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste 'dod chags dang bcas par 'dzin na ni rdzas re re zhing spyod yul lo zhes bya ba 'di ji ltar mi 'gal zhe na /
translated: But if it is grasped as associated with attachment, how is it not contradictory to say that each substance has a separate object?

original: gos dang dri ma cig car du mi 'dzin pa bzhin no zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
analyzed: gos dang dri ma cig car du mi 'dzin pa bzhin no zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
translated: It is like not grasping a garment and a stain simultaneously.

original: dri ma dang bcas pa la yongs su brtags pa na gos dang dri ma cig car 'dzin pa ma yin te /üîΩgang gi tshe gos la yongs su rtog pa de'i tshe dri ma mi 'dzin no //
analyzed: dri ma dang bcas pa la yongs su brtags pa na gos dang dri ma cig car 'dzin pa ma yin te / gang gi tshe gos la yongs su rtog pa de'i tshe dri ma mi 'dzin no //
translated: When one examines the cloth that has stains, one does not apprehend the cloth and the stains simultaneously.üîΩWhen one examines the cloth, one does not apprehend the stains.

original: gang gi tshe dri ma la yongs su rtog pa de'i tshe gos ma yin pas gos dang dri ma cig car mi 'dzin pa bzhin no @291b zhes bya ba 'di ni yongs su chad pa'i dbang du byas nas bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe dri ma la yongs su rtog pa de'i tshe gos ma yin pas gos dang dri ma cig car mi 'dzin pa bzhin no @291b zhes bya ba 'di ni yongs su chad pa'i dbang du byas nas bshad pa yin no //
translated: When one examines the stains, one does not apprehend the cloth. Thus one does not apprehend the cloth and the stains simultaneously.üîΩThis explanation is made from the point of view of the cessation of the two.

original: 'dod chags dang bcas pa gnyis rnam pa gnyis te zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bcas pa gnyis rnam pa gnyis te zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
translated: Those who are accompanied by attachment are of two types.

original: 'dres pa'i 'dod chags dang bcas pa nyid ni mngon du gyur pa las so //üîΩldan pa'i 'dod chags dang bcas pa ni 'dod chags kyi thob pa dang rjes su 'brel pa las so //
analyzed: 'dres pa'i 'dod chags dang bcas pa nyid ni mngon du gyur pa las so // ldan pa'i 'dod chags dang bcas pa ni 'dod chags kyi thob pa dang rjes su 'brel pa las so //
translated: Those who are accompanied by manifest attachment are those in whom attachment is present.üîΩThose who are accompanied by attachment through possession are those who are not presently in a state of attachment but who are bound to attachment through the possession of the possession of attachment.

original: gnyis kyi 'dod chags dang bcas pa yin te /
analyzed: gnyis kyi 'dod chags dang bcas pa yin te /
translated: Those who are accompanied by both are those who are presently in a state of attachment and who are bound to attachment through the possession of the possession of attachment.

original: 'dres pa'i 'dod chags dang bcas pa dang ldan pa'i 'dod chags dang bcas pa dag gis so //
analyzed: 'dres pa'i 'dod chags dang bcas pa dang ldan pa'i 'dod chags dang bcas pa dag gis so //
translated: Those who possess attachment to mixing and attachment to possession are those who possess attachment.

original: de las gzhan zag pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa can dang ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa dang / 'jig rten pa'i dge ba ni ldan pa'i 'dod chags dang bcas pas 'dod chags dang bcas pa ste /
analyzed: de las gzhan zag pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa can dang ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa dang / 'jig rten pa'i dge ba ni ldan pa'i 'dod chags dang bcas pas 'dod chags dang bcas pa ste /
translated: Those who possess attachment to the other contaminated states are those who possess attachment because they possess attachment to the afflicted, the unobscured indeterminate, and the mundane virtues.

original: de'i phyir 'di gnyi ga yang 'dod chags dang bcas pa'o zhes bstan par 'gyur te de ltar rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di gnyi ga yang 'dod chags dang bcas pa'o zhes bstan par 'gyur te de ltar rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Therefore, both of these are taught to be those who possess attachment, and thus they are posited.

original: 'dir kha cig gi lugs smos pa /
analyzed: 'dir kha cig gi lugs smos pa /
translated: Here, some say:

original: mdo 'dir ni 'dod chags dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems ni 'dod chags pa yin gyi zag pa dang bcas pa gzhan thob pa tsam dang lhan cig pa ni ma yin la /
analyzed: mdo 'dir ni 'dod chags dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems ni 'dod chags pa yin gyi zag pa dang bcas pa gzhan thob pa tsam dang lhan cig pa ni ma yin la /
translated: In this sutra, the mind that is concomitant with attachment is one who possesses attachment, but it is not merely the obtainment of other contaminated states.

original: 'dod chags kyi gnyen po ni 'dod chags dang bral ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dod chags kyi gnyen po ni 'dod chags dang bral ba yin no //
translated: Freedom from attachment is the antidote to attachment.

original: yang thams cad 'dod chags ma 'dres pa'i gnyen po yang ma yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: yang thams cad 'dod chags ma 'dres pa'i gnyen po yang ma yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Also, it is not the antidote that is the opposite of attachment.

original: de nyid la rgyu smos pa /
analyzed: de nyid la rgyu smos pa /
translated: The reason is stated:

original: gal te 'dod chags dang mtshungs par mi ldan pa de'i thob pa 'ba' zhig dang bcas pa de 'dod chags dang bral bar gyur na /üîΩnyon mongs pa gzhan dang mtshungs par ldan pa ste /
analyzed: gal te 'dod chags dang mtshungs par mi ldan pa de'i thob pa 'ba' zhig dang bcas pa de 'dod chags dang bral bar gyur na / nyon mongs pa gzhan dang mtshungs par ldan pa ste /
translated: If that which is not associated with attachment were to become free from attachment,üîΩit would be associated with other defilements.

original: nyon mongs pa khong khro ba la sogs pa dang yang mtshungs par ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa khong khro ba la sogs pa dang yang mtshungs par ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: It would be associated with other defilements such as anger.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: de yang 'dod chags dang mtshungs par mi ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang 'dod chags dang mtshungs par mi ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not associated with attachment.

original: mdo las ni /
analyzed: mdo las ni /
translated: In the sutra,

original: zhe sdang la sogs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa la 'dod chags dang bral ba zhes ma gsungs te /
analyzed: zhe sdang la sogs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa la 'dod chags dang bral ba zhes ma gsungs te /
translated: it is not said that that which is associated with aversion and so on is free from attachment.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What is said?

original: zhe sdang dang bcas pa gti mug dang bcas pa zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhe sdang dang bcas pa gti mug dang bcas pa zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is said that it is associated with aversion and associated with delusion.

original: 'dod chags kyi gnyen por gyur pa'i sems zhe sdang la sogs pa dang mtshungs par mi ldan pas /
analyzed: 'dod chags kyi gnyen por gyur pa'i sems zhe sdang la sogs pa dang mtshungs par mi ldan pas /
translated: Since the mind that is the antidote to attachment is not concomitant with anger and so on,

original: de'i phyir de nyid 'dod chags bral ba zhes bya bar bzung ngo //üîΩzhe sdang la sogs pa dang @292a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir de nyid 'dod chags bral ba zhes bya bar bzung ngo // zhe sdang la sogs pa dang @292a * //
translated: it is called free from attachment.

original: mtshungs par ldan pa ni zhe sdang dang bcas pa gti mug dang bcas pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: mtshungs par ldan pa ni zhe sdang dang bcas pa gti mug dang bcas pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The mind concomitant with anger and so on is said to possess anger and so on.

original: de'i phyir 'di la skyon med de /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di la skyon med de /
translated: Therefore there is no error here.

original: 'dir skyon gzhan 'chad par 'dod pas de lta na 'o na zhes smos te /üîΩgal te 'dod chags dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems 'dod chags dang bcas pa yin zhing /
analyzed: 'dir skyon gzhan 'chad par 'dod pas de lta na 'o na zhes smos te / gal te 'dod chags dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems 'dod chags dang bcas pa yin zhing /
translated: Here, one who wishes to explain another error says, If that is so, then.

original: 'dod chags kyi gnyen po 'dod chags dang bral ba yin na /üîΩde lta na ni de'i gnyen po ma yin pa'i sems nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa 'dod chags dang bcas pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: 'dod chags kyi gnyen po 'dod chags dang bral ba yin na / de lta na ni de'i gnyen po ma yin pa'i sems nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa 'dod chags dang bcas pa yang ma yin la /
translated: If the mind concomitant with attachment possesses attachment and the antidote to attachment is free from attachment,

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba'ang ma yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba'ang ma yin par 'gyur te /
translated: then a mind that is not an antidote to attachment would not possess attachment and would not be free from attachment.

original: gang gi phyir gnyen po dang nyon mongs pa can yang ma yin pas de'i phyir nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa zhes smos te /üîΩma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa dang dge ba ni nam yang 'dod chags dang mtshungs par mi ldan pa'i phyir 'dod chags dang bcas pa nyid ma yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gnyen po dang nyon mongs pa can yang ma yin pas de'i phyir nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa zhes smos te / ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa dang dge ba ni nam yang 'dod chags dang mtshungs par mi ldan pa'i phyir 'dod chags dang bcas pa nyid ma yin la /
translated: Because it is neither a counteragent nor afflicted, therefore it is said to be unafflicted.üîΩNeither associated with attachment nor free from attachmentüîΩbecause it is never associated with attachment,

original: 'dod chags kyi gnyen po ma yin pa'i phyir 'dod chags dang bral ba ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dod chags kyi gnyen po ma yin pa'i phyir 'dod chags dang bral ba ma yin no //
translated: because it is not the counteragent to attachment.

original: gang zhig de'i gnyen po ma yin zhe na sbyor ba'i lam la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gang zhig de'i gnyen po ma yin zhe na sbyor ba'i lam la sogs pa'o //
translated: What is not its counteragent? The path of preparation and so on.

original: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni zhe sdang dang bcas pa dang / gti mug dang bcas pa zhes bya ba der yang 'dra bar thal bar 'gyur bar ston to //
analyzed: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni zhe sdang dang bcas pa dang / gti mug dang bcas pa zhes bya ba der yang 'dra bar thal bar 'gyur bar ston to //
translated: The term ‚Äúand so on‚Äù indicates that the same applies to being associated with aversion and being associated with delusion.

original: de bas na 'dir 'dod chags dang ldan pas kyang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de bas na 'dir 'dod chags dang ldan pas kyang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Therefore, here, ‚Äúassociated with attachment‚Äù means

original: gang gi phyir bshad ma thag pa'i kha cig gi lugs skyon dang bcas pa de'i phyir 'dod chags dang mtshungs par ldan pas kyang ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir bshad ma thag pa'i kha cig gi lugs skyon dang bcas pa de'i phyir 'dod chags dang mtshungs par ldan pas kyang ste /
translated: Because some systems just explained are faulty, therefore, the mind is associated with attachment.

original: 'dod chags rgyas par 'gyur bas kyang zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'dod chags rgyas par 'gyur bas kyang zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it increases attachment.

original: kyang zhes bya ba'i sgras ni 'dir 'dod chags dang mtshungs par ldan pa nyid kyis kyang 'dod chags dang bcas pa'i sems su 'dod par bya'o zhes gzhan dag go //
analyzed: kyang zhes bya ba'i sgras ni 'dir 'dod chags dang mtshungs par ldan pa nyid kyis kyang 'dod chags dang bcas pa'i sems su 'dod par bya'o zhes gzhan dag go //
translated: Others say that the term also indicates that the mind is associated with attachment because it is associated with attachment.

original: de lta na zag pa dang bcas pa dang / nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa yang 'dod chags dang bcas pa yin no zhes bya bar bsdus par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na zag pa dang bcas pa dang / nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa yang 'dod chags dang bcas pa yin no zhes bya bar bsdus par 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, it would follow that a contaminated mind and a nonvirtuous mind would also possess attachment.

original: dmigs pa la mngon par bsdus pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dmigs pa la mngon par bsdus pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because it is concentrated on the object.

original: dge ba'i sems ni dmigs pa la mngon par bsdus shing dmigs pa las mi g-yengs pa ste rnam par mi g-yengs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge ba'i sems ni dmigs pa la mngon par bsdus shing dmigs pa las mi g-yengs pa ste rnam par mi g-yengs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: A virtuous mind is concentrated on the object and not distracted from the object because it is concomitant with nondistraction.

original: kun tu bsdus pa ni @292b gnyid dang mtshungs par ldan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni dbang po lnga rgyu ba mngon par bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun tu bsdus pa ni @292b gnyid dang mtshungs par ldan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni dbang po lnga rgyu ba mngon par bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The five faculties are completely contracted because they are withdrawn.

original: rnam par g-yeng ba ni nyon mongs pa gzhan yin zhes bya ba ni gnyid dang mtshungs par ldan pa las so //
analyzed: rnam par g-yeng ba ni nyon mongs pa gzhan yin zhes bya ba ni gnyid dang mtshungs par ldan pa las so //
translated: Distracted is associated with other afflictions.

original: sems de ni nyon mongs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pas rnam par g-yang ba yin zhing /
analyzed: sems de ni nyon mongs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pas rnam par g-yang ba yin zhing /
translated: That mind is distracted because it is associated with afflictions.

original: gnyid dang mtshungs par ldan pas kun tu bsdus par 'gyur na /
analyzed: gnyid dang mtshungs par ldan pas kun tu bsdus par 'gyur na /
translated: It is completely contracted because it is associated with sleep.

original: gcig la ni 'gal ba'i chos nyid rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gcig la ni 'gal ba'i chos nyid rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not logical for a single mind to have mutually exclusive natures.

original: bstan bcos las zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bstan bcos las zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The treatise states:

original: gal te kun tu bsdus pa gang yin pa de nyid dang mtshungs par ldan par gyur na 'gal par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te kun tu bsdus pa gang yin pa de nyid dang mtshungs par ldan par gyur na 'gal par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If that which is completely contracted were associated with that, there would be a contradiction.

original: sems kun tu bsdus pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes so zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: sems kun tu bsdus pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes so zhes 'byung ste /
translated: It is stated: ‚ÄúOne accurately knows a completely contracted mind.‚Äù

original: gnyid dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems kyis yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gnyid dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems kyis yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes pa ma yin no //
translated: The mind associated with sleep does not know reality as it is.

original: de shes pa'i shes pa ni bzhi ste zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de shes pa'i shes pa ni bzhi ste zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The knowledge that knows that is four knowledges.

original: kun bsdus pa'i sems de shes pa'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: kun bsdus pa'i sems de shes pa'i shes pa'o //
translated: The knowledge that knows that mind that is a collection is four knowledges.

original: lam la rjes su shes pa ngag ni gnyid dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems kyi dmigs par mi rung ste /
analyzed: lam la rjes su shes pa ngag ni gnyid dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems kyi dmigs par mi rung ste /
translated: The subsequent knowledge of the truth of the path is not suitable as the object of a mind associated with sleep,

original: gnyid ni gcig tu zag pa dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir dang / 'dod pa na spyod pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyid ni gcig tu zag pa dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir dang / 'dod pa na spyod pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because sleep is exclusively contaminated and belongs to the desire realm.

original: gzhan gyi sems pa 'dir ci'i phyir ma bshad /
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems pa 'dir ci'i phyir ma bshad /
translated: Why is the knowledge of others' minds not explained here?

original: de nyid ni 'dir rnam par dbye ba byas te /
analyzed: de nyid ni 'dir rnam par dbye ba byas te /
translated: That itself is analyzed here.

original: ji lta ba ni sngar kun bsdus pa'i dge ba zhes bshad do //
analyzed: ji lta ba ni sngar kun bsdus pa'i dge ba zhes bshad do //
translated: The knowledge of others' minds that is a collection is explained as virtuous in the previous section.

original: de ltar na 'di la skyon med do //
analyzed: de ltar na 'di la skyon med do //
translated: Thus there is no fault in this explanation.

original: gcig nyid kun bsdus pa dang rnam par g-yeng bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i bstan bcos dang 'gal ba med de dge ba khams gsum pas bsdus pa'i yang phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig nyid kun bsdus pa dang rnam par g-yeng bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i bstan bcos dang 'gal ba med de dge ba khams gsum pas bsdus pa'i yang phyir ro //
translated: There is no contradiction with the treatises that state that it is a single entity that includes all and is distracted, because it is included in the three realms of virtue.

original: le lo dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mngon par mi spro ba'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩrab tu bzung ba ni brtson 'grus dang mtshungs par ldan pa ste /
analyzed: le lo dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mngon par mi spro ba'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro // rab tu bzung ba ni brtson 'grus dang mtshungs par ldan pa ste /
translated: It is associated with laziness because it is the nature of non-exertion.üîΩIt is associated with vigor because it is the nature of exertion.

original: rab tu bzung ba ni brtson 'grus kyi rnam grangs yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rab tu bzung ba ni brtson 'grus kyi rnam grangs yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Vigor is a synonym for exertion.

original: rnam par byang ba chung du dag gis bsten pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i rtsa ba chung du rnams kyis so //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba chung du dag gis bsten pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i rtsa ba chung du rnams kyis so //
translated: It is associated with small purification because it is associated with small roots of virtue.

original: 'dir ni dge ba'i rtsa ba dag rnam par byang ba yin par 'dod de /
analyzed: 'dir ni dge ba'i rtsa ba dag rnam par byang ba yin par 'dod de /
translated: Here, the roots of virtue are considered to be purification.

original: ngo bo nyid kyi dge bas dag pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyi dge bas dag pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because virtue is pure by nature.

original: de'i phyir de lta na dge ba'i rtsa ba chung ngu @293a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir de lta na dge ba'i rtsa ba chung ngu @293a * //
translated: Therefore, in that case, the roots of virtue are small.

original: dag gis bsten pa'i phyir zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dag gis bsten pa'i phyir zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: because it is the basis of the great purification.

original: chen por gyur pa ni de las bzlog pa yin pa'i phyir dge ba yin no zhes bya ba ni rnam par byang ba chen po bdag gis bsten pa'i phyir zhes ston pa yin no //
analyzed: chen por gyur pa ni de las bzlog pa yin pa'i phyir dge ba yin no zhes bya ba ni rnam par byang ba chen po bdag gis bsten pa'i phyir zhes ston pa yin no //
translated: The great is virtuous because it is the opposite of that.

original: gzhan yang go rims bzhin du rtsa ba dang / rin dang 'khor dang rjes su 'brang ba dang / stobs chung ba dang che ba'i phyir chung du chen por gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang go rims bzhin du rtsa ba dang / rin dang 'khor dang rjes su 'brang ba dang / stobs chung ba dang che ba'i phyir chung du chen por gyur pa yin no //
translated: Moreover, they are small and great because they are, respectively, weak and strong roots, prices, retinues, followers, and powers.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩnyon mongs pa can ni mi dge ba'i rtsa ba gnyis kyis rtsa ba dang bcas pa yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir / nyon mongs pa can ni mi dge ba'i rtsa ba gnyis kyis rtsa ba dang bcas pa yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: In order to demonstrate just this, he says:üîΩThe afflicted is associated with two unwholesome roots.

original: nyon mongs pa can ni 'dod chags dang zhe sdang gnyis la mtshungs par ldan pas de nyid gang yang rung ba zhig dang gti mug gi dge ba'i rtsa bas rtsa ba dang bcas pa yin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can ni 'dod chags dang zhe sdang gnyis la mtshungs par ldan pas de nyid gang yang rung ba zhig dang gti mug gi dge ba'i rtsa bas rtsa ba dang bcas pa yin no //
translated: The afflicted is associated with either attachment or aversion, and it is associated with the unwholesome root of delusion.

original: dge ba ni gsum gyis so zhes bya ba ni ma chags pa dang zhe sdang med pa dang / gti mug med pa rnams phan tshun mi 'khrul ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge ba ni gsum gyis so zhes bya ba ni ma chags pa dang zhe sdang med pa dang / gti mug med pa rnams phan tshun mi 'khrul ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Virtue is established by three, because nonattachment, nonaversion and nondelusion are mutually unconfounded.

original: 'bad pas bsgrub par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mi 'dod bzhin du yang nyon mongs pa 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bad pas bsgrub par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mi 'dod bzhin du yang nyon mongs pa 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are not established by effort means that afflictions arise even without desire.üîΩBecause they are established by a great collection means that they are established by listening to the excellent teaching, properly attending to it and practicing its meaning.üîΩAfflicted states are not established by those three because they are not established by the three roots of virtue.üîΩAfflicted states are not established by the three roots of virtue because they are not established by the three roots of nonvirtue.üîΩAfflicted states are not established by the three roots of nonvirtue because they are not established by the three roots of virtue.

original: sam bh'a ra tshogs chen po bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni dam pa'i chos nyan pa dang tshul bzhin yid la byed pa dang / don gyis sgrub pa la sogs pa dag gis bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sam bh'a ra tshogs chen po bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni dam pa'i chos nyan pa dang tshul bzhin yid la byed pa dang / don gyis sgrub pa la sogs pa dag gis bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Afflicted states are not established by the three roots of virtue because they are not established by the three roots of nonvirtue.üîΩAfflicted states are not established by the three roots of nonvirtue because they are not established by the three roots of virtue.üîΩAfflicted states are not established by the three roots of virtue because they are not established by the three roots of nonvirtue.üîΩAfflicted states are not established by the three roots of nonvirtue because they are not established by the three roots of virtue.üîΩAfflicted states are not established by the three roots of virtue because they are not established by the three roots of nonvirtue.üîΩAfflicted states are not established by the three roots of nonvirtue because they are not established by the three roots of virtue.üîΩAfflicted states are not established by the three roots of virtue because they are not established by the three roots of nonvirtue.üîΩAfflicted states are not established by the three roots of nonvirtue because they are not established by the three roots of virtue.üîΩAfflicted states are not established by the three roots of virtue because they are not established by the three roots of nonvirtue.üîΩAfflicted states are not established by the three roots of nonvirtue because they are not established by the three roots of virtue.üîΩAfflicted states are not established by the three roots of virtue because they are not established by the three roots of nonvirtue.üîΩAfflicted states are not established by the three roots of nonvirtue because they are not established by the three roots of virtue.

original: nyon mongs pa can ni de dang 'dra ba ma 'ongs pa thob pa med pa'i phyir mtshams sbyor ba'i srid par kho na nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi ngo bo bsgom pa ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can ni de dang 'dra ba ma 'ongs pa thob pa med pa'i phyir mtshams sbyor ba'i srid par kho na nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi ngo bo bsgom pa ste /
translated: Afflicted states are not established by the three roots of virtue because they are not established by the three roots of nonvirtue.

original: yang nyon mongs pa 'dra ba rnams bsgoms pas te /
analyzed: yang nyon mongs pa 'dra ba rnams bsgoms pas te /
translated: Afflicted states are not established by the three roots of nonvirtue

original: yang nyon mongs pa 'dra ba rnams thob pa med pas 'khor ba mang ba ma yin no //
analyzed: yang nyon mongs pa 'dra ba rnams thob pa med pas 'khor ba mang ba ma yin no //
translated: Also, there is no increase in samsara due to the non-acquisition of similar afflictions.

original: dge ba ni de dang 'dra ba ma 'ongs pa'i dngos po rnams bsgom pa'i phyir 'khor ba mang ba yin no //
analyzed: dge ba ni de dang 'dra ba ma 'ongs pa'i dngos po rnams bsgom pa'i phyir 'khor ba mang ba yin no //
translated: However, there is an increase in samsara due to the cultivation of future entities that are similar to virtue.

original: lung las chos dge ba 'dus byas thob pa yin no zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lung las chos dge ba 'dus byas thob pa yin no zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is said in scripture, ‚ÄúThe acquisition of conditioned virtuous entities is a dharma.‚Äù

original: phung po gsum gyis zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: phung po gsum gyis zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is accompanied by three aggregates.

original: gang gi phyir nyon mongs pa can gyi gzugs dang sems rjes su 'jug pa med do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir nyon mongs pa can gyi gzugs dang sems rjes su 'jug pa med do //
translated: Because there is no concomitant form or mind in afflicted states,

original: de'i phyir nyon mongs pa can gyi sems la ni tshor ba dang 'du shes dang 'du byed rnams kyis so //
analyzed: de'i phyir nyon mongs pa can gyi sems la ni tshor ba dang 'du shes dang 'du byed rnams kyis so //
translated: afflicted mind is accompanied by four aggregates: feeling, discernment, and formation.üîΩIt is accompanied by four aggregates.

original: phung po bzhis rjes su 'brang ba dang bcas pa yin @293b no zhes bya ba ni de la bsam gtan dang dag pa med pa'i sdom pa dag gi gzugs ni phung po bzhis sems kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phung po bzhis rjes su 'brang ba dang bcas pa yin @293b no zhes bya ba ni de la bsam gtan dang dag pa med pa'i sdom pa dag gi gzugs ni phung po bzhis sems kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In the absorptions and formless states, there is no concomitant form, because form does not exist there.

original: gtan du 'joms pa zhes bya ba ni dge bas gcod pa'i don to //
analyzed: gtan du 'joms pa zhes bya ba ni dge bas gcod pa'i don to //

analyzed: gzhan gyi sems shes pa zag pa med pa rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can du bshad pa'i phyir ro //

original: dri med bcu drug gzhan rnams med ces so //
analyzed: dri med bcu drug gzhan rnams med ces so //
translated: The stainless has sixteen aspects. Others do not.

original: 'di skad bstan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan par 'gyur te /
translated: This is explained as follows:

original: gzhan zag pa med pa'i spyi'i rnam pa yang med na /
analyzed: gzhan zag pa med pa'i spyi'i rnam pa yang med na /
translated: If other uncontaminated aspects are general aspects,

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kyi rnam pa lta ga la yod ces bya'o //üîΩmi ldan pa'i sems kyis zhes bya ba ni zag pa @299a * //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kyi rnam pa lta ga la yod ces bya'o // mi ldan pa'i sems kyis zhes bya ba ni zag pa @299a * //
translated: How could there be an aspect of intrinsic identity?

original: med pas so //
analyzed: med pas so //
translated: With a non-associated mind means with an uncontaminated mind.

original: mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ste /
translated: Impermanence, suffering, etc.

original: mi rtag pa zhes bya ba dang sdug bsngal zhes bya ba dag gi don gang zhe na /
analyzed: mi rtag pa zhes bya ba dang sdug bsngal zhes bya ba dag gi don gang zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of impermanence and suffering?

original: ta sil gyi rkyen 'di ni zhes bya ba'i don la blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: ta sil gyi rkyen 'di ni zhes bya ba'i don la blta bar bya ste /
translated: The meaning of this suffix ta is to be understood as ‚Äúthis is the case.‚Äù

original: de ltar thams cad du'o //
analyzed: de ltar thams cad du'o //
translated: Thus, in all cases.

original: 'di ni gnas yod do zhes bya ba ni mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ni gnas yod do zhes bya ba ni mtshan nyid do //
translated: This is the case means the intrinsic identity.

original: 'di ni gzhi yod do zhes bya ba ni rgyu'o //
analyzed: 'di ni gzhi yod do zhes bya ba ni rgyu'o //
translated: This is the basis means the cause.

original: rig pas bskyed pa'i sgo nas zhes bya ba ni phyin ci ma log par te ma 'khrul bar zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rig pas bskyed pa'i sgo nas zhes bya ba ni phyin ci ma log par te ma 'khrul bar zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: By means of the generation of knowledge means without error, without confusion.

original: 'di'i don ni nyi 'og pa rnams kyis smras pa 'di ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di'i don ni nyi 'og pa rnams kyis smras pa 'di ma yin no //
translated: This is not the meaning of the above statement by the outsiders.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning?

original: 'di'i don ni mi rtag pa la sogs par shes par 'gyur ba gang yin 'di ni gnas yod do 'di ni gzhi yod do zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'di'i don ni mi rtag pa la sogs par shes par 'gyur ba gang yin 'di ni gnas yod do 'di ni gzhi yod do zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The meaning of this is that this is a basis, this is a ground, for understanding impermanence and so on.

original: 'di ni srid pa yod do //
analyzed: 'di ni srid pa yod do //
translated: This is existence.

original: 'di ni 'byor pa yod do zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni 'byor pa yod do zhes bya ba 'di yin no //

original: gal te 'di bstan bcos kyi don yin par 'gyur na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gal te 'di bstan bcos kyi don yin par 'gyur na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
translated: If this were the meaning of the treatise, then the treatise would not be teaching the meaning of the four noble truths.

original: bdag dang bdag gi zhes bya ba ni 'jig tshogs la lta bas so //
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gi zhes bya ba ni 'jig tshogs la lta bas so //
translated: The self and what belongs to the self are due to the afflicted view of the perishing aggregates.

original: chad pa dang rtag pa zhes bya ba ni mthar 'dzin pa'i lta bas so //
analyzed: chad pa dang rtag pa zhes bya ba ni mthar 'dzin pa'i lta bas so //
translated: Annihilation and permanence are due to the extreme view.

original: rgyu med pa dang byed pa med pa dang skur pa 'debs pa zhes bya ba ni log par lta bas so //
analyzed: rgyu med pa dang byed pa med pa dang skur pa 'debs pa zhes bya ba ni log par lta bas so //

original: mchog dang gtso bo dang khyad par du 'phags pa dang / dam pa zhes bya ba ni lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pas so //
analyzed: mchog dang gtso bo dang khyad par du 'phags pa dang / dam pa zhes bya ba ni lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pas so //
translated: Supreme, best, highest, and excellent are due to the esteem of views.

original: 'gog pa dang / grol ba dang / nges par 'byin pa zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pas so //
analyzed: 'gog pa dang / grol ba dang / nges par 'byin pa zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pas so //
translated: Cessation, liberation, and definite emergence are due to the overesteeming of morality and asceticism.

original: nem nur dang yid gnyis dang the tshom zhes bya ba ni the tshom gyis so //
analyzed: nem nur dang yid gnyis dang the tshom zhes bya ba ni the tshom gyis so //
translated: Doubt is due to doubt.

original: chags pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags kyis so ;üîΩ/ sdang ba zhes bya ba ni zhe sdang gis so //
analyzed: chags pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags kyis so ; / sdang ba zhes bya ba ni zhe sdang gis so //
translated: Attachment is due to craving.üîΩAversion is due to hatred.

original: rlom pa zhes bya ba ni nga rgyal gyis so //
analyzed: rlom pa zhes bya ba ni nga rgyal gyis so //
translated: Conceit is due to pride.

original: rmongs pa zhes bya ba ni gti mug gis so //
analyzed: rmongs pa zhes bya ba ni gti mug gis so //

original: de ltar gzhung 'dis ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i phra rgyas bcu bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar gzhung 'dis ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i phra rgyas bcu bstan to //

original: 'di ni gnas yod do 'di ni gzhi yod do zhes bya ba 'di rnam pa bcu drug ma rtog par zag pa med pa'i rnam pa ma yin par shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ni gnas yod do 'di ni gzhi yod do zhes bya ba 'di rnam pa bcu drug ma rtog par zag pa med pa'i rnam pa ma yin par shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: The sixteen aspects of the truths, such as impermanence, are not considered to be the pure aspects of the truths, since they are not free from the proclivities.

original: de lta bas na 'di ni de'i don ma yin no zhes bya ba ni mi rtag pa la sogs pa shes par 'gyur ba gang yin pa 'di ni gnas yod do 'di ni gzhi yod do zhes ji skad du smras pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'di ni de'i don ma yin no zhes bya ba ni mi rtag pa la sogs pa shes par 'gyur ba gang yin pa 'di ni gnas yod do 'di ni gzhi yod do zhes ji skad du smras pa'o //
translated: This is the case, for it is said, ‚ÄúThere is a basis for the knowledge of impermanence, etc., there is a ground for it.‚Äù

original: de lta yin dang gzhan gyi sems @299b shes pa thams cad rdzas kyi rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can du grub po //
analyzed: de lta yin dang gzhan gyi sems @299b shes pa thams cad rdzas kyi rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can du grub po //
translated: If that is so, then all knowledge of the minds of others is established as having a substance for its own characteristic object.

original: gzhan dag na re /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re /
translated: Others say:

original: 'di ni gnas yod do zhes bya ba dang srid pa yod do 'di ni gzhi yod do zhes bya ba 'di ni phyin ci ma log pa'i yul smos pa bsal bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni gnas yod do zhes bya ba dang srid pa yod do 'di ni gzhi yod do zhes bya ba 'di ni phyin ci ma log pa'i yul smos pa bsal bar byed pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThere is a basis for it‚Äù and ‚Äúthere is existence‚Äù and ‚Äúthere is a ground for it‚Äù are explanations that eliminate the mention of a non-erroneous object.

original: de nyid kyi phyir mthong bas spang bar bya'o zhes 'dir 'don to //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mthong bas spang bar bya'o zhes 'dir 'don to //
translated: Therefore, it is recited here that it is abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: phyin ci ma log pa'i yul smos pa med pas so //
analyzed: phyin ci ma log pa'i yul smos pa med pas so //
translated: Because it does not have a non-erroneous object.

original: de la rkyen la rag las pa'i phyir mi rtag pa ste /
analyzed: de la rkyen la rag las pa'i phyir mi rtag pa ste /
translated: It is impermanent because it depends on conditions.

original: snga na med pa ni rkyen yod pa la rag las pa yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: snga na med pa ni rkyen yod pa la rag las pa yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: That which did not exist before depends on the existence of conditions, not on anything else.

original: gnod pa'i bdag nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gnod pa'i bdag nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is the nature of harm.üîΩ

original: gnod par byed pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya don to //
analyzed: gnod par byed pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya don to //
translated: The meaning of the phrase, ‚Äúit has the nature of harm‚Äù is that it is the cause of harm.

original: bdag gir lta ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bdag gir lta ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase, ‚Äúby the counteragent to the view of ‚Äòmine‚Äô‚Äù means

original: bdag gir shin tu stong pa'o //
analyzed: bdag gir shin tu stong pa'o //
translated: that it is completely empty of ‚Äúmine.‚Äù

original: bdag gir lta ba de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis stong pa'o //
analyzed: bdag gir lta ba de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis stong pa'o //
translated: It is empty by the counteragent to the view of ‚Äúmine.‚Äù

original: bdag yod na bdag gi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag yod na bdag gi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If there were a self, there would be ‚Äúmine.‚Äù

original: bdag tu lta ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis bdag med pa'o zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po lnga po bdag ma yin la /
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis bdag med pa'o zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po lnga po bdag ma yin la /
translated: The phrase, ‚Äúby the counteragent to the view of self, it is selfless‚Äù means that the five aggregates, such as form, are not the self.

original: gang mi rtag pa de sdug bsngal ba'o //
analyzed: gang mi rtag pa de sdug bsngal ba'o //
translated: Whatever is impermanent is unsatisfactory.

original: sdug bsngal ba de bdag med pa yin pas de la bdag go snyam du mngon par zhen pa ni bdag tu lta ba ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba de bdag med pa yin pas de la bdag go snyam du mngon par zhen pa ni bdag tu lta ba ste /
translated: Since that which is unsatisfactory is selfless, the adherence to the notion that ‚Äúthat is a self‚Äù is the view of self.

original: de'i gnyen por bdag med pa'o //
analyzed: de'i gnyen por bdag med pa'o //
translated: The counteragent to that is selflessness.

original: sa bon gyi chos kyi tshul gyis zhes bya bas ni rgyu thag ring po'i gnas skabs ston te dang po'i sa bon lta bu'o //
analyzed: sa bon gyi chos kyi tshul gyis zhes bya bas ni rgyu thag ring po'i gnas skabs ston te dang po'i sa bon lta bu'o //
translated: The phrase, ‚Äúby the principle of the seed-dharma‚Äù indicates the state of distant cause, like the initial seed.

original: sa bon gyi chos kyi tshul gyis zhes bya ba ni sa bon gyi chos kyi lugs kyis zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sa bon gyi chos kyi tshul gyis zhes bya ba ni sa bon gyi chos kyi lugs kyis zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: By the method of the seed-dharma means by the method of the seed-dharma.

original: 'byung ba'i tshul gyis zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'byung ba'i tshul gyis zhes bya ba ni /
translated: By the method of origination means

analyzed: de ma thag tu skye ba ltar rgyu thag nye ba'i gnas skabs ston te / 'di ni phrad nas 'byung bas kun 'byung ba'o //

analyzed: 'brel pa'i tshul gyis rab tu skye ba'o zhes bya bas ni /
translated: By the method of connection it is fully produced means

original: rgyun mi 'chad pa'i rgyur ston te /
analyzed: rgyun mi 'chad pa'i rgyur ston te /

original: sa bon dang myu gu dang lo ma dang sdong bu la sogs pa ltar 'di las rgyun chad pa'am rab tu skye bas na rab tu skye ba'o //
analyzed: sa bon dang myu gu dang lo ma dang sdong bu la sogs pa ltar 'di las rgyun chad pa'am rab tu skye bas na rab tu skye ba'o //
translated: It is fully produced because it is produced from this without interruption or fully, like a seed, sprout, leaf, stem, and so on.

original: mngon par sgrub pa'i don gyis na rkyen zhes bya pas ni rgyu la sogs pa rkyen mang po zhig las skye ba ste /
analyzed: mngon par sgrub pa'i don gyis na rkyen zhes bya pas ni rgyu la sogs pa rkyen mang po zhig las skye ba ste /

analyzed: rkyen rnams phan tshun mngon du phyogs pa las de skye ba'i phyir bum pa la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: It is produced from the mutual orientation of the conditions, like a pot and so on.

original: me gsum nye bar zhi ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug gi me zhi ba'i @300a * //
analyzed: me gsum nye bar zhi ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug gi me zhi ba'i @300a * //
translated: Because the three fires are completely extinguished means because the fires of passion, hatred, and ignorance are extinguished.

original: phyir ro // 'tshe ba med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyir ro // 'tshe ba med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no injury means because there is no suffering.

original: skyon thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: skyon thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because it is free from all faults means

original: skyon ni sdug bsngal gyi rgyu rnams so //
analyzed: skyon ni sdug bsngal gyi rgyu rnams so //

original: bgrod pa'i don gyis na lam mo zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das par bgrod pa'i don gyis so ;
analyzed: bgrod pa'i don gyis na lam mo zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das par bgrod pa'i don gyis so ;
translated: The path is so called because of the meaning of going, means because of the meaning of going to nirvana.

original: / rig pa dang ldan pa'i phyir rig pa'o zhes bya ba ni tha dad pa dang ldan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩyang dag par sgrub pa'i don gyis bsgrub pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: / rig pa dang ldan pa'i phyir rig pa'o zhes bya ba ni tha dad pa dang ldan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to // yang dag par sgrub pa'i don gyis bsgrub pa'o zhes bya ba ni /

analyzed: yang dag par bgrod pa'i don gyis na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //

original: shin tu yang dag par 'da' bar byed pa'i phyir nges par 'byin par byed pa'o zhes bya ba ni 'bras las nyams pa 'chi ba med zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shin tu yang dag par 'da' bar byed pa'i phyir nges par 'byin par byed pa'o zhes bya ba ni 'bras las nyams pa 'chi ba med zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the one that definitely leads to the transcendence of suffering because it causes one to completely transcend suffering.

original: gtan du ba ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rab tu 'jig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gtan du ba ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rab tu 'jig pa'i phyir ro //

original: khur lta bur gyur pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: khur lta bur gyur pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is like a burden because it is a collection of many things.

original: mngon par bkod par gyur pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mngon par bkod par gyur pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is like a foundation because it is the basis of many things.

original: gzhan dag ni sdug bsngal gyi khur gtong ba dang 'dor na 'dren pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni sdug bsngal gyi khur gtong ba dang 'dor na 'dren pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //

original: 'dod dgur byed pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rang dbang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod dgur byed pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rang dbang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not independent because it is not autonomous.

original: mdo las kyang gsungs te /
analyzed: mdo las kyang gsungs te /
translated: A sutra states:

original: dge slong dag gal te gzugs bdag yin par 'gyur na /
analyzed: dge slong dag gal te gzugs bdag yin par 'gyur na /
translated: Monks, if form were the self,

original: gzugs bdag nyid la gnod pa byed par 'gyur gyi zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gzugs bdag nyid la gnod pa byed par 'gyur gyi zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //

analyzed: 'ong ba'i tshul gyis rgyu'o zhes bya ba ni 'di las 'ong bas na rgyu ste /

analyzed: 'di las skye bas na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
