original: 'phel ba'i tshul gyis rab tu skye'o zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'phel ba'i tshul gyis rab tu skye'o zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Production means the mode of increase.

original: dper na sa bon dang myu gu dang lo ma la sogs pa'i rgyun gyis 'phel ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na sa bon dang myu gu dang lo ma la sogs pa'i rgyun gyis 'phel ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, like the increase of a seed, sprout, leaf, and so on.üîΩCondition means the mode of following.

original: so sor 'brang ba'i don gyis rkyen no zhes bya ba ni rjes su 'gro ba'i don gyis zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //üîΩ'brel ba med pas 'brel pa zhig pa'i phyir 'gog pa'o zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal phyi ma dang 'brel pa med cing /
analyzed: so sor 'brang ba'i don gyis rkyen no zhes bya ba ni rjes su 'gro ba'i don gyis zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // 'brel ba med pas 'brel pa zhig pa'i phyir 'gog pa'o zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal phyi ma dang 'brel pa med cing /
translated: The meaning is: the mode of following.üîΩCessation means the mode of separation.

original: sdug bsngal snga ma 'gog pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sdug bsngal snga ma 'gog pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: because it is separated from future suffering and because it is the cessation of former suffering.

original: 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid gsum dang bral ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid gsum dang bral ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Because it is free from the three characteristics of conditioned states.

original: skye ba dang 'jig pa dang gnas pa las gzhan @300b du 'gyur ba nyid dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba dang 'jig pa dang gnas pa las gzhan @300b du 'gyur ba nyid dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is free from arising, destruction, and change while enduring.

original: dge ba'i phyir gya nom pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dge ba'i phyir gya nom pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is sublime because it is virtuous.

original: thar pa dam pa'i don du dge zhes bya ba yin pas so //
analyzed: thar pa dam pa'i don du dge zhes bya ba yin pas so //
translated: Because it is virtuous in the ultimate sense, i.e., as liberation.

original: yid brtan pa'i phyogs yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yid brtan pa'i phyogs yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is the side of confidence because

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i grong du 'jug pa dang mi 'gal ba'i don gyis zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste 'dis sgrub par byed pas so //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i grong du 'jug pa dang mi 'gal ba'i don gyis zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste 'dis sgrub par byed pas so //

analyzed: de'i phyir dge slong dag de lta na zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said in detail, ‚ÄúMonks, it is thus.‚Äù

original: gong na med pa'i phyir gya nom pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gong na med pa'i phyir gya nom pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is sublime because there is nothing higher.

original: gong ma dang bcas pa la gya nom pa'o zhes mi rung ngo //
analyzed: gong ma dang bcas pa la gya nom pa'o zhes mi rung ngo //
translated: It is not suitable to say, ‚ÄúIt is sublime because it has something higher.‚Äù

original: yang phyir mi ldog pa'i phyir nges par 'byung ba'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yang phyir mi ldog pa'i phyir nges par 'byung ba'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is definite emergence because there is no return.

original: gtan du ba ma yin pa ni nges par 'byung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: gtan du ba ma yin pa ni nges par 'byung ba ma yin no //
translated: That which is not permanent is not definite emergence.

original: lam lta bur gyur pa'i phyir lam mo zhes bya ba ni lam dang chos mthun pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: lam lta bur gyur pa'i phyir lam mo zhes bya ba ni lam dang chos mthun pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is the path because it is like a path. This means that it is similar to a path.

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin zhugs pa'i phyir rigs pa'o zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin zhugs pa ma yin pa ni rigs pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin zhugs pa'i phyir rigs pa'o zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin zhugs pa ma yin pa ni rigs pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is reasonable because it is in accordance with reality.üîΩIt is a practice because it is definite.

original: so sor nges pa'i phyir sgrub pa ste zhes bya ba la so sor nges pa nyid ni mya ngan las 'das par nges pa nyid do //
analyzed: so sor nges pa'i phyir sgrub pa ste zhes bya ba la so sor nges pa nyid ni mya ngan las 'das par nges pa nyid do //
translated: It is a practice because it is definite, since it is definite in nirvana.

original: de nyid kyis des 'gro ba'i phyir ro //üîΩde @302b nyid la dbyangs ni /
analyzed: de nyid kyis des 'gro ba'i phyir ro // de @302b nyid la dbyangs ni /
translated: It is a practice because it is the path to that.

original: ji skad du zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: ji skad du zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba'o //
translated: The same is stated in the following verse:üîΩOr, for those who practice the views of permanence, happiness, mine, and self,

original: yang na rtag pa dang bde ba dang bdag gi dang bdag tu lta ba spyad pa rnams kyi zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: yang na rtag pa dang bde ba dang bdag gi dang bdag tu lta ba spyad pa rnams kyi zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: the aspects of impermanence, etc.üîΩare the aspects of the truth of suffering.

original: de la 'du byed rnams rtag go snyam du lta ba spyad pa rnams la ni mi rtag pa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'du byed rnams rtag go snyam du lta ba spyad pa rnams la ni mi rtag pa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: For those who practice the view that formations are permanent, the aspect of impermanence is the aspect of the truth of suffering.

original: 'du byed rnams bde'o snyam du lta ba spyad pa rnams ni sdug bsngal ba'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: 'du byed rnams bde'o snyam du lta ba spyad pa rnams ni sdug bsngal ba'i rnam pa'o //
translated: For those who practice the view that formations are happy, the aspect of suffering is the aspect of the truth of suffering.

original: 'du byed rnams bdag gi'o snyam du lta ba spyad pa rnams la ni stong pa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: 'du byed rnams bdag gi'o snyam du lta ba spyad pa rnams la ni stong pa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: For those who practice the view that the formative forces are mine, the aspect of emptiness.

original: 'du byed rnams bdag yin no snyam du lta ba spyad pa rnams la ni bdag med pa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: 'du byed rnams bdag yin no snyam du lta ba spyad pa rnams la ni bdag med pa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: For those who practice the view that the formative forces are the self, the aspect of selflessness.

original: 'du byed rnams rgyu med pa'o snyam du lta ba spyad pa rnams la ni rgyu'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: 'du byed rnams rgyu med pa'o snyam du lta ba spyad pa rnams la ni rgyu'i rnam pa'o //
translated: For those who practice the view that the formative forces are causeless, the aspect of cause.

original: thams cad kyi rgyu dbang phyug la sogs pa gcig pu'o snyam du lta ba spyad pa rnams la ni kun 'byung ba'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad kyi rgyu dbang phyug la sogs pa gcig pu'o snyam du lta ba spyad pa rnams la ni kun 'byung ba'i rnam pa'o //
translated: For those who practice the view that the cause of all is a single one such as the Lord, the aspect of origination.

original: 'gyur bar lta ba spyad pa rnams la ni rab tu skye ba'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: 'gyur bar lta ba spyad pa rnams la ni rab tu skye ba'i rnam pa'o //
translated: For those who practice the view of transformation, the aspect of complete transformation.

original: dang por 'byung zhing rab tu skye ba yin gyi 'gyur ba ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //üîΩyang na 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni rga ba'i rnam grangs so //
analyzed: dang por 'byung zhing rab tu skye ba yin gyi 'gyur ba ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'o // yang na 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni rga ba'i rnam grangs so //
translated: It is the first arising and complete transformation, not transformation.

original: rab tu skye ba'i zhes bya ba ni skye ba'i rnam grangs so //
analyzed: rab tu skye ba'i zhes bya ba ni skye ba'i rnam grangs so //
translated: Alternatively, transformation is a synonym for aging and complete transformation is a synonym for birth.

original: blo sngon du gtong bar byed pa po yin no snyam du lta ba spyad pa rnams la rkyen gyi rnam pa ste /
analyzed: blo sngon du gtong bar byed pa po yin no snyam du lta ba spyad pa rnams la rkyen gyi rnam pa ste /
translated: The aspect of condition is for those who practice the view that the self is the agent that precedes the mind.

original: rkyen gyi tshig ni sngon du ma btang ba'i rgyu'i tshig go //
analyzed: rkyen gyi tshig ni sngon du ma btang ba'i rgyu'i tshig go //
translated: The word condition is a causal word that is not preceded by the word for.

original: thog ma med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: thog ma med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: As for beginningless, etc.,

original: skye ba'i rgyun la thog ma bzhin du tha ma yang med do snyam du gang dag log par lta ba gang yin pa de'i gnyen por 'gog pa'i rnam pa yin no //
analyzed: skye ba'i rgyun la thog ma bzhin du tha ma yang med do snyam du gang dag log par lta ba gang yin pa de'i gnyen por 'gog pa'i rnam pa yin no //
translated: the aspect of cessation is the antidote to the wrong view that there is no end, just as there is no beginning, in the continuum of birth.

original: yul nye bar longs spyod pa med pa'i phyir dang ; sdug bsngal ni thar pa yin no snyam du lta ba spyad pa rnams kyi gnyen por ni zhi ba'i rnam pa yin no //
analyzed: yul nye bar longs spyod pa med pa'i phyir dang ; sdug bsngal ni thar pa yin no snyam du lta ba spyad pa rnams kyi gnyen por ni zhi ba'i rnam pa yin no //
translated: The aspect of peace is the antidote to the view that pleasure is liberation for those who practice the view that there is no enjoyment of objects.

original: de lta na ni 'o na zhes rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: de lta na ni 'o na zhes rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: If that is so, then, as the root text says,

original: sems dang sems las byung ba thams cad rnam pa dang bcas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba thams cad rnam pa dang bcas zhes bya'o //
translated: all minds and mental factors are said to have aspects.

original: gal te shes rab kyi rnam pa de yis sems dang sems las byung ba lhag ma rnams kyi rnam pa nyid du grub po zhe na /
analyzed: gal te shes rab kyi rnam pa de yis sems dang sems las byung ba lhag ma rnams kyi rnam pa nyid du grub po zhe na /
translated: If you say that the aspect of wisdom is established as the aspect of the remaining minds and mental factors,

original: de dang mtshungs par ldan pa la shes rab kyis ni mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: de dang mtshungs par ldan pa la shes rab kyis ni mi 'grub ste /
translated: then it is not established as being concomitant with them,

original: de dang ldan pas shes rab gzhan dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde lta bu ni rig par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni mdo sde @303a * //
analyzed: de dang ldan pas shes rab gzhan dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir ro // de lta bu ni rig par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni mdo sde @303a * //
translated: because it is concomitant with another wisdom.

original: pa'i lugs yin no //
analyzed: pa'i lugs yin no //
translated: This is the Sautrantika system.üîΩThe Vaibhasikas say:

original: dmigs pa smos pas bye brag dang rnam pa zhes bya ba ste /üîΩnges pa'i tshig gi tshul gyis dmigs pa zhes bya ba 'dir rnam par bzung nas bye brag ces bya'o //üîΩde'i phyir rnam pa'i sgras bzung nas rnam pa zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: dmigs pa smos pas bye brag dang rnam pa zhes bya ba ste / nges pa'i tshig gi tshul gyis dmigs pa zhes bya ba 'dir rnam par bzung nas bye brag ces bya'o // de'i phyir rnam pa'i sgras bzung nas rnam pa zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The word ‚Äúobject‚Äù refers to the specific and the aspect.üîΩThe word ‚Äúobject‚Äù is taken here in the sense of a verbal root.üîΩThe word ‚Äúspecific‚Äù is taken in the sense of the verbal root ‚Äúto go,‚Äù because it is that to which one goes.

original: dmigs pa smos pa'i tshul gang gis dmigs pa bzung ba'i bye brag ni mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa smos pa'i tshul gang gis dmigs pa bzung ba'i bye brag ni mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúaspect‚Äù is taken in the sense of the verbal root ‚Äúto look,‚Äù because it is that by which one looks.üîΩThe specific is the object that is taken by the aspect.

original: 'di'i dmigs pa smos pas yul nyid kyi bye brag yod pa nyid de rnam pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: 'di'i dmigs pa smos pas yul nyid kyi bye brag yod pa nyid de rnam pa dang bcas pa'o //
translated: Since its object is mentioned, it is the existence of the object itself, along with its aspects.

original: de ltar na shes rab rnam pa dang bcas par grub po //
analyzed: de ltar na shes rab rnam pa dang bcas par grub po //
translated: Thus, wisdom is established as having aspects.

original: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re /
analyzed: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re /
translated: Master Samghabhadra says:

original: shes rab dang mtshungs par ldan pa las rnam pa dang bcas par brjod pa med do //
analyzed: shes rab dang mtshungs par ldan pa las rnam pa dang bcas par brjod pa med do //
translated: It is not said to have aspects due to being concomitant with wisdom.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: mthun pa'i rnam pa ni rnam pa dang bcas te zag pa dang bcas pa nyid do //
analyzed: mthun pa'i rnam pa ni rnam pa dang bcas te zag pa dang bcas pa nyid do //
translated: It has aspects due to having compatible aspects, which means having defilements.

original: dper na zag pa dang mthun pas zag pa dang bcas pa ste zag pa nyid kyi gnyen po yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dper na zag pa dang mthun pas zag pa dang bcas pa ste zag pa nyid kyi gnyen po yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For example, it is said to have defilements because it is compatible with defilements, because it is the antidote to defilements themselves.

original: de bzhin du dus mtshungs par 'dzin par byed pas rnam pa dang bcas pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du dus mtshungs par 'dzin par byed pas rnam pa dang bcas pa ste /
translated: Similarly, it has aspects because it apprehends objects simultaneously,

original: snga ma dang phyi ma ma yin par cig car du zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: snga ma dang phyi ma ma yin par cig car du zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: meaning it apprehends them all at once, not sequentially.

original: de ltar na 'o na shes rab kyi rnam pa nyid du mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: de ltar na 'o na shes rab kyi rnam pa nyid du mi 'grub ste /
translated: If that is so, then wisdom is not established as having aspects,

original: dmigs pa thams cad kyi 'jug pa'i rnam pa yin pas so //
analyzed: dmigs pa thams cad kyi 'jug pa'i rnam pa yin pas so //
translated: because it has the aspects of engaging all objects.

original: lhag ma rnams kyis rnam pa'i bdag nyid ma yin pa'i phyir 'dri ba ni /
analyzed: lhag ma rnams kyis rnam pa'i bdag nyid ma yin pa'i phyir 'dri ba ni /
translated: The remaining faculties are not the nature of aspects.üîΩTherefore, the question is asked: ‚ÄúDoes only wisdom apprehend?‚Äù

original: yang ci shes rab kho na 'dzin par byed dam zhes bya ba ste sgrub pa dang 'dzin par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //üîΩdang bcas pa'i dmigs pa dang bcas pa 'dzin par byed ces bya ba la rigs pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: yang ci shes rab kho na 'dzin par byed dam zhes bya ba ste sgrub pa dang 'dzin par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go // dang bcas pa'i dmigs pa dang bcas pa 'dzin par byed ces bya ba la rigs pa gang zhe na /
translated: That is, does it alone apprehend and grasp?üîΩWhat is the reason that the S≈´tra says that the faculty of coming to know what was not known and the faculty of perfect knowledge grasp the object and the faculty of final and perfect knowledge grasps the object together with its aspects?

original: shes rab kyi yul 'dzin par byed pas rnam pa ste rang gi ngo bo nyid las so //
analyzed: shes rab kyi yul 'dzin par byed pas rnam pa ste rang gi ngo bo nyid las so //
translated: The aspect is that which grasps the object of wisdom, i.e., its own nature.

original: shes rab las ma gtogs pa'i dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i rnam pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: shes rab las ma gtogs pa'i dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i rnam pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: There is no object together with its aspects that is not the object of wisdom.

original: ci ltar 'dzin par byed ce na shes rab dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ci ltar 'dzin par byed ce na shes rab dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir zhes bya'o //
translated: How does it grasp? It grasps through being associated with wisdom.

original: gal te tshor ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir shes rab la sogs pa tshor ba byed par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te tshor ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir shes rab la sogs pa tshor ba byed par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If it grasps through being associated with feeling, then wisdom and so on would be feeling.

original: 'di la slob dpon 'dus bzang gis ni rnam pa zhes bya ba 'di shes rab kyi rnam grangs su gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di la slob dpon 'dus bzang gis ni rnam pa zhes bya ba 'di shes rab kyi rnam grangs su gsungs te /
translated: Master Sa·πÖghabhadra says that this so-called aspect is a synonym for wisdom.

original: yul smos pa dang dang po'i rgyu zhes bya ba rnam grangs yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: yul smos pa dang dang po'i rgyu zhes bya ba rnam grangs yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, ‚Äúobject‚Äù and ‚Äúcause of the first‚Äù are synonyms.

original: rnam pa'i mtshan nyid @303b shes rab ces mi bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa'i mtshan nyid @303b shes rab ces mi bya'o //
translated: The characteristic of an aspect is not called wisdom.

original: tshor ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa de yul gyi rgyur rig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshor ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa de yul gyi rgyur rig par 'gyur ro //
translated: The characteristic of feeling, etc., is known as the cause of the object.

original: dmigs pa ji lta bar shes pa'i phyir yul dang shes rab kyis rab tu shes shing 'dzin par byed pas kyang zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa ji lta bar shes pa'i phyir yul dang shes rab kyis rab tu shes shing 'dzin par byed pas kyang zhes bya'o //
translated: Because it knows objects as they are, it is also called ‚Äúobject‚Äù and ‚Äúwisdom‚Äù because it fully knows and grasps them.

original: de bzhin du dmigs par 'du shes pa'i phyir 'du shes kyi yul kun tu shes pa dang 'dzin par byed pas kyang nges par bstan to //
analyzed: de bzhin du dmigs par 'du shes pa'i phyir 'du shes kyi yul kun tu shes pa dang 'dzin par byed pas kyang nges par bstan to //
translated: Similarly, because it is the perception of the object, it is also taught as ‚Äúperception‚Äù because it fully knows and grasps the object.

original: rnam par shes pas kyang dmigs shing rnam par shes pa'i phyir yongs su shes pa dang 'dzin par byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pas kyang dmigs shing rnam par shes pa'i phyir yongs su shes pa dang 'dzin par byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because it fully knows and grasps the object, it is also called ‚Äúconsciousness‚Äù because it is conscious of the object.

original: kyang zhes bya ba ni de lta bu la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: kyang zhes bya ba ni de lta bu la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAlso‚Äù means ‚Äúin that way and so on.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir dmigs smos pa rnam pa'i rnam grangs yin pa'i phyir shes rab las ma gtogs pas kyang 'dzin par byed do zhes bstan par 'thad do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir dmigs smos pa rnam pa'i rnam grangs yin pa'i phyir shes rab las ma gtogs pas kyang 'dzin par byed do zhes bstan par 'thad do zhes zer ro //
translated: Therefore, since the phrase ‚Äúin that way‚Äù is a synonym for ‚Äúin that way and so on,‚Äù it is reasonable to explain that ‚Äúgrasping‚Äù is not separate from wisdom.

original: gal te shes rab kyi rnam grangs tsam rnam pa'i sgras mi brjod na /
analyzed: gal te shes rab kyi rnam grangs tsam rnam pa'i sgras mi brjod na /
translated: If the word ‚Äúin that way‚Äù does not refer to a synonym for wisdom,

original: 'di'i don gyis yul yod do zhes brjod par mi bya'o //üîΩshes rab kyi rnam pas 'dzin par bya ba dang 'dzin par byed pas kyang ste /
analyzed: 'di'i don gyis yul yod do zhes brjod par mi bya'o // shes rab kyi rnam pas 'dzin par bya ba dang 'dzin par byed pas kyang ste /
translated: then it should not be said that the object exists in the sense of being a referent of that word.üîΩ‚ÄúIn that way‚Äù means ‚Äúin the way that wisdom grasps.‚Äù

original: de ltar shes rab kyis shes rab 'dzin par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar shes rab kyis shes rab 'dzin par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: Wisdom does not grasp wisdom.

original: kyang zhes bya ba 'dis cung zad bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: kyang zhes bya ba 'dis cung zad bshad pa yin no //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù indicates that there is more to be said.

original: gal te thog ma med na khyad par yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te thog ma med na khyad par yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: If there is no beginning, there is no difference.

original: de'i phyir rnam pa'i sgra ni 'dir khyad par gyi don du shes pa'o ;
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam pa'i sgra ni 'dir khyad par gyi don du shes pa'o ;
translated: Therefore, the word ‚Äúin that way‚Äù should be understood here as having the sense of difference.

original: / shes rab kyi rnam grangs ni ma yin no //
analyzed: / shes rab kyi rnam grangs ni ma yin no //
translated: It does not refer to a synonym for wisdom.

original: de ltar na 'di la dmigs pa rnam pa'i bdag nyid ma yin pa'i phyir 'dzin par byed pa dang 'dzin pa yang rnam pa zhes bya bar mi rigs so //
analyzed: de ltar na 'di la dmigs pa rnam pa'i bdag nyid ma yin pa'i phyir 'dzin par byed pa dang 'dzin pa yang rnam pa zhes bya bar mi rigs so //
translated: Thus, since the object is not of the nature of an aspect, it is not tenable to call the apprehender and the apprehended ‚Äúaspects.‚Äù

original: yod pa thams cad gzung bya yin zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yod pa thams cad gzung bya yin zhes bya ba ni /
translated: All that exists is the apprehended.

original: gang cung zad rdzas su yod pa'am btags par yod pa de thams cad gzung bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gang cung zad rdzas su yod pa'am btags par yod pa de thams cad gzung bar bya ba yin no //
translated: Whatever exists substantially or is imputedly existent is all apprehended.

original: 'dir yod pa smos pa ni med pa bzlog par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dir yod pa smos pa ni med pa bzlog par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Here, the word ‚Äúexists‚Äù is used to exclude non-existence.

original: thams cad smos pa ni rdzas dang kun rdzob nye bar gzung bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad smos pa ni rdzas dang kun rdzob nye bar gzung bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The word ‚Äúall‚Äù is used to include substantial and superficial realities.

original: de ltar byas nas zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: de ltar byas nas zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: Having done that,

original: shes rab ni rnam pa yang yin te de'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes rab ni rnam pa yang yin te de'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: wisdom is an aspect because it has that as its nature.

original: 'dzin par byed pa yang yin te dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dzin par byed pa yang yin te dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is an apprehender because it has an object.

original: gzung bar bya ba yang yin te yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzung bar bya ba yang yin te yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the apprehended because it exists.

original: dmigs pa med pa rnams ni gzung bar bya ba kho na yin no zhes bya ba ni /üîΩdmigs pa med pa'i phyir @304a * //
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa rnams ni gzung bar bya ba kho na yin no zhes bya ba ni / dmigs pa med pa'i phyir @304a * //
translated: Those that are not objects are only objects of observation.

original: dang rnam pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dang rnam pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are not objects and because they are not aspects.

original: dge ba la sogs pa'i bye brag bstan par bya ste zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dge ba la sogs pa'i bye brag bstan par bya ste zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The distinction of virtue, etc., should be stated.

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa dang / sa dang rten la sogs pa'i bye brag bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa dang / sa dang rten la sogs pa'i bye brag bstan par bya ste /
translated: The distinction of virtue, nonvirtue, indeterminate, realm, stage, basis, etc., should be stated.

original: dang po rnam gsum zhes bya ba ni zag pa dang bcas pa yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: dang po rnam gsum zhes bya ba ni zag pa dang bcas pa yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The first three are of three types, because they are only contaminated.

original: gzhan rnams dge zhes bya ba ni zag pa med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan rnams dge zhes bya ba ni zag pa med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The others are virtuous, because they are uncontaminated.

original: tshigs su bcad pa'i dang po na yod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa'i dang po na yod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Because they exist in the first verse.

original: shes pa zag bcas zag pa med //
analyzed: shes pa zag bcas zag pa med //
translated: Contaminated and uncontaminated knowledge.

original: ces bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa der kun rdzob shes pa dang por 'don pa yin no //
analyzed: ces bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa der kun rdzob shes pa dang por 'don pa yin no //
translated: In that verse, conventional knowledge is mentioned first.

original: dang po sa rnams thams cad na //
analyzed: dang po sa rnams thams cad na //
translated: All the stages are the first.

original: zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob shes pa ni rang gi ngo bo dmigs pa'i sgo nas 'dod pa'i khams nas srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar du dmigs so //üîΩdrug na chos zhes bya ba ni //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob shes pa ni rang gi ngo bo dmigs pa'i sgo nas 'dod pa'i khams nas srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar du dmigs so // drug na chos zhes bya ba ni //
translated: Conventional knowledge focuses on its own nature and on the desire realm up to the summit of existence, because it focuses on the contaminated and uncontaminated.üîΩThe others focus on nine.

original: de dag gcig tu zag pa dang bcas pa'i phyir mi lcogs pa med pa las gzhan pa'i nye bar bsdogs pa dag med la /
analyzed: de dag gcig tu zag pa dang bcas pa'i phyir mi lcogs pa med pa las gzhan pa'i nye bar bsdogs pa dag med la /
translated: The others are the six types of Dharma knowledge, because they do not exist in the access concentrations other than the unrestricted state, since they are exclusively contaminated.

original: 'dod pa'i khams la dmigs pa'i phyir gzugs med pa'i sa dag na yang med do //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams la dmigs pa'i phyir gzugs med pa'i sa dag na yang med do //
translated: They also do not exist in the formless realm levels, because they focus on the desire realm.üîΩThe others focus on nine.

original: dgun rdzas zhes bya ba zhes bya ba ni mi lcogs pa med pa la sogs pa rnams gong ma'i sdug bsngal la sogs pa dmigs pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: dgun rdzas zhes bya ba zhes bya ba ni mi lcogs pa med pa la sogs pa rnams gong ma'i sdug bsngal la sogs pa dmigs pa'i phyir la /
translated: The others are the access concentrations of unrestricted states and so on, because they focus on the suffering of higher realms and so on.

original: bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs pa'i nyer bsdogs rnams dang / srid pa'i rtse mo ni gcig tu zag pa dang bcas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs pa'i nyer bsdogs rnams dang / srid pa'i rtse mo ni gcig tu zag pa dang bcas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The access concentrations of the second absorption and so on and the summit of existence focus on nine levels, because they are exclusively contaminated.üîΩThe others do not exist.

original: gzhan na med ces bya ba ni nyer bsdogs dang bsam gtan gzhan dag na med pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan na med ces bya ba ni nyer bsdogs dang bsam gtan gzhan dag na med pa'o //
translated: The others do not exist in the access concentrations and other absorptions.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na yul phra ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na yul phra ba'i phyir te /
translated: Why? Because the object is subtle.

original: de ni gzhan gyi rgyud du gtogs pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i yul can yin la de dag kyang phra bas so //
analyzed: de ni gzhan gyi rgyud du gtogs pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i yul can yin la de dag kyang phra bas so //
translated: It has as its object the minds and mental factors of other continuities, and they are subtle.

original: der yang lam dman pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: der yang lam dman pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Also, the inferior path does not exist there.

original: der gzhan gyi sems shes pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: der gzhan gyi sems shes pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: The knowledge of others' minds does not exist there,

original: gzugs med pa rnams su sbyor ba mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs med pa rnams su sbyor ba mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is impossible to prepare for it in the formless realm.

original: mngon par shes pa'i rang gi ngo bo las ni sa gzhan du ma yin te /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa'i rang gi ngo bo las ni sa gzhan du ma yin te /
translated: It does not exist on other levels, because it is not the essence of higher perception.

original: 'dod pa dang gzugs kyi khams dag tu'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang gzugs kyi khams dag tu'o //
translated: It exists in the desire and form realms.

original: des zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: des zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: It is not manifest there.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams na gzhan gyi sems shes pa mngon du byed pa med de /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams na gzhan gyi sems shes pa mngon du byed pa med de /
translated: The knowledge of others' minds does not manifest in the formless realm,

original: de'i sa pa'i gzhan gyi sems pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i sa pa'i gzhan gyi sems pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no other mind of that level.

original: sa 'og ma pa'i de'i rjes su @304b 'brang ba mngon du gyur par mi nus pa'i gzugs med pa'i khams na de mngon du gyur pa med do //
analyzed: sa 'og ma pa'i de'i rjes su @304b 'brang ba mngon du gyur par mi nus pa'i gzugs med pa'i khams na de mngon du gyur pa med do //
translated: The knowledge of others' minds does not manifest in the formless realm, because it is impossible for the knowledge of others' minds of lower levels to manifest there.

original: chos shes bya ba 'dod rten can //
analyzed: chos shes bya ba 'dod rten can //
translated: The knowledge of the dharmas has a desire realm basis.

original: zhes bya ba la ni'i sgra ni nges par gzung ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la ni'i sgra ni nges par gzung ba'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúonly‚Äù is for the sake of emphasis.

original: chos shes pa 'dod pa'i rten can kho na yin gyi gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i rten can ni ma yin te /
analyzed: chos shes pa 'dod pa'i rten can kho na yin gyi gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i rten can ni ma yin te /
translated: The knowledge of the dharmas has only a desire realm basis, not a form realm or formless realm basis,

original: snyoms par 'jug pa de kun nas bslang ba'i sems rnams 'dod pa'i khams kho na na yod pa'i phyir dang de'i rjes su 'jug pa'i rten med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa de kun nas bslang ba'i sems rnams 'dod pa'i khams kho na na yod pa'i phyir dang de'i rjes su 'jug pa'i rten med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the minds that motivate that meditative attainment exist only in the desire realm and because there is no basis for that which is subsequent to it.

original: rjes su 'jug pa'i tshul khrims ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i 'byung ba rnams kyi rten can nyid de /
analyzed: rjes su 'jug pa'i tshul khrims ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i 'byung ba rnams kyi rten can nyid de /
translated: Subsequent morality has a basis in the elements of the desire realm.

original: tshul khrims 'chal ba kun nas bslang ba'i nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshul khrims 'chal ba kun nas bslang ba'i nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the antidote to the afflictions that motivate immorality.

original: de dag kyang de na yod pa ma yin pas /
analyzed: de dag kyang de na yod pa ma yin pas /
translated: Since those do not exist there,

original: chos shes pa 'dod pa'i rten can kho na yin no //
analyzed: chos shes pa 'dod pa'i rten can kho na yin no //
translated: the knowledge of the dharmas has only a desire realm basis.

original: gzhan gyi sems shes pa dang chos shes pa ma gtogs so zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems shes pa dang chos shes pa ma gtogs so zhes bya ba la /
translated: Except for the knowledge of the minds of others and the knowledge of the dharmas.

original: de yang kun rdzob shes pa dang rjes su shes pa dang sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba dang 'gog pa dang lam shes pa dang zad pa shes pa dang mi skye ba shes pa rnams so //
analyzed: de yang kun rdzob shes pa dang rjes su shes pa dang sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba dang 'gog pa dang lam shes pa dang zad pa shes pa dang mi skye ba shes pa rnams so //
translated: They are conventional knowledge, subsequent knowledge, knowledge of suffering, knowledge of origin, knowledge of cessation, knowledge of the path, knowledge of elimination, and knowledge of nonarising.üîΩKnowledge of cessation is one, which is the application of mindfulness to phenomena.

original: 'gog pa shes pa ni gcig ste chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa yin no zhes bya ba ni 'gog pa lus dang tshor ba dang sems dang mtshan nyid mi mthun pa'i phyir chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'gog pa shes pa ni gcig ste chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa yin no zhes bya ba ni 'gog pa lus dang tshor ba dang sems dang mtshan nyid mi mthun pa'i phyir chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la dmigs pa yin no //
translated: Knowledge of cessation is the application of mindfulness to phenomena because cessation is not compatible with the body, feelings, or mind.

original: gzhan gyi sems shes pa ni tshor ba dang sems dang chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams yin pas lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems shes pa ni tshor ba dang sems dang chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams yin pas lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ma yin no //
translated: Knowledge of others' minds is the applications of mindfulness to feelings, mind, and phenomena, and is not the application of mindfulness to the body.

original: gzugs med pa'i yul can yin pa'i phyir chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa go ji ltar yin zhe na tshor ba ma gtogs pa'i sems las byung ba'i dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i yul can yin pa'i phyir chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa go ji ltar yin zhe na tshor ba ma gtogs pa'i sems las byung ba'i dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: How is it the application of mindfulness to phenomena, since it has formless states as its object? It is the object of mental factors other than feeling.

original: lhag ma bzhi yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: lhag ma bzhi yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The remaining four are the remaining four.

original: lhag ma ni shes pa brgyad de /
analyzed: lhag ma ni shes pa brgyad de /
translated: The remaining four are the remaining eight knowledges.

original: de la kun rdzob shes pa ni thams cad kyi yul can yin pas dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi yin no //
analyzed: de la kun rdzob shes pa ni thams cad kyi yul can yin pas dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi yin no //
translated: Conventional knowledge has all as its object, therefore it is the four foundations of mindfulness.

original: chos shes pa ni sdug bsngal la sogs pa la dmigs pas bzhi yin no //
analyzed: chos shes pa ni sdug bsngal la sogs pa la dmigs pas bzhi yin no //
translated: Knowledge of the truth of the path is the four foundations of mindfulness.

original: rjes su shes pa yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: rjes su shes pa yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: Knowledge of subsequent reality is also like that.

original: sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung dang lam dang zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa rnams ni re re zhing dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi bzhi yin te phung po lnga la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung dang lam dang zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa rnams ni re re zhing dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi bzhi yin te phung po lnga la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Knowledge of the truths of suffering, origin, path, elimination, and nonarising are each the four foundations of mindfulness because they focus on the five aggregates.

original: rjes su shes pa @305a * //üîΩma gtogs so zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rjes su shes pa @305a * // ma gtogs so zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Except for subsequent knowledge.

original: chos shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa lam shes pa'i dmigs pa ni sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam dang / zad pa dang / mi skye ba shes pa dang / gzhan gyi sems shes pa rnams so //
analyzed: chos shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa lam shes pa'i dmigs pa ni sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam dang / zad pa dang / mi skye ba shes pa dang / gzhan gyi sems shes pa rnams so //
translated: The object of knowledge of the truth of the path that is compatible with knowledge of the truth of the path is the knowledge of the truths of suffering, origin, cessation, path, elimination, and nonarising and knowledge of others' minds.

original: sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung la chos shes pa dag gi dmigs pa ni kun rdzob shes pa 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal dang de kun 'byung bas bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung la chos shes pa dag gi dmigs pa ni kun rdzob shes pa 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal dang de kun 'byung bas bsdus pa'o //
translated: The focal object of Dharma knowledge of the truths of suffering and origin is the suffering and origin of the desire realm subsumed by conventional knowledge.

original: rjes su shes pa ni thams cad du chos shes pa'i dmigs pa ma yin te yul tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su shes pa ni thams cad du chos shes pa'i dmigs pa ma yin te yul tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Subsequent knowledge is never the focal object of Dharma knowledge because they are different objects.

original: lam rjes blo yi dgu yin no //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: lam rjes blo yi dgu yin no // zhes bya ba la /
translated: The nine are the focal object of subsequent knowledge of the path.üîΩThe nine knowledges are the focal object of subsequent knowledge of the path.

original: rjes su shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa sdug bsngal la sogs pa shes pa la ni de'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i lam shes pa kho nas dmigs la /
analyzed: rjes su shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa sdug bsngal la sogs pa shes pa la ni de'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i lam shes pa kho nas dmigs la /
translated: Subsequent knowledge of the truths of suffering and so on focuses on the path that is compatible with it.

original: kun rdzob shes pa khams gong ma'i sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung gis bsdus pa la ni sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung la chos shes pa dag kho nas dmigs so //
analyzed: kun rdzob shes pa khams gong ma'i sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung gis bsdus pa la ni sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung la chos shes pa dag kho nas dmigs so //
translated: Conventional knowledge focuses on the suffering and origin of higher realms subsumed by the truths of suffering and origin.

original: thams cad du chos shes pa dang rjes su shes pa dag gi dmigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: thams cad du chos shes pa dang rjes su shes pa dag gi dmigs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is never the focal object of Dharma knowledge or subsequent knowledge.

original: des na lam shes pa yul tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des na lam shes pa yul tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the object of path knowledge is different.

original: kun rdzob shes pa ma gtogs so zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: kun rdzob shes pa ma gtogs so zhes bya ba la /
translated: Except for conventional knowledge.

original: lam shes pa ni lam la dmigs pas de'i dmigs pa ni shes pa zag pa med pa dgu yin te de dag lam gyi bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lam shes pa ni lam la dmigs pas de'i dmigs pa ni shes pa zag pa med pa dgu yin te de dag lam gyi bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Path knowledge focuses on the path, so its focal object is the nine uncontaminated knowledges, because they are the nature of the path.

original: kun rdzob shes pa ni ma yin te zag pa dang bcas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun rdzob shes pa ni ma yin te zag pa dang bcas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Conventional knowledge is not, because it is contaminated.

original: sdug bsngal rgyu blo'i gnyis yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sdug bsngal rgyu blo'i gnyis yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: The two of the minds of suffering and cause are.üîΩConventional knowledge is the focal object of the knowledge of suffering and origin because it is included in the truths of suffering and origin.

original: kun rdzob shes pa ni sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung gi nang du gtogs pa'i phyir sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung shes pa dag gi dmigs pa yin no zhes bya bar rtogs na gzhan gyi sems shes pa ni ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: kun rdzob shes pa ni sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung gi nang du gtogs pa'i phyir sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung shes pa dag gi dmigs pa yin no zhes bya bar rtogs na gzhan gyi sems shes pa ni ji ltar zhe na /
translated: If one understands that, how is knowledge of others' minds?

original: gzhan gyi sems pa'i phyogs gcig kyang sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung gis bsdus pa yod de zag pa dang bcas pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems pa'i phyogs gcig kyang sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung gis bsdus pa yod de zag pa dang bcas pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: One part of the mind of another is also included in the truths of suffering and origin, because it is contaminated.

original: bzhi 'am bcu yin no zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
analyzed: bzhi 'am bcu yin no zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
translated: It is said, Four or ten.

original: de la kun rdzob shes pa ni thams cad kyi yul can yin pa'i phyir shes pa bcu la dmigs so zhes bya ba rtogs na /
analyzed: de la kun rdzob shes pa ni thams cad kyi yul can yin pa'i phyir shes pa bcu la dmigs so zhes bya ba rtogs na /
translated: Conventional knowledge focuses on ten knowledges because it is the subject of all objects.

original: ji ltar gzhan gyi sems shes pa'i dmigs pa shes pa bcu yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar gzhan gyi sems shes pa'i dmigs pa shes pa bcu yin zhe na /
translated: If one understands that, then why is the object of knowledge of others' minds the ten knowledges?

original: gzhan gyi sems shes pa ni chos dang rjes @305b dang lam dang kun rdzob shes pas bsdus pa yin la /
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems shes pa ni chos dang rjes @305b dang lam dang kun rdzob shes pas bsdus pa yin la /
translated: Knowledge of others' minds is subsumed by Dharma, subsequent, path and conventional knowledge.

original: de'i dmigs pa ni rnam par ma phye bar shes pa bcu yin la /
analyzed: de'i dmigs pa ni rnam par ma phye bar shes pa bcu yin la /
translated: Its focal object is the ten knowledges without differentiation.

original: dbye ba ni chos dang rjes kyis bsdus pa dag gis ni shes pa brgyad do //
analyzed: dbye ba ni chos dang rjes kyis bsdus pa dag gis ni shes pa brgyad do //
translated: If differentiated, those subsumed by Dharma and subsequent knowledge are eight knowledges.

original: lam shes pas bsdus pa yis ni dgu'o //
analyzed: lam shes pas bsdus pa yis ni dgu'o //
translated: Those subsumed by path knowledge are nine.

original: kun rdzob shes pas bsdus pa yis ni kun rdzob shes pa dang gzhan gyi sems shes pa gnyis so //
analyzed: kun rdzob shes pas bsdus pa yis ni kun rdzob shes pa dang gzhan gyi sems shes pa gnyis so //
translated: Those subsumed by conventional knowledge are two: conventional knowledge and knowledge of others' minds.

original: ji ltar zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa dag gi dmigs pa shes pa bcu yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa dag gi dmigs pa shes pa bcu yin zhe na /
translated: Why are the objects of knowledge of elimination and nonarising the ten knowledges?

original: zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa dag ni bdag gi lam bsgom ste yang bsgom du med do zhes chos dang rjes su shes pa'i lam la dmigs pa yin te /üîΩde'i phyir shes pa zag pa med pa dgu la dmigs la sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung gi bden pa la dmigs pa'i zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa dag ni bdag gi sdug bsngal yongs su shes par bya ste yang yongs su shes par byar med /
analyzed: zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa dag ni bdag gi lam bsgom ste yang bsgom du med do zhes chos dang rjes su shes pa'i lam la dmigs pa yin te / de'i phyir shes pa zag pa med pa dgu la dmigs la sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung gi bden pa la dmigs pa'i zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa dag ni bdag gi sdug bsngal yongs su shes par bya ste yang yongs su shes par byar med /
translated: The knowledge of elimination and nonarising focus on the Dharma and subsequent knowledges of the path, since they focus on the path and think, I have meditated on the path of the arya and there is no more to meditate on.

original: kun 'byung spangs te yang yongs su spang du med do zhes sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung gis bsdus pa'i kun rdzob shes pa la dmigs so //üîΩdbye na ni chos shes pas bsdus pa dag gi dmigs pa ni rjes su shes pa ma yin la /
analyzed: kun 'byung spangs te yang yongs su spang du med do zhes sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung gis bsdus pa'i kun rdzob shes pa la dmigs so // dbye na ni chos shes pas bsdus pa dag gi dmigs pa ni rjes su shes pa ma yin la /
translated: The knowledge of elimination and nonarising that focus on the truths of suffering and origin focus on conventional knowledge subsumed by the truths of suffering and origin, since they think, I have fully understood suffering and there is no more to fully understand.üîΩI have abandoned origin and there is no more to abandon.

original: rjes su shes pas bsdus pa dag gis ni chos shes ma yin no //
analyzed: rjes su shes pas bsdus pa dag gis ni chos shes ma yin no //
translated: If classified, those subsumed by Dharma knowledge do not focus on subsequent knowledge and those subsumed by subsequent knowledge do not focus on Dharma knowledge.üîΩThe Compendium of Abhidharma explains:

original: chos 'dus byas rnams la rnam pa brgyad du bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: chos 'dus byas rnams la rnam pa brgyad du bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The conditioned is to be known in eight aspects.

original: 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i chos rnams rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i chos rnams rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Phenomena associated with the desire realm are of two types:

original: mtshungs par ldan pa dang ldan pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: mtshungs par ldan pa dang ldan pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: those that are concomitant and those that are not concomitant.

original: de bzhin du gzugs dang ldan pa yang rnam pa gnyis yin la /
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs dang ldan pa yang rnam pa gnyis yin la /
translated: Similarly, those associated with the form realm are of two types,

original: gzugs med pa dang ldan pa yang rnam pa gnyis yin no //
analyzed: gzugs med pa dang ldan pa yang rnam pa gnyis yin no //
translated: and those associated with the formless realm are of two types.

original: zag pa med pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: zag pa med pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Those that are uncontaminated are also of two types:

original: mtshungs par ldan pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: mtshungs par ldan pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: those that are concomitant and those that are not concomitant.

original: dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i bye brag gis zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i bye brag gis zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The distinction between virtuous and neutral states.

original: dge ba ni so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa ste /
analyzed: dge ba ni so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa ste /
translated: The virtuous state is analytical cessation.

original: thar pa dam pa'i don du dge ba zhes bya ba 'byung ba'i phyir ro //

analyzed: kun rdzob yul ni thams cad do @306a * // zhes bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: chos shes pa ni lnga ste zhes bya ba ni /

analyzed: 'gog pa'i bden pa la dmigs pa'i ni 'dus ma byas dge ba yin te /

analyzed: lam shes pa ni gnyis te zhes bya ba ni zag pa med par mtshungs par ldan pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin pa dag go //

analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams la dmigs pa med pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: gnyis pa ni bzhi dang ldan no zhes thams cad du rgyas par brjod par bya'o //

analyzed: khyad par 'dod pa'i 'bras bu med pa'i phyir dge ba 'dus ma byas rnams yin te /
