analyzed: 'bras bu med pa'i phyir dang rang gi rgyud la mnyam par 'byung ba mi ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are not results and because they do not occur in an equal number in one‚Äôs stream of consciousness.

original: de'i rigs can ma 'ongs pa 'thob pa yin na rigs gzhan ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i rigs can ma 'ongs pa 'thob pa yin na rigs gzhan ni ma yin te /
translated: If one acquires the future state of the same type, one does not acquire a different type,

original: yul gzhan yin zhing bya ba so so ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes kha cig go //
analyzed: yul gzhan yin zhing bya ba so so ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes kha cig go //
translated: because the object and activity are different.

original: 'di ltar sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa skyes pa na bzod pa de nyid ma 'ongs pa de'i rnam pa bzhi 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa skyes pa na bzod pa de nyid ma 'ongs pa de'i rnam pa bzhi 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, when perseverance for the knowledge of the doctrine in regard to suffering arises, one acquires four future states of that perseverance.

original: de bzhin du sdug bsngal la chos shes pa skyes pa na yang de nyid ma 'ongs pa de'i rnam pa bzhi 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du sdug bsngal la chos shes pa skyes pa na yang de nyid ma 'ongs pa de'i rnam pa bzhi 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Similarly, when the knowledge of the doctrine in regard to suffering arises, one acquires four future states of that knowledge.

original: de bzhin du thams cad la brjod par bya'o //üîΩbsgom pa'i lam la ni shes pa skal ba mnyam pa'i rnam pa thob pa yang yin pas de'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin du thams cad la brjod par bya'o // bsgom pa'i lam la ni shes pa skal ba mnyam pa'i rnam pa thob pa yang yin pas de'i phyir /
translated: This should be stated in the same way for all.üîΩOn the path of cultivation, one acquires the aspects of the knowledge of the same stage.

original: ci'i phyir mthong ba'i lam la shes pa 'dra ba'i rnam pa kho na 'thob ces dris te /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mthong ba'i lam la shes pa 'dra ba'i rnam pa kho na 'thob ces dris te /
translated: Therefore, one asks, ‚ÄúWhy does one acquire only the aspects of knowledge similar to those of the path of seeing?‚Äù

original: shes pa thun mong ba las shes pa'i rnam pa kho na dris kyi bzod pa'i rnam pa rnams ma yin no //
analyzed: shes pa thun mong ba las shes pa'i rnam pa kho na dris kyi bzod pa'i rnam pa rnams ma yin no //
translated: The aspect of perseverance is not asked about, but only the aspect of knowledge is asked about, because knowledge is superior to perseverance.

original: de lta ma yin na 'di @308a * //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na 'di @308a * //
translated: If that were not so, then one would have to ask:

original: ltar ci'i phyir mthong ba'i lam la skal ba mnyam pa'i bzod pa dang shes pa'i rnam pa dag 'thob pa nyid yin zhes dri bar bya dgos so //
analyzed: ltar ci'i phyir mthong ba'i lam la skal ba mnyam pa'i bzod pa dang shes pa'i rnam pa dag 'thob pa nyid yin zhes dri bar bya dgos so //
translated: ‚ÄúWhy is it that one obtains the aspects of perseverance and knowledge of the same status on the path of seeing?‚Äù

original: rigs rnams ma 'thob pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rigs rnams ma 'thob pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because the lineages have not been obtained.

original: ji ltar na mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba dang stong pa dang bdag med pa rnam pa bzhi phan tshun skal pa mnyam pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba dang stong pa dang bdag med pa rnam pa bzhi phan tshun skal pa mnyam pa yin zhe na /
translated: How are impermanence, suffering, emptiness, and selflessness mutually of the same status?

original: bzod pa la sogs pas bsdus pa'i phyir dang dmigs pa tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bzod pa la sogs pas bsdus pa'i phyir dang dmigs pa tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are subsumed by perseverance and so on and because their focal objects are undifferentiated.

original: de la sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa skyes na de'i rigs 'thob cing de'i rnam pa bzhi'i rigs 'thob par 'gyur gyi sdug bsngal la chos shes pa la sogs pa rnams la ma yin te /
analyzed: de la sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa skyes na de'i rigs 'thob cing de'i rnam pa bzhi'i rigs 'thob par 'gyur gyi sdug bsngal la chos shes pa la sogs pa rnams la ma yin te /
translated: When perseverance for Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering arises, its lineage is obtained and the lineage of its four aspects is obtained, but not the Dharma knowledge of suffering and so on, because they are not obtained.

original: rigs tha dad pa'i phyir dang dmigs pa tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs tha dad pa'i phyir dang dmigs pa tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are different types and because they have different objects.

original: yang mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa rnams las rnam pa gcig mngon du gyur na rnam pa lhag ma rnams kyi rigs 'thob pa gang yin pa 'di la rgyu ci zhig yod ce na /
analyzed: yang mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa rnams las rnam pa gcig mngon du gyur na rnam pa lhag ma rnams kyi rigs 'thob pa gang yin pa 'di la rgyu ci zhig yod ce na /
translated: What is the cause for obtaining the type of the remaining aspects when one aspect is manifested among the aspects of impermanence and so on?

original: dmigs pa mtshungs pa'i skal ba 'dra ba nyid kyis so //
analyzed: dmigs pa mtshungs pa'i skal ba 'dra ba nyid kyis so //
translated: They are obtained through the homogeneous cause of the same focal object.

original: 'dir sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa skyes pa gang yin pa de nyid thams cad kyi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu nyid du gnas pas de skyes pas thams cad kyi rigs rnams 'thob po zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa skyes pa gang yin pa de nyid thams cad kyi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu nyid du gnas pas de skyes pas thams cad kyi rigs rnams 'thob po zhes bya ste /
translated: Here, the type of all is established as the homogeneous cause of that which arises as the perseverance for Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering. Therefore, when it arises, the types of all are obtained.

original: de bzhin du sdug bsngal la chos shes pa skyes pa nas ji srid lam la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa skyes pa'i bar du de'i rigs rnams dang de'i rnam pa rnams 'thob par 'gyur pas de nyid bsgom par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du sdug bsngal la chos shes pa skyes pa nas ji srid lam la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa skyes pa'i bar du de'i rigs rnams dang de'i rnam pa rnams 'thob par 'gyur pas de nyid bsgom par 'gyur ro //
translated: Similarly, when Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering arises, up to when the perseverance for subsequent knowledge of the truth of the path arises, the types of that and its aspects are obtained and it is cultivated.

original: gzhan ma yin zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gzhan ma yin zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is not different.

original: bsgom pa'i lam la ni skal ba 'dra ba dang skal pa 'dra ba ma yin pa'i shes pa thams cad dang de'i rnam pa rnams mngon du gyur pas thams cad kyis skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu thob par 'gyur bas der shes pa'i rnam pa khyad par du 'phagsüîΩpa ma 'ongs pa 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam la ni skal ba 'dra ba dang skal pa 'dra ba ma yin pa'i shes pa thams cad dang de'i rnam pa rnams mngon du gyur pas thams cad kyis skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu thob par 'gyur bas der shes pa'i rnam pa khyad par du 'phags pa ma 'ongs pa 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, future aspects of knowledge are obtained that are superior to those obtained on the path of seeing.

original: rigs rnams ni sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa la sogs pa rnams kyi skad cig gnyis pa la sogs pa rnams la bsgom pas 'thob pa ma yin pa'i phyir dang lam gyis drangs te 'gro ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs rnams ni sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa la sogs pa rnams kyi skad cig gnyis pa la sogs pa rnams la bsgom pas 'thob pa ma yin pa'i phyir dang lam gyis drangs te 'gro ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But the three lineages are not obtained by the path of meditation because they are not obtained by the path of meditation in the second moment of perseverance for Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering and so on and because they are not drawn and led by the path.

original: rjes gsum la ni kun rdzob kyang zhes bya ba 'dir ni kun rdzob shes pa khyad par can gzung gi thams cad ni ma yin no //üîΩ@308b chos shes pa dag la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rjes gsum la ni kun rdzob kyang zhes bya ba 'dir ni kun rdzob shes pa khyad par can gzung gi thams cad ni ma yin no // @308b chos shes pa dag la ni ma yin te /
translated: The three subsequent are also conventional knowledge.

original: bden pa zad par mngon par ma rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
analyzed: bden pa zad par mngon par ma rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
translated: Conventional knowledge is not obtained in Dharma knowledge because it is not obtained in Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering and so on.

original: de ni bden pa mngon par rtogs pa'i mthar 'thob na /
analyzed: de ni bden pa mngon par rtogs pa'i mthar 'thob na /
translated: It is obtained at the end of realizing the truths.

original: chos shes pa dag la ni bden pa zad par mngon par rtogs pa med do //üîΩ'di ltar sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung dang 'gog pa la chos shes pa pa dag gis ni gzugs dang gzugs med par rtogs pa'i sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung dang 'gog pa rnam par mi rtogs pas don byas zin pa ma yin pa'i phyir chos shes pa dag la
analyzed: chos shes pa dag la ni bden pa zad par mngon par rtogs pa med do // 'di ltar sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung dang 'gog pa la chos shes pa pa dag gis ni gzugs dang gzugs med par rtogs pa'i sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung dang 'gog pa rnam par mi rtogs pas don byas zin pa ma yin pa'i phyir chos shes pa dag la
translated: But it is not obtained in Dharma knowledge, because there is no complete realization of the truths in Dharma knowledge.üîΩOthers say: It is not obtained in Dharma knowledge because the purpose is not accomplished, since Dharma knowledge of the truths of suffering, origin, and cessation does not realize the suffering, origin, and cessation that are to be realized in the form and formless realms.

original: mi 'thob po zhes gzhan dag zer ro //
analyzed: mi 'thob po zhes gzhan dag zer ro //
translated: It is obtained in subsequent knowledge, because it is obtained in subsequent knowledge of the truths of suffering, origin, and cessation.üîΩIt is not obtained in subsequent knowledge of the truth of the path, because the purpose is not accomplished.

original: dmigs pa dang rnam pa pa ri dza yo hi na dharma dzny'a na kha dyu pi pa ri sa m'apta ai ti /
analyzed: dmigs pa dang rnam pa pa ri dza yo hi na dharma dzny'a na kha dyu pi pa ri sa m'apta ai ti /
translated: It is obtained in the end of realizing the truths, because it is obtained in the end of realizing the truth of the path.

original: chos shes pa la de thob pa'i phyir mngon par rtogs pa'i bar du 'gyur gyi mngon par rtogs pa'i mtha' las byung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: chos shes pa la de thob pa'i phyir mngon par rtogs pa'i bar du 'gyur gyi mngon par rtogs pa'i mtha' las byung ba ma yin no //
translated: It is not obtained in the end of realizing the truths, because it is not obtained in the end of realizing the truth of cessation.

original: de la gzugs na spyod pa'i mngon par rtogs pa'i mtha' las byung ba rnams ni 'dod pa na spyod pa rnams las khams kyi sgo nas khyad par du 'phags so //
analyzed: de la gzugs na spyod pa'i mngon par rtogs pa'i mtha' las byung ba rnams ni 'dod pa na spyod pa rnams las khams kyi sgo nas khyad par du 'phags so //
translated: Those that arise from the end of realization in the form realm are superior to those in the desire realm in terms of realm.

original: kun 'byung ba la sogs pa rnams la 'dod pa na spyod pa rnams ni rgyud kyi sgo nas rgyu nye bar bsags pa'i rgyud la de'i thob pa'o //
analyzed: kun 'byung ba la sogs pa rnams la 'dod pa na spyod pa rnams ni rgyud kyi sgo nas rgyu nye bar bsags pa'i rgyud la de'i thob pa'o //
translated: Those in the desire realm are obtained in a continuum that has accumulated causes in terms of the continuum.

original: lam ni sngon 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis mngon par ma rtogs pa'i phyir dang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: lam ni sngon 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis mngon par ma rtogs pa'i phyir dang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The path is not previously realized by the mundane path.

original: thog ma med pa can gyi 'khor ba na sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung dang 'gog pa dang kun rdzob shes pas mngon par ma rtogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: thog ma med pa can gyi 'khor ba na sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung dang 'gog pa dang kun rdzob shes pas mngon par ma rtogs pa rnams so //
translated: Those that are not previously realized by the mundane path in beginningless samsara are the knowledge of suffering, origin, cessation and conventional knowledge.

original: yongs su shes pa dang spangs pa dang mngon sum du byas pa'i sgo nas kyang mthong zhing dmigs pa dang mngon par rtogs so //
analyzed: yongs su shes pa dang spangs pa dang mngon sum du byas pa'i sgo nas kyang mthong zhing dmigs pa dang mngon par rtogs so //
translated: They are seen, observed and realized by means of complete knowledge, abandonment and manifestation.

original: 'di ltar phyi rol pa'i lam gyis sa 'og ma sdug bsngal gyi sgo nas yongs su shes so //
analyzed: 'di ltar phyi rol pa'i lam gyis sa 'og ma sdug bsngal gyi sgo nas yongs su shes so //
translated: Thus, by the path of the non-Buddhist, one fully understands the lower stage from the point of view of suffering.

original: de las gzhan pas kun 'byung spong ba dang 'gog pa mngon du byed do //
analyzed: de las gzhan pas kun 'byung spong ba dang 'gog pa mngon du byed do //
translated: By the other, one abandons the origin and manifests cessation.

original: yang na mthong zhing dmigs pa dang mngon par rtogs pa'i sgo nas kyang mngon par rtogs par byed do //
analyzed: yang na mthong zhing dmigs pa dang mngon par rtogs pa'i sgo nas kyang mngon par rtogs par byed do //
translated: Or else, one realizes by means of seeing, by means of taking as object, and by means of clear manifestation.

original: sdug bsngal gcig bstan pa sdug bsngal las shes pas sa bon la sogs pa rgyu'i sgo nas shes pa'i phyir 'jig rten pa'i 'dod chags dang bral bas nyon mongs pa spang ba dang 'gog pa shes pa ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gcig bstan pa sdug bsngal las shes pas sa bon la sogs pa rgyu'i sgo nas shes pa'i phyir 'jig rten pa'i 'dod chags dang bral bas nyon mongs pa spang ba dang 'gog pa shes pa ste /
translated: By means of the teaching of the one suffering, one understands the seed, etc., by means of the cause, and thus one abandons the defilements and understands cessation by means of mundane detachment.

original: go rims bzhin du mngon par rtogs pa gsum skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: go rims bzhin du mngon par rtogs pa gsum skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the three realizations arise in order.

original: @309a * // kha cig tu zag pa med pa kho na mngon par rtogs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: @309a * // kha cig tu zag pa med pa kho na mngon par rtogs pa ma yin te /
translated: In some cases, there is no realization of the uncontaminated alone.

original: ji skad du mdo las bdag nyid tshul bzhin yid la byed pa brtsams te /
analyzed: ji skad du mdo las bdag nyid tshul bzhin yid la byed pa brtsams te /
translated: As it is said in the sutra: ‚ÄúHaving begun to attend properly to oneself,

original: 'di ltar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin mngon par rtogs par gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ltar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin mngon par rtogs par gyur te /
translated: Thus, he realizes the perfect truth just as it is.

original: 'di lta ste skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga shi zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o ;
analyzed: 'di lta ste skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga shi zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o ;
translated: This is the realization of the truth of suffering, for example, that aging and death have birth as their condition.

original: / gzhan yang ji ltar sdug bsngal ba de ltar sdug bsngal ba mngon par rtogs pa 'byung bas thams cad du nges par yod pa ma yin pas gang gi phyir 'ga' zhig gi tshe lam dang lam ma yin pa'i rnam pa ma rtogs pas de'i phyir 'bras bu
analyzed: / gzhan yang ji ltar sdug bsngal ba de ltar sdug bsngal ba mngon par rtogs pa 'byung bas thams cad du nges par yod pa ma yin pas gang gi phyir 'ga' zhig gi tshe lam dang lam ma yin pa'i rnam pa ma rtogs pas de'i phyir 'bras bu
translated: Moreover, since the realization of suffering is not definite in all cases, because it is sometimes the case that the aspects of the path and not the path are not realized, then the path is not the result of the realization of the truth of suffering.

original: thun mong ba nyid kyi phyir gsum rnams la re re ste bden pa mngon par rtogs pa'i mthar kun rdzob shes pa 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thun mong ba nyid kyi phyir gsum rnams la re re ste bden pa mngon par rtogs pa'i mthar kun rdzob shes pa 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since the path is common to all, the three results are obtained in relation to each truth, because at the end of the realization of the truth, conventional knowledge is obtained.

original: lam rjes su shes pa la ma yin te /
analyzed: lam rjes su shes pa la ma yin te /
translated: But not in relation to subsequent knowledge of the truth of the path,

original: lam ni thams cad du sngar mngon par ma rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lam ni thams cad du sngar mngon par ma rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the path is not previously realized in all cases.

original: de lta mod kyi nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i gnas skabs su byed pa de lta na yang de mngon par rtogs pa zhes mi bya ste /
analyzed: de lta mod kyi nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i gnas skabs su byed pa de lta na yang de mngon par rtogs pa zhes mi bya ste /
translated: However, though it is a state that is compatible with the factors conducive to penetrative insight, it is not called clear realization.üîΩ

original: nyon mongs pa spang ba'i sgo nas bden pa rnams ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa spang ba'i sgo nas bden pa rnams ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: But even though it is so, it is not called clear knowledge, because it does not see the truths by the elimination of the defilements.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: And it is said:

original: 'jig rten pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba ni sprin dang bcas pa'i mtshan mo gzugs mthong ba bzhin zhes so //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba ni sprin dang bcas pa'i mtshan mo gzugs mthong ba bzhin zhes so //
translated: The right view of the world is like seeing a form in the night when there is a cloud.

original: gang gi de mngon par rtogs pa de'i rnam pa kho na de mngon par rtogs pa'i mthar 'thob po //
analyzed: gang gi de mngon par rtogs pa de'i rnam pa kho na de mngon par rtogs pa'i mthar 'thob po //
translated: But when one has that clear knowledge, one obtains the end of that clear knowledge, which is the same as that.

original: zad par mngon par ma rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni lam zhes bya bar snyegs so //
analyzed: zad par mngon par ma rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni lam zhes bya bar snyegs so //
translated: Because one has not clearly known the extinction, which is the path.

original: lam thams cad ni sus kyang bsgom par mi nus so //
analyzed: lam thams cad ni sus kyang bsgom par mi nus so //
translated: No one can cultivate all the paths.

original: gzhan gyi rgyud la yod pa bsgom par mi nus la rang gi rgyud la yod pa'i rnyed zin pa ni brgya'i char yang mngon du bya bar mi nus so //
analyzed: gzhan gyi rgyud la yod pa bsgom par mi nus la rang gi rgyud la yod pa'i rnyed zin pa ni brgya'i char yang mngon du bya bar mi nus so //
translated: One cannot cultivate that which exists in the stream of another. And one cannot make manifest even a hundredth part of that which is obtained in one‚Äôs own stream.

original: de'i tshe kun 'byung yang thams cad spangs pa ma yin pas zhes bya ba ni kun 'byung la rjes su shes pa'i tshe'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe kun 'byung yang thams cad spangs pa ma yin pas zhes bya ba ni kun 'byung la rjes su shes pa'i tshe'o //
translated: At that time, the truth of origination is not completely abandoned.

original: gang zhig ma spangs zhe na 'gog pa lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams te ;
analyzed: gang zhig ma spangs zhe na 'gog pa lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams te ;
translated: What is not abandoned? The afflictions that are to be abandoned by seeing the truths of cessation and path.

original: de'i phyir lam la rjes su shes pa ltar kun 'byung la rjes su shes pa'i tshe yang mngon par rtogs pa'i mtha' las 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir lam la rjes su shes pa ltar kun 'byung la rjes su shes pa'i tshe yang mngon par rtogs pa'i mtha' las 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, just as at the end of clear knowledge of the path, one does not emerge from the equipoise of the uninterrupted stage, one also does not emerge from the equipoise of the uninterrupted stage at the end of clear knowledge of the truth of origination.

original: sdug bsngal ni khams gsum pa ste sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pas thams cad yongs su shes par byas pas de ma smos so //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ni khams gsum pa ste sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pas thams cad yongs su shes par byas pas de ma smos so //
translated: Suffering is of the three realms, and since all suffering is completely known by subsequent knowledge of the truth of suffering, it is not mentioned.

original: de'i bden @309b pa mthong pas spang bar bya ba zhes bya ba ni kun 'byung gi bden pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i bden @309b pa mthong pas spang bar bya ba zhes bya ba ni kun 'byung gi bden pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba'o //
translated: That to be abandoned by seeing its truth means that to be abandoned by seeing the truth of origination.

original: 'gog pa yang de bzhin te gzhan mthong bas spang bar bya ba thams cad mngon du byas pa'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa yang de bzhin te gzhan mthong bas spang bar bya ba thams cad mngon du byas pa'o //
translated: Cessation is also like that, since all that is to be abandoned by seeing other truths is manifested.

original: rigs mang ba'i phyir zhes bya ba rigs ni nus pa'i khyad par dang ldan pa'i rgyud yin la /
analyzed: rigs mang ba'i phyir zhes bya ba rigs ni nus pa'i khyad par dang ldan pa'i rgyud yin la /
translated: A lineage is a continuum that possesses a special capacity.

original: lam 'di la nyan thos la sogs pa'i rigs kyi dbye bas rigs mang po zhig yod pas na rigs mang po'o //
analyzed: lam 'di la nyan thos la sogs pa'i rigs kyi dbye bas rigs mang po zhig yod pas na rigs mang po'o //
translated: This path has many lineages because it has many divisions of lineages of sravakas and so on.

original: nyan thos kyi rigs la sogs pa'i dbye bas tha dad pa'i lam thams cad ni bsgom par mi nus te /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi rigs la sogs pa'i dbye bas tha dad pa'i lam thams cad ni bsgom par mi nus te /
translated: One cannot cultivate all the paths that are differentiated by the lineages of sravakas and so on.

original: mngon du bya bar mi nus zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: mngon du bya bar mi nus zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: The meaning of cannot manifest is that one cannot manifest any of them.

original: gang yang rung ba zhig mngon du 'gyur na gang yang rung ba zhig gis so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa 'thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang yang rung ba zhig mngon du 'gyur na gang yang rung ba zhig gis so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa 'thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because if any one of them were to manifest, one would obtain the cessation not due to analytical discernment through any one of them.

original: dus ring pos de bsgom med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dus ring pos de bsgom med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Because it is not cultivated for a long time.

original: kha cig na re /
analyzed: kha cig na re /
translated: Some say:

original: kun 'byung gi bden pa ma lus pa spangs pas ni lam ma lus pa'i lam bsgom pa yod srid do //
analyzed: kun 'byung gi bden pa ma lus pa spangs pas ni lam ma lus pa'i lam bsgom pa yod srid do //
translated: It is possible to cultivate the entire path through the abandonment of the entire truth of origin.

original: rigs du ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: rigs du ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
translated: Because it has many lineages.

original: de lta na mngon par rtogs pa'i mtha' las byung ba nyid kun rdzob shes par mi 'gyur bas snga ma kho na bzang ngo //
analyzed: de lta na mngon par rtogs pa'i mtha' las byung ba nyid kun rdzob shes par mi 'gyur bas snga ma kho na bzang ngo //
translated: Thus, it is better to maintain the former position.

original: mthong ba'i lam gyi 'khor yin pa'i phyir ro zhes zer te zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam gyi 'khor yin pa'i phyir ro zhes zer te zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Because it is the retinue of the path of seeing.

original: kun rdzob shes pa ni 'di yin la lam la rjes su shes pa ni bsgom pa'i lam yin te /
analyzed: kun rdzob shes pa ni 'di yin la lam la rjes su shes pa ni bsgom pa'i lam yin te /
translated: This is the conventional knowledge, and subsequent knowledge of the path is the path of meditation.

original: de'i phyir der ni 'thob po zhes zer ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir der ni 'thob po zhes zer ba'o //
translated: Therefore, it is obtained there.üîΩThis is not a proof because it is what is to be proven.

original: 'di ni bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir shes par byed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i lam gyi 'khor kho na yin gyi bsgom pa'i lam gyi 'khor ram lam gnyi ga'i 'khor ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni bsgrub par bya ba
analyzed: 'di ni bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir shes par byed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i lam gyi 'khor kho na yin gyi bsgom pa'i lam gyi 'khor ram lam gnyi ga'i 'khor ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni bsgrub par bya ba
translated: This is what is to be proven: It is the retinue of the path of seeing alone, not the retinue of the path of meditation or the retinue of both paths.

original: yin te ; gcig tu mthong ba'i lam ni zag pa med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yin te ; gcig tu mthong ba'i lam ni zag pa med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the path of seeing is uncontaminated alone.

original: gzhan dag na re mthong ba'i lam gyis 'khor zag pa dang bcas pa nyid yin pa bsgrub par bya ba yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re mthong ba'i lam gyis 'khor zag pa dang bcas pa nyid yin pa bsgrub par bya ba yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say: The path of seeing is to be established as having a retinue that is still subject to contamination.üîΩIt is only nonarisen,

original: gcig kho nar de ni mi skye ba'i chos can yin zhes bya ba la ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: gcig kho nar de ni mi skye ba'i chos can yin zhes bya ba la ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: de'i rten mi skye ba'i chos can yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de'i rten mi skye ba'i chos can yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because its basis is nonarisen.

original: de ni dad pa dang chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i rten kho nas mngon du byed pa srid na /
analyzed: de ni dad pa dang chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i rten kho nas mngon du byed pa srid na /
translated: It is possible that it is manifested by the basis of a follower of faith or a follower of reality alone,

original: mthong ba'i lam na ni de dag skye ba'i go skabs med de /üîΩdad pa dang chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i rten dag kyang de'i gong rol na mi skye ba'i chos can yin pa'i phyir de mi @310a * //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam na ni de dag skye ba'i go skabs med de / dad pa dang chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i rten dag kyang de'i gong rol na mi skye ba'i chos can yin pa'i phyir de mi @310a * //
translated: but there is no opportunity for them to arise on the path of seeing.üîΩThe basis of a follower of faith or a follower of reality does not arise prior to it,

original: skye ba'i chos can nyid yin no //
analyzed: skye ba'i chos can nyid yin no //
translated: therefore it is nonarisen.

original: ji ltar de thob pa yin zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ji ltar de thob pa yin zhes bya ba ni /
translated: How is it obtained?

original: gal te mngon du mi byed na snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: gal te mngon du mi byed na snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: If it is not manifested,

original: ma rnyed pa las rnyed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ma rnyed pa las rnyed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: because it is obtained from what has not been obtained.

original: de ni thog ma med pa can gyi 'khor bar snga ma rnyed pa las bden pa gsum mngon par rtogs pa'i mthar rnyed pas ma rnyed pa las rnyed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni thog ma med pa can gyi 'khor bar snga ma rnyed pa las bden pa gsum mngon par rtogs pa'i mthar rnyed pas ma rnyed pa las rnyed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called obtained from what was not obtained because it was not previously obtained in beginningless cyclic existence, but is obtained at the end of the clear realization of the three truths.

original: ji ltar rnyed pa yin zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: ji ltar rnyed pa yin zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: How is it obtained?

original: de skye ba'i nus pa thob pa nyid ni rnyed pa'o //
analyzed: de skye ba'i nus pa thob pa nyid ni rnyed pa'o //
translated: Obtaining the capacity to generate it is obtaining it.

original: de skye ba'i nus pa rnyed na ji ltar mngon du mi byed /
analyzed: de skye ba'i nus pa rnyed na ji ltar mngon du mi byed /
translated: If it obtains the capacity to generate it, why does it not manifest?

original: 'on te mngon du mi byed na ji ltar rnyed de mi rnyed pa nyid do snyam du bsams pa'o ;
analyzed: 'on te mngon du mi byed na ji ltar rnyed de mi rnyed pa nyid do snyam du bsams pa'o ;
translated: But if it does not manifest, how is it obtained? It is not obtained.

original: /'thob pa'i sgo nas zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir gnas skabs der de'i 'thob pa skye ste /
analyzed: /'thob pa'i sgo nas zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir gnas skabs der de'i 'thob pa skye ste /
translated: Obtaining it is from the perspective of obtainment because at that time its obtainment arises.

original: des na de'i tshe rnyed do zhes brjod kyi skye'o zhes bya ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: des na de'i tshe rnyed do zhes brjod kyi skye'o zhes bya ba ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore it is said to be obtained at that time, but it is not said to arise.

original: gang gi phyir rnyed pa de'i phyir rnyed do zhes bya ba ni thob pa dang rnyed pa'i sgra la khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rnyed pa de'i phyir rnyed do zhes bya ba ni thob pa dang rnyed pa'i sgra la khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Obtaining it is from the perspective of obtainment because the terms obtainment and obtainment are synonymous.

original: ston pa 'di ni sngon ma byung ba'i rnam pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rig pa dang bral ba'i phyir ram sngar ma thos pa'i phyir sngon ma byung ba ste /
analyzed: ston pa 'di ni sngon ma byung ba'i rnam pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rig pa dang bral ba'i phyir ram sngar ma thos pa'i phyir sngon ma byung ba ste /
translated: This teacher is of a type that has not existed before means that he is of a type that has not existed before because he is devoid of knowledge or because he has not previously heard.

original: sngar sus kyang de nyid nges par bya ba'i phyir de nyid ma bstan pas ston pa mngon du ma byung ba'i rnam pa yin no //
analyzed: sngar sus kyang de nyid nges par bya ba'i phyir de nyid ma bstan pas ston pa mngon du ma byung ba'i rnam pa yin no //
translated: He is of a type that has not existed before because he has not previously taught reality in order to ascertain reality, since no one has previously taught reality.

original: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re /
analyzed: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re /
translated: Master Sa·πÖghabhadra says:

original: de'i thob pa rnyed pa'i phyir mngon du gyur pa'i skabs yod pa ni dbang du gyur pa nyid de ltar rtogs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i thob pa rnyed pa'i phyir mngon du gyur pa'i skabs yod pa ni dbang du gyur pa nyid de ltar rtogs pa yin gyi /
translated: The existence of the opportunity for the actualization of that is mastery, which is understood in that way.

original: de'i mngon du gyur pa'i skabs yod pas mngon du byed pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i mngon du gyur pa'i skabs yod pas mngon du byed pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not that the existence of the opportunity for the actualization of that is actualization.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de thob pa zhes bya ste mngon du gyur ba'i khyad par rtogs pa'i phyir chos kha cig gi thob pa ni cig car mngon du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de thob pa zhes bya ste mngon du gyur ba'i khyad par rtogs pa'i phyir chos kha cig gi thob pa ni cig car mngon du 'gyur ro //
translated: For that reason, it is called the obtainment of that, because the special actualization of some phenomena is actualized simultaneously.

original: dper na zad mi shes pa kha cig gi thob pa mngon du 'gro ba can mngon du gyur pa dang / de bzhin du mi skye ba shes pa dang slob pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba dag gi khams thams cad las kha cig gi thob pa med par mngon du gyur pa yod pa ma yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na zad mi shes pa kha cig gi thob pa mngon du 'gro ba can mngon du gyur pa dang / de bzhin du mi skye ba shes pa dang slob pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba dag gi khams thams cad las kha cig gi thob pa med par mngon du gyur pa yod pa ma yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the possession of the acquisition of certain inexhaustible treasures is actualized, and likewise, the possession of the acquisition of certain aspects of the cognition of nonarising and the right view of a trainee are not actualized.

original: yang dbang du gyur pa nyid ces bya ba ci zhe na /
analyzed: yang dbang du gyur pa nyid ces bya ba ci zhe na /
translated: What is meant by mastery?

original: gal te de skyed pa'i nus pa de'i lam gyi khyad par kho na las 'dir 'gyur pa'o //
analyzed: gal te de skyed pa'i nus pa de'i lam gyi khyad par kho na las 'dir 'gyur pa'o //
translated: If it is the capacity to generate it, then it is due to the specific path of that person.

original: yang thob pa yongs su rtogs pas ci /
analyzed: yang thob pa yongs su rtogs pas ci /
translated: What is the point of understanding the possession of that?

original: 'on te thob pa nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te thob pa nyid do zhe na /
translated: If it is possession itself,

original: de lta na yang brjod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de lta na yang brjod par mi bya'o //
translated: then it should not be stated.

original: de'i thob pa rnyed pa'i phyir mngon du gyur pa'i skabs yod @310b pa ni dbang du gyur pa nyid rtogs pa yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de'i thob pa rnyed pa'i phyir mngon du gyur pa'i skabs yod @310b pa ni dbang du gyur pa nyid rtogs pa yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: The opportunity for actualizing it exists when the possession of that is obtained.

original: de yang dad pa dang chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i rten gyi skyed pas de lta na 'di mi sgrub po /
analyzed: de yang dad pa dang chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i rten gyi skyed pas de lta na 'di mi sgrub po /
translated: and the basis of faith and pursuit of virtue is the same.

original: sngon gyi slob dpon rnams ji skad zer ba zhes zer ba ni /
analyzed: sngon gyi slob dpon rnams ji skad zer ba zhes zer ba ni /
translated: The former masters say:

original: rnal 'byor spyod pa pa rnams ni mthu'i sgo nas kun rdzob shes pa 'thob kyi /
analyzed: rnal 'byor spyod pa pa rnams ni mthu'i sgo nas kun rdzob shes pa 'thob kyi /
translated: YogacƒÅrins obtain conventional knowledge through power,

original: mngon du gyur pa'i sgo nas ni ma yin te /
analyzed: mngon du gyur pa'i sgo nas ni ma yin te /
translated: but not through manifestation,

original: langs pas mngon du byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: langs pas mngon du byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they manifest it upon rising from meditative attainment.

original: chos khyad par du 'phags pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan 'jig rten pa'i kun rdzob shes pa pas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: chos khyad par du 'phags pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan 'jig rten pa'i kun rdzob shes pa pas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúsuperior Dharma‚Äù means the other, mundane conventional knowledge.

original: gzhan ni bden pa mthong ba'i bden pa mi dmigs pa nyid kyi khyad par du 'phags pa'i phyir rtog pa la dpyod pa yin pas ches khyad par du 'phags pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan ni bden pa mthong ba'i bden pa mi dmigs pa nyid kyi khyad par du 'phags pa'i phyir rtog pa la dpyod pa yin pas ches khyad par du 'phags pa yin no //
translated: The other is superior to that because it is the superior nonapprehension of the truths that are seen.

original: 'thob pa med na ji ltar ma 'ongs pa de rnyed ce na de'i phyir /
analyzed: 'thob pa med na ji ltar ma 'ongs pa de rnyed ce na de'i phyir /
translated: If it is not obtained, how can future conventional knowledge be acquired?

original: de nyid de rnyed pa yin te zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
analyzed: de nyid de rnyed pa yin te zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
translated: That is the acquisition of that.üîΩThe acquisition of the lineage is also the acquisition of that.

original: rigs las byung ba yang rnyed pa yin no zhes bya ba ni dper na 'thob pa dang ldan pa rnyed pa bzhin no snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: rigs las byung ba yang rnyed pa yin no zhes bya ba ni dper na 'thob pa dang ldan pa rnyed pa bzhin no snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: This is similar to the acquisition of the possession of obtainment.

original: rigs ni de skyed par nus pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: rigs ni de skyed par nus pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: The lineage is the cause that is able to generate that.

original: de nas byung ba ni rigs las byung ba'o //
analyzed: de nas byung ba ni rigs las byung ba'o //
translated: That which arises from the lineage is the acquisition of the lineage.

original: 'di skad bstan par 'gyur te de mngon sum du 'byung bar nus pa'i rten rnyed na rten des skyes pa de yang rnyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di skad bstan par 'gyur te de mngon sum du 'byung bar nus pa'i rten rnyed na rten des skyes pa de yang rnyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: This is taught: If one acquires the basis that is able to manifest that, then that which arises from that basis is also acquired.

original: bye brag tu smra ba rnams ni 'di mi 'dod do zhes bya ba ni de ni mthong ba'i lam gyis thob par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba rnams ni 'di mi 'dod do zhes bya ba ni de ni mthong ba'i lam gyis thob par bya ba yin no //
translated: Vaibhasikas do not assert this because it is to be obtained by the path of seeing.

original: de bsgom pa'i lam du ji ltar mngon sum du byed par 'gyur /
analyzed: de bsgom pa'i lam du ji ltar mngon sum du byed par 'gyur /
translated: How could it be manifested on the path of meditation?

original: de nyid kyi phyir de mi skye ba'i chos can du rnam par gzhag go zhe'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de mi skye ba'i chos can du rnam par gzhag go zhe'o //
translated: For that very reason it is classified as a phenomenon that is not produced.

original: sa du pa'i kun rdzob shes pa de 'thob ce na /
analyzed: sa du pa'i kun rdzob shes pa de 'thob ce na /
translated: Obtaining that conventional knowledge of whatever level?

original: mthong ba'i lam 'dod pa na spyod pas mtshungs pas bdun pa'o //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam 'dod pa na spyod pas mtshungs pas bdun pa'o //
translated: The path of seeing is the seventh because it is similar to the desire realm.üîΩDo all levels of the path of seeing arise simultaneously?

original: cig car thams cad 'thob bam ci zhe na ma yin te /üîΩ'o na ci zhe na mthong ba'i lam gong gis sa pa yin pa zhes rgyas par 'byung ste /üîΩ'di ltar mthong ba'i lam bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sa pa yin na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: cig car thams cad 'thob bam ci zhe na ma yin te / 'o na ci zhe na mthong ba'i lam gong gis sa pa yin pa zhes rgyas par 'byung ste / 'di ltar mthong ba'i lam bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sa pa yin na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: No, they do not.üîΩThe path of seeing is higher level.

original: mthong ba'i lam bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa yin na sa gsum pa'i 'thob ste /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa yin na sa gsum pa'i 'thob ste /
translated: If the path of seeing is the level of the fourth absorption, then it is obtained from three levels:

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa dang mi lcogs pa med pa dang bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa rnams so //
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa dang mi lcogs pa med pa dang bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa rnams so //
translated: the desire realm level, the level of unrestricted access concentration to the first absorption and the level of the first absorption.

original: bsam gtan khyad par can gyi sa pa yin na rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan khyad par can gyi sa pa yin na rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: If the path of seeing is the level of the special first absorption, then it is obtained from four levels:üîΩthe three just explained and the level of the special first absorption.üîΩIf the path of seeing is the level of the second absorption, then it is obtained from five levels:üîΩthe three just explained, the level of the special first absorption and the level of the second absorption.üîΩIf the path of seeing is the level of the third absorption, then it is obtained from six levels:

original: bshad ma thag pa rnam pa gsum pa dang bsam gtan khyad par can gyi sa pa'o //
analyzed: bshad ma thag pa rnam pa gsum pa dang bsam gtan khyad par can gyi sa pa'o //
translated: the three just explained, the level of the special first absorption, the level of the second absorption and the level of the third absorption.üîΩIf the path of seeing is the level of the fourth absorption, then it is obtained from seven levels:üîΩthe three just explained, the level of the special first absorption, the level of the second absorption, the level of the third absorption and the level of the fourth absorption.

original: @311a * // de bzhin du bsam gtan gnyis pa dang gsum pa'i sa pa re re la 'phel bas bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sa pa'i bar du rang gi sa pa dang 'og ma'i sa pa rnams te drug 'thob po //
analyzed: @311a * // de bzhin du bsam gtan gnyis pa dang gsum pa'i sa pa re re la 'phel bas bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sa pa'i bar du rang gi sa pa dang 'og ma'i sa pa rnams te drug 'thob po //
translated: So too, each level of the second and third absorptions increases by one, up to the level of the fourth absorption, where one obtains six: the level of the fourth absorption itself and the levels of the lower three absorptions.

original: yang mthong ba'i lam gang yin pas rang dang sa 'og ma'i 'thob kyi sa gong ma pa'i ma yin pa rgyu ci zhe na /
analyzed: yang mthong ba'i lam gang yin pas rang dang sa 'og ma'i 'thob kyi sa gong ma pa'i ma yin pa rgyu ci zhe na /
translated: Why does the path of seeing obtain the conventional knowledge of its level and lower levels, but not higher levels?

original: mthong ba'i lam ni rang dang 'og ma'i sa pa'i kun rdzob shes pa yang sa de la brten nas nus pa'i bdag nyid du byed kyi /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam ni rang dang 'og ma'i sa pa'i kun rdzob shes pa yang sa de la brten nas nus pa'i bdag nyid du byed kyi /
translated: The path of seeing makes the conventional knowledge of its level and lower levels capable of acting as its basis, but

original: sa gong ma khyad par du gyur pa'i phyir sa gong ma las ma yin no //
analyzed: sa gong ma khyad par du gyur pa'i phyir sa gong ma las ma yin no //
translated: it does not make the conventional knowledge of higher levels capable of acting as its basis, because it is inferior to the higher levels.

original: de'i phyir rang dang 'og ma'i sa pa kho na'i 'thob kyi gong ma'i sa pa'i ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rang dang 'og ma'i sa pa kho na'i 'thob kyi gong ma'i sa pa'i ma yin no //
translated: Therefore it obtains the conventional knowledge of its level and lower levels, but not higher levels.

original: 'gog pa mngon par rtogs pa zhes rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: 'gog pa mngon par rtogs pa zhes rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: Obtaining the knowledge of others' minds and so onüîΩObtaining the knowledge of others' minds and so on is similar to the obtainment of the path of seeing.

original: 'gog pa ni lus dang sems dang tshor ba dang mtshan nyid mi mthun pa'i phyir dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa ni lus dang sems dang tshor ba dang mtshan nyid mi mthun pa'i phyir dmigs pa'o //
translated: Cessation is the object of the mindfulness of dharmas because it is not similar to the body, mind, and feelings.

original: chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ni lhag ma ste dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi rnams so //
analyzed: chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ni lhag ma ste dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi rnams so //
translated: The remaining foundations of mindfulness are the four foundations of mindfulness.

original: sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba dag mngon par rtogs pa'i mtha' las byung ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams te phung po lnga la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba dag mngon par rtogs pa'i mtha' las byung ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams te phung po lnga la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The foundations of mindfulness that arise at the end of the clear realization of suffering and origin are the four foundations of mindfulness that have the five aggregates as their object.

original: rang bden rnam can zhes bya ba ni gang zhig bden pa gang mngon par rtogs pas 'thob pa de'i ni de rang gi bden pa ste /
analyzed: rang bden rnam can zhes bya ba ni gang zhig bden pa gang mngon par rtogs pas 'thob pa de'i ni de rang gi bden pa ste /
translated: Those who obtain the clear realization of a certain truth have that truth as their own truth.

original: sdug bsngal mngon par rtogs pa na kun rdzob shes pa gang 'thob pa de ni mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal mngon par rtogs pa na kun rdzob shes pa gang 'thob pa de ni mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: When one obtains the clear realization of suffering, the conventional knowledge that is obtained has impermanence, etc. as its aspects.

original: de bzhin du kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa la yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa la yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: The same should be said for the clear realizations of origin and cessation.

original: de'i dmigs pa yang bden pa de nyid yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de'i dmigs pa yang bden pa de nyid yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ngo //
translated: The objects of those are also just those truths.üîΩThe four foundations of mindfulness are the four foundations of mindfulness that have the four truths as their objects.

original: de'i dmigs pa can ma yin pa ni de'i rnam pa can nyid du mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i dmigs pa can ma yin pa ni de'i rnam pa can nyid du mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not suitable to be the aspect of that which is not its object.

original: rnam pa ni dmigs pa 'dzin pa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa ni dmigs pa 'dzin pa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: The aspect is the aspect of apprehending the object.

original: 'bad las byung zhes bya ba ni skye bas thob pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'bad las byung zhes bya ba ni skye bas thob pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Arisen from effort means it is not obtained from birth.

original: phung po bzhi dang lnga'i rang bzhin yin no zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa na spyod pa la rjes su 'brang ba'i gzugs med pa'i phyir phung po bzhi'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: phung po bzhi dang lnga'i rang bzhin yin no zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa na spyod pa la rjes su 'brang ba'i gzugs med pa'i phyir phung po bzhi'i rang bzhin no //
translated: It has the nature of four or five aggregates means it has the nature of four aggregates because it does not have the form of the desire realm that is concomitant with it.

original: gzugs na spyod pa ni bsam gtan gyis bsdam pa'i gzugs yod pa'i phyir phung po lnga pa yin no //
analyzed: gzugs na spyod pa ni bsam gtan gyis bsdam pa'i gzugs yod pa'i phyir phung po lnga pa yin no //
translated: It has the nature of five aggregates because it has the form of the form realm that is bound by absorption.

original: chags bcas bcu drug pa la drug ces bya ba ni rgyun tu zhugs pa dang lan cig phyir 'ong ba'o //
analyzed: chags bcas bcu drug pa la drug ces bya ba ni rgyun tu zhugs pa dang lan cig phyir 'ong ba'o //
translated: Six on the sixteenth for those with attachment means for those who are stream enterers and once returners.

original: phyir mi 'ong ba ni 'dir mi @311b gzung ste 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba ni 'dir mi @311b gzung ste 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Nonreturners are not mentioned here because they are free from attachment.

original: shes pa gnyis de ltar byung ba yin la zhes bya ba ni lam la rjes su shes pa kho na gnyis su brtsi'o //
analyzed: shes pa gnyis de ltar byung ba yin la zhes bya ba ni lam la rjes su shes pa kho na gnyis su brtsi'o //
translated: The two knowledges arise in that way means that only subsequent knowledge of the truth of path is counted as two.

original: lam shes pa dang rjes su shes pa yang ngo //üîΩma 'ongs pa drug 'thob ste zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: lam shes pa dang rjes su shes pa yang ngo // ma 'ongs pa drug 'thob ste zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is knowledge of the truth of path and subsequent knowledge.

original: rgyun tu zhugs pa dang lan cig phyir 'ong bas shes pa drug 'thob pa de'i phyir de dag nyid ma 'ongs pa 'thob ste /
analyzed: rgyun tu zhugs pa dang lan cig phyir 'ong bas shes pa drug 'thob pa de'i phyir de dag nyid ma 'ongs pa 'thob ste /
translated: One obtains six in the future means that since stream enterers and once returners obtain six knowledges, they obtain those very six in the future.

original: ches khyad par du 'phags pa rnams kyi thob pa dag skye zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ches khyad par du 'phags pa rnams kyi thob pa dag skye zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This means that the obtainment of those who are superior arises.

original: 'dod chags dang ni bral bas bdun zhes bya ba ni skad cig ma bcu drug pa kho na la ste /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang ni bral bas bdun zhes bya ba ni skad cig ma bcu drug pa kho na la ste /
translated: One who is free of attachment obtains seven means that on the sixteenth moment alone,

original: mthong ba'i lam la ni 'dod chags dang bral bas kyang gzhan gyi sems shes pa mi 'thob ste /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam la ni 'dod chags dang bral bas kyang gzhan gyi sems shes pa mi 'thob ste /
translated: one who is free of attachment to the desire realm obtains knowledge of others minds on the path of seeing.

original: de mngon sum du bya bas rab tu phye ba yin pa'i phyir la de na yang de'i skabs med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de mngon sum du bya bas rab tu phye ba yin pa'i phyir la de na yang de'i skabs med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is classified as manifest and there is no opportunity for it to arise on that path.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de ni bar chad med pa'i lam thams cad la yang mi 'thob po //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de ni bar chad med pa'i lam thams cad la yang mi 'thob po //
translated: Therefore, it is also not obtained on all uninterrupted paths.

original: de yang zag pa med pa kho na zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de yang zag pa med pa kho na zhes bya ba ste /
translated: It is uncontaminated alone.

original: lhag ma bcu drug pa la kun rdzob shes pa bkag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lhag ma bcu drug pa la kun rdzob shes pa bkag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The conventional knowledge that is blocked on the sixteenth moment is not obtained.

original: ji srid 'dod chags dang bral bar ma gyur pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ji srid 'dod chags dang bral bar ma gyur pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: As long as one does not become free from attachment,

original: rnam par grol ba'i ye shes kyi lam dgu pa 'dod chags dang bral ba yin na /üîΩde'i phyir rnam par grol ba'i lam dgu pa ma gtogs pa gzhan gang dag 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral bar byed pa sbyor ba'i lam la sogs pa de dag tu gzhan gyi sems shes pa dang zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa dag ma gtogs pa
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i ye shes kyi lam dgu pa 'dod chags dang bral ba yin na / de'i phyir rnam par grol ba'i lam dgu pa ma gtogs pa gzhan gang dag 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral bar byed pa sbyor ba'i lam la sogs pa de dag tu gzhan gyi sems shes pa dang zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa dag ma gtogs pa
translated: if the ninth liberated path of the desire realm is free from attachment,

original: shes pa bdun 'thob po //
analyzed: shes pa bdun 'thob po //
translated: then on the other paths that free from attachment to the desire realm, such as the path of preparation, one obtains seven knowledges, excluding knowledge of others' minds, the knowledge of elimination and the knowledge of nonarising.

original: bsgom pa'i lam gyi 'bras bu ni bden pa gsum mngon par rtogs pa bzhin du kun rdzob shes pa thun mong ba ste /
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam gyi 'bras bu ni bden pa gsum mngon par rtogs pa bzhin du kun rdzob shes pa thun mong ba ste /
translated: The result of the path of meditation is the common conventional knowledge that is the realization of the three truths.

original: de'i phyir lam shes pa la yang bsgom pa'i lam la kun rdzob shes pa 'thob po //
analyzed: de'i phyir lam shes pa la yang bsgom pa'i lam la kun rdzob shes pa 'thob po //
translated: Therefore, when knowing the path, conventional knowledge is obtained on the path of meditation.

original: gal te bsgom pa'i lam 'jig rten pa zhig yin na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gal te 'phags pas 'jig rten pa'i lam gyi 'dod par gtogs pa'i bsgom pas spang bar bya ba zad par byed na de'i phyir kun rdzob shes pa da ltar byungüîΩba yin no //
analyzed: gal te bsgom pa'i lam 'jig rten pa zhig yin na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gal te 'phags pas 'jig rten pa'i lam gyi 'dod par gtogs pa'i bsgom pas spang bar bya ba zad par byed na de'i phyir kun rdzob shes pa da ltar byung ba yin no //
translated: If the path of meditation is mundane, etc. If a noble one eliminates the objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation that belong to the desire realm by means of a mundane path, then conventional knowledge arises in the present.

original: ci ste 'jig rten las 'das pas zad par byed na de'i phyir chos shes pa bzhi las zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: ci ste 'jig rten las 'das pas zad par byed na de'i phyir chos shes pa bzhi las zhes bya ba ste /
translated: But if they are eliminated by supramundane means, then one of the four Dharma knowledges arises in the present.

original: sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung dang / 'gog pa dang / lam la chos shes pa rnams las gang yang rung ba zhig da ltar byung ba yin te /üîΩ'dod @312a * //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung dang / 'gog pa dang / lam la chos shes pa rnams las gang yang rung ba zhig da ltar byung ba yin te / 'dod @312a * //
translated: That is, one of the Dharma knowledges of the truths of suffering, origin, cessation, and path arises in the present.

original: chags dang bcas pa'i bsgom pa'i lam ni 'dod pa'i sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i spyod yul can kho na yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chags dang bcas pa'i bsgom pa'i lam ni 'dod pa'i sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i spyod yul can kho na yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the path of meditation that possesses attachment has the objects of the desire realm, such as the truth of suffering, as its domain.

original: gzhan gyi sems shes pa ni mthong ste /
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems shes pa ni mthong ste /
translated: Knowledge of others' minds is seen.

original: de ni 'dod chags dang ma bral ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni 'dod chags dang ma bral ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no one who is not free from attachment to the desire realm.

original: de dag nyid do zhes bya ba ni chos dang / rdzas dang sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung dang 'gog pa dang lam dang kun rdzob shes pa rnams so //
analyzed: de dag nyid do zhes bya ba ni chos dang / rdzas dang sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung dang 'gog pa dang lam dang kun rdzob shes pa rnams so //
translated: Those very same knowledges are the conventional knowledge of phenomena, substances, suffering, origin, cessation, path, and conventional knowledge.

original: 'dod pa'i khams las 'dod chags dang bral yang gzhan gyi sems shes pa mi 'thob ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams las 'dod chags dang bral yang gzhan gyi sems shes pa mi 'thob ste /
translated: One who is free from attachment to the desire realm does not obtain knowledge of others' minds.

original: de ni bar chad med pa'i lam la bkag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni bar chad med pa'i lam la bkag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is blocked on the uninterrupted path.üîΩIf the path of meditation is mundane,

original: gal te bsgom pa'i lam 'jig rten pa zhig yin na ni zhes bya ba la bsgom pa'i lam ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: gal te bsgom pa'i lam 'jig rten pa zhig yin na ni zhes bya ba la bsgom pa'i lam ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The path of meditation is twofold:

original: 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'o //
translated: mundane and transcendent.

original: de la sa bdun las 'dod chags dang bral ba la sogs pa ci rigs par gal te bsgom pa'i lam 'jig rten pa yin na ni kun rdzob shes pa da ltar byung ba yin no //
analyzed: de la sa bdun las 'dod chags dang bral ba la sogs pa ci rigs par gal te bsgom pa'i lam 'jig rten pa yin na ni kun rdzob shes pa da ltar byung ba yin no //
translated: If the path of meditation is mundane, conventional knowledge arises in the present for one who is free from attachment to the seven levels and so on, as appropriate.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa zhig yin na ni rjes su shes pa bzhi zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung dang 'gog pa dang lam la rjes su shes pa rnams las gang yang rung ba zhig ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa zhig yin na ni rjes su shes pa bzhi zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung dang 'gog pa dang lam la rjes su shes pa rnams las gang yang rung ba zhig ste /
translated: If it is supramundane, it is any one of the four subsequent knowledges, that is, subsequent knowledge of the truths of suffering, origin, cessation, and path.

original: thams cad cig car mngon sum du 'gyur ba mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad cig car mngon sum du 'gyur ba mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is impossible for all of them to manifest simultaneously.

original: chos shes pa gnyis las zhes bya ba ni 'gog pa dang lam dag gi chos shes pa dag la zhes bya ba'o //üîΩsrid pa'i rtse mo'i gnyen po ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob shes pa srid pa'i rtse mo'i gnyen po med de /
analyzed: chos shes pa gnyis las zhes bya ba ni 'gog pa dang lam dag gi chos shes pa dag la zhes bya ba'o // srid pa'i rtse mo'i gnyen po ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob shes pa srid pa'i rtse mo'i gnyen po med de /
translated: From two knowledges of the truth of cessation and the truth of path.üîΩBecause it is not the antidote of the summit of existence.

original: sa gong ma'i nyer bsdogs med pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: sa gong ma'i nyer bsdogs med pa'i phyir la /
translated: Conventional knowledge is not the antidote of the summit of existence because there is no access concentration to a higher level.

original: mi g-yo ba'i sems rnam par grol ba yang srid pa'i rtse mo'i gnyen pos rab tu phye ba yin no //
analyzed: mi g-yo ba'i sems rnam par grol ba yang srid pa'i rtse mo'i gnyen pos rab tu phye ba yin no //
translated: Immovable liberation is distinguished by the antidote of the summit of existence.

original: der ni zad pa shes pa bdun pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: der ni zad pa shes pa bdun pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: In that case, the knowledge of elimination is the seventh.

original: yang ci'i phyir der zad pa shes pa kho na 'thob kyi mi skye ba shes pa yang mi 'thob ce na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir der zad pa shes pa kho na 'thob kyi mi skye ba shes pa yang mi 'thob ce na /
translated: Why is it that only the knowledge of elimination is obtained there and not the knowledge of nonarising?üîΩOne who is on the uninterrupted path is also a steadfast arhat,

original: mi g-yo ba'i chos can gyi rtogs pa'i phyir bar chad med pa'i lam la gnas pa yang ste /
analyzed: mi g-yo ba'i chos can gyi rtogs pa'i phyir bar chad med pa'i lam la gnas pa yang ste /
translated: because he realizes the immutable dharma.

original: 'di ma lus pa dus kyi rnam par grol ba nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ma lus pa dus kyi rnam par grol ba nyid do //
translated: This is the complete liberation of the time of death.

original: mi g-yo ba'i chos can gyis kyang mi skye ba shes pa 'thob po //
analyzed: mi g-yo ba'i chos can gyis kyang mi skye ba shes pa 'thob po //
translated: A steadfast arhat also obtains the knowledge of nonarising.

original: bar chad med pa'i lam la gnas pa 'di ni mi g-yo ba'i chos can ma yin pas der mi skye ba mi 'thob po //
analyzed: bar chad med pa'i lam la gnas pa 'di ni mi g-yo ba'i chos can ma yin pas der mi skye ba mi 'thob po //
translated: One who is on the uninterrupted path is not a steadfast arhat, so he does not obtain the knowledge of nonarising.

original: shes pa bdun 'thob po zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: shes pa bdun 'thob po zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One obtains seven knowledges.

original: kun rdzob dang zad pa dang shes pa mi skye shes @312b pa ma gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob dang zad pa dang shes pa mi skye shes @312b pa ma gtogs pa'o //
translated: This means that one obtains the conventional knowledge, the knowledge of elimination, and the knowledge of nonarising, but not the knowledge of other minds.

original: gal te kun rdzob shes pa mi 'thob na gzhan gyi sems shes pa ji ltar 'thob ce na /
analyzed: gal te kun rdzob shes pa mi 'thob na gzhan gyi sems shes pa ji ltar 'thob ce na /
translated: If one does not obtain the conventional knowledge, how does one obtain the knowledge of other minds?

original: gzhan gyi sems shes pa ni rnam par grol ba'i lam gyis bsdus pa dang / zag pa med pa yin pas 'thob pa'i kun rdzob shes pa srid pa'i rtse mo'i gnyen po ni /üîΩyod pa ma yin pas mi 'thob po //
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems shes pa ni rnam par grol ba'i lam gyis bsdus pa dang / zag pa med pa yin pas 'thob pa'i kun rdzob shes pa srid pa'i rtse mo'i gnyen po ni / yod pa ma yin pas mi 'thob po //
translated: Knowledge of other minds is included in the liberated path and is uncontaminated. Therefore, it is impossible to obtain conventional knowledge that is the antidote of the summit of existence.

original: re zhig rig pa ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba rjes su shes pa mngon du gyur pa na 'gog pa dang lam gyi chos shes pa gang yin pa 'thob po //
analyzed: re zhig rig pa ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba rjes su shes pa mngon du gyur pa na 'gog pa dang lam gyi chos shes pa gang yin pa 'thob po //
translated: One obtains knowledge of cessation and knowledge of the path that are Dharma knowledge of the truths of cessation and path when the subsequent knowledge of the form and formless realm levels manifests and one is free from attachment to the desire and form realms.

original: de dag kyang de'i spang ba gnyen po yin pa'i phyir rjes su shes pa ni 'dod pa'i khams kyi gnyen po ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag kyang de'i spang ba gnyen po yin pa'i phyir rjes su shes pa ni 'dod pa'i khams kyi gnyen po ma yin no //
translated: Subsequent knowledge is not the antidote of the desire realm level because those two are antidotes that abandon that level.

original: sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba chos shes pa dag gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams dag gi ma yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba chos shes pa dag gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams dag gi ma yin no //
translated: Knowledge of the truths of suffering and origin are not antidotes of the form and formless realms.

original: de dag ji ltar de'i gnyen po mngon du byed ce na /
analyzed: de dag ji ltar de'i gnyen po mngon du byed ce na /
translated: How can they manifest as antidotes of those levels?

original: ma 'ongs pa 'thob par rung ngo //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa 'thob par rung ngo //
translated: It is possible to obtain them in the future.

original: srid pa'i rtse mo la 'dod chags dang bral bas kyang kun rdzob shes pa thob pa thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: srid pa'i rtse mo la 'dod chags dang bral bas kyang kun rdzob shes pa thob pa thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Also, it follows that one who is detached from the summit of existence would obtain conventional knowledge.

original: 'di med de gnyen po de nyid ma 'ongs pa thob par khas blangs pa med do //
analyzed: 'di med de gnyen po de nyid ma 'ongs pa thob par khas blangs pa med do //
translated: This is not so, because it is not accepted that one obtains that antidote in the future.

original: de la rag las pa'i phyir ma 'ongs pa 'thob pa yin no //
analyzed: de la rag las pa'i phyir ma 'ongs pa 'thob pa yin no //
translated: It is obtained in the future because it depends on that.üîΩConventional knowledge is obtained in the future through the power of the path of seeing, because it is obtained through the power of the path of seeing.üîΩConventional knowledge is obtained in the future through the power of the path of seeing, because it is obtained through the power of the path of seeing.üîΩConventional knowledge is obtained in the future through the power of the path of seeing, because it is obtained through the power of the path of seeing.üîΩConventional knowledge is obtained in the future through the power of the path of seeing, because it is obtained through the power of the path of seeing.

original: ji ltar mthong ba'i lam la kun rdzob shes pa rnams rgyu nye bar bsags pa'i sgo nas 'dod pa'i khams las 'dod chags dang bral ba'i rjes su shes pa ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams las 'dod chags dang bral ba sdug bsngal kun 'byung la chos shesüîΩpa dag lta bu'o //
analyzed: ji ltar mthong ba'i lam la kun rdzob shes pa rnams rgyu nye bar bsags pa'i sgo nas 'dod pa'i khams las 'dod chags dang bral ba'i rjes su shes pa ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams las 'dod chags dang bral ba sdug bsngal kun 'byung la chos shes pa dag lta bu'o //
translated: Conventional knowledge is obtained in the future through the power of the path of seeing, because it is obtained through the power of the path of seeing.

analyzed: gal te 'dod pa'i khams las 'dod chags dang bral ba la rjes su shes pa mi 'thob na /

analyzed: pa'i rnam par grol ba'i lam gnyis ni zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
translated: The two liberated paths of the higher perceptions are not subsumed by the uninterrupted path.

original: mig dang rna ba'i mngon par shes pa dag ni lung du ma bstan pa yin pas de'i phyir de dag gis rnam par grol ba'i lam lung du ma bstan pa yin la /üîΩchos lung du ma bstan pa la ni ma 'ongs pa thob pa med do //
analyzed: mig dang rna ba'i mngon par shes pa dag ni lung du ma bstan pa yin pas de'i phyir de dag gis rnam par grol ba'i lam lung du ma bstan pa yin la / chos lung du ma bstan pa la ni ma 'ongs pa thob pa med do //
translated: The higher perceptions of eye and ear are neutral avyakrta, therefore the liberated paths of those are neutral.üîΩBut future states do not arise simultaneously with the obtainment of neutral states.

original: lung bstan min ni thob lhan cig skye zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lung bstan min ni thob lhan cig skye zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The Abhidharmakosa states, Neutral states arise simultaneously with obtainment.

original: so so skye bo zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni /
analyzed: so so skye bo zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni /
translated: Ordinary beings

original: 'dod pa las 'dod chags dang bral ba dang @314b bsam gtan gsum las 'dod chags dang bral ba'i rnam par grol ba'i lam tha ma rnams la kun rdzob shes pa dang / gzhan gyi sems shes pa ma 'ongs pa 'thob po //
analyzed: 'dod pa las 'dod chags dang bral ba dang @314b bsam gtan gsum las 'dod chags dang bral ba'i rnam par grol ba'i lam tha ma rnams la kun rdzob shes pa dang / gzhan gyi sems shes pa ma 'ongs pa 'thob po //
translated: Conventional knowledge and knowledge of others' minds are obtained on the last liberated paths free from attachment to the desire realm and the first three absorptions.

original: yang bsam gtan bzhi pa las 'dod chags dang bral ba'i yang ci'i phyir ma brjod ce na /
analyzed: yang bsam gtan bzhi pa las 'dod chags dang bral ba'i yang ci'i phyir ma brjod ce na /
translated: Why is it not said that they are obtained on the last liberated path free from attachment to the fourth absorption?

original: de ni nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyis bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyis bsdus pa yin no //
translated: That is subsumed by the base of infinite space.

original: gzhan gyi sems shes pa bsgom pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems shes pa bsgom pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because knowledge of others' minds is not cultivated there.

original: gang du sa bdun las rgyal 'phags pa ni gzugs med pas bsdus pa'i rnam par grol ba'i lam rnams su gzhan gyi sems shes pa bsgom par gsungs pa de zag pa med pa'i gzhan gyi sems pa'i dbang du byas te de ltar sbyor ba'i mtha'o //
analyzed: gang du sa bdun las rgyal 'phags pa ni gzugs med pas bsdus pa'i rnam par grol ba'i lam rnams su gzhan gyi sems shes pa bsgom par gsungs pa de zag pa med pa'i gzhan gyi sems pa'i dbang du byas te de ltar sbyor ba'i mtha'o //
translated: It is said that knowledge of others' minds is cultivated on the liberated paths that conquer the seven levels, but that is from the perspective of uncontaminated knowledge of others' minds.

original: mngon par shes pa gsum gyis rnam par grol ba'i lam rnams dang / tshad med pa la sogs pa'i yon tan mngon par sgrub pa rnams ni /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa gsum gyis rnam par grol ba'i lam rnams dang / tshad med pa la sogs pa'i yon tan mngon par sgrub pa rnams ni /
translated: The three higher perceptions, the liberated paths, and the qualities such as the immeasurables are established on the level of absorption.

original: sbyor ba rnams dang mngon par shes pa gsum gyis rnam par grol ba'i lam rnams dang / tshad med pa la sogs pa'i yon tan mngon par sgrub pa rnams te /
analyzed: sbyor ba rnams dang mngon par shes pa gsum gyis rnam par grol ba'i lam rnams dang / tshad med pa la sogs pa'i yon tan mngon par sgrub pa rnams te /
translated: The three higher perceptions, the liberated paths, and the qualities such as the immeasurables are established on the level of absorption.

original: bsam gtan gyi sa pa de rnams la kun rdzob shes pa ma 'ongs pa dang gzhan gyi sems pa thob po //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi sa pa de rnams la kun rdzob shes pa ma 'ongs pa dang gzhan gyi sems pa thob po //
translated: One obtains future conventional knowledge and knowledge of others' minds on those levels of absorption.

original: bsam gtan gyi sa pa dag ces bya ba ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi sa pa dag ces bya ba ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why are they called levels of absorption?

original: gzhan gyi sems shes pa nyer bsdogs kyi sa pa med par ston pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems shes pa nyer bsdogs kyi sa pa med par ston pa'o //
translated: This shows that knowledge of others' minds does not exist on the level of access concentration.

original: 'di skad bstan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan par 'gyur te /
translated: This is taught:

original: bsam gtan dang po las 'dod chags dang bral bar bya ba la gal te dang po'i sbyor ba yin na ni kun rdzob shes pa dang gzhan gyi sems shes pa 'thob po //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po las 'dod chags dang bral bar bya ba la gal te dang po'i sbyor ba yin na ni kun rdzob shes pa dang gzhan gyi sems shes pa 'thob po //
translated: If one is a beginner in order to attain freedom from attachment to the first absorption, one obtains conventional knowledge and knowledge of others' minds.

original: gal te bsam gtan gnyis pa'i nye bar bsdogs kyi sbyor ba yin na ni kun rdzob shes pa kho na 'thob po //
analyzed: gal te bsam gtan gnyis pa'i nye bar bsdogs kyi sbyor ba yin na ni kun rdzob shes pa kho na 'thob po //
translated: If it is the preparatory stage of access to the second meditation, he obtains only conventional cognition.

original: bsam gtan gsum pa las 'dod chags dang bral bar bya ba'i yul yang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan gsum pa las 'dod chags dang bral bar bya ba'i yul yang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The object of detachment from the third meditation should be understood in the same way.

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa las 'dod chags dang bral bar bya ba la gal te de nyid sbyor ba yin na ni kun rdzob dang gzhan gyi sems shes pa dag thob /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa las 'dod chags dang bral bar bya ba la gal te de nyid sbyor ba yin na ni kun rdzob dang gzhan gyi sems shes pa dag thob /
translated: If the object of detachment from the fourth meditation is the same, he obtains conventional cognition and cognition of another's thoughts.

original: gong ma'i nyer bsdogs kyi yin na ni kun rdzob shes pa kho na 'thob po //
analyzed: gong ma'i nyer bsdogs kyi yin na ni kun rdzob shes pa kho na 'thob po //
translated: If it is the access to a higher stage, he obtains only conventional cognition.

original: mngon par shes pa gsum gyis rnam par grol ba'i lam la yang shes pa gnyis kho na 'thob po //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa gsum gyis rnam par grol ba'i lam la yang shes pa gnyis kho na 'thob po //
translated: On the path of liberation of the three superknowledges, he also obtains only two cognitions.

original: mngon par shes pa gsum gang zhe na /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa gsum gang zhe na /
translated: What are the three superknowledges?

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi yul shes pa dang / @315a * //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi yul shes pa dang / @315a * //
translated: The cognition of the object of supernormal accomplishments,

original: sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa shes pa dang / sems kyi rnam pa shes pa'o //
analyzed: sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa shes pa dang / sems kyi rnam pa shes pa'o //
translated: the cognition of the recollection of past abodes, and the cognition of the thoughts of others.

original: tshad med pa la sogs pa zhes smos pa ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: tshad med pa la sogs pa zhes smos pa ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it said that immeasurable and so on are obtained?

original: rnam par thar pa dang / zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched dang / zad par gyi skye mched la sogs pa'i yon tan mngon par sgrub pa dag gis bsam gtan gyi sa pa'i sbyor ba dang rnam par grol ba'i lam gang dag yin pa de rnams la yang kun rdzob shes pa ma 'ongs pa dang gzhan gyi sems shes pa 'thob
analyzed: rnam par thar pa dang / zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched dang / zad par gyi skye mched la sogs pa'i yon tan mngon par sgrub pa dag gis bsam gtan gyi sa pa'i sbyor ba dang rnam par grol ba'i lam gang dag yin pa de rnams la yang kun rdzob shes pa ma 'ongs pa dang gzhan gyi sems shes pa 'thob
translated: The future conventional knowledge and knowledge of others' minds are obtained on the path of preparation and the liberated path of the absorptions that establish qualities such as the immeasurables, the bases of subjugation, the bases of totality and so on.

original: ste / gzhan gyi shes pa de ni bsam gtan gyi sa dngos gzhis bsdus pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ste / gzhan gyi shes pa de ni bsam gtan gyi sa dngos gzhis bsdus pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is stated because that knowledge of others' minds is subsumed by the actual basis of the absorptions.

original: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa dag ma gtogs pa zhes bya ba ni nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa bsam gtan gyi sa pa dag kyang yod mod kyi /

translated: The term except for the factors conducive to penetrative insight is stated because although there are factors conducive to penetrative insight that are levels of absorption,

original: de dag la ni gzhan gyi sems shes pa mi 'thob ste /
analyzed: de dag la ni gzhan gyi sems shes pa mi 'thob ste /
translated: knowledge of others' minds is not obtained on them.
